original: de bas na bskal ba 'grib pa'i tshe sangs rgyas 'jig rten du gshegs la bskal pa skye ba'i tshe 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'byung ngo //🔽de ltar bskal pa 'grib pa'i tshe sangs rgyas gshegs la bskal pa skye ba'i tshe 'khor @222b los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'byung na ci'i phyir rgyal po dung zhes bya ba sangs rgyas byams pa dang cig car byung la gal te rab tu ma byung na 'khor los
analyzed: de bas na bskal ba 'grib pa'i tshe sangs rgyas 'jig rten du gshegs la bskal pa skye ba'i tshe 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'byung ngo // de ltar bskal pa 'grib pa'i tshe sangs rgyas gshegs la bskal pa skye ba'i tshe 'khor @222b los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'byung na ci'i phyir rgyal po dung zhes bya ba sangs rgyas byams pa dang cig car byung la gal te rab tu ma byung na 'khor los
translated: Therefore, when the eon declines, buddhas appear in the world and when the eon improves, cakravartins appear.

original: sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi sras brgyad car gling bzhi la dbang bar 'gyur zhes gsungs /
analyzed: sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi sras brgyad car gling bzhi la dbang bar 'gyur zhes gsungs /
translated: If the eon declines and buddhas appear and the eon improves and cakravartins appear, why did the king called Sankha and Maitreya Buddha appear at the same time? If he did not go forth, he would have become a cakravartin king and the eight sons of Buddha Dipankara would have become kings of the four continents.

original: lan btab ba rgyal po dung zhes bya ba bskal ba skye ba'i tshe byung ba ni bden na tshe ring bas byams pa dang phrad par zad kyi sangs rgyas byams pa bskal pa 'grib pa'i dus ma yin par gshegs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lan btab ba rgyal po dung zhes bya ba bskal ba skye ba'i tshe byung ba ni bden na tshe ring bas byams pa dang phrad par zad kyi sangs rgyas byams pa bskal pa 'grib pa'i dus ma yin par gshegs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The king called Dung, who appeared at the time of the kalpa of formation, is true, but because he lived a long time, he met Maitreya. But Maitreya Buddha did not come at a time when the kalpa was declining.

original: sangs rgyas rab tu byung nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur zhes bstan pa yang nges par lung bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rab tu byung nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur zhes bstan pa yang nges par lung bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: The teaching that a buddha becomes a universal monarch after going forth is not a definitive pronouncement.

original: sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi sras brgyad kyang snga ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi sras brgyad kyang snga ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: The eight sons of the Buddha Dipankara are similar to the above.

original: bsod nams kyi sku yin pas de 'dra'i skyon med du nges so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi sku yin pas de 'dra'i skyon med du nges so //
translated: Since they were bodies of merit, they definitely did not have such faults.

original: gser gyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni bskal pa yar skye ba'i tshe 'jig rten du nges par 'byung gi / dngul dang zangs dang lcags kyi 'khor los sgyur pha'i rgyal po 'byung ba'i dus su ni nges pa med de /
analyzed: gser gyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni bskal pa yar skye ba'i tshe 'jig rten du nges par 'byung gi / dngul dang zangs dang lcags kyi 'khor los sgyur pha'i rgyal po 'byung ba'i dus su ni nges pa med de /
translated: A golden universal monarch definitely appears in the world at the time of the increase of the kalpa, but the time of the appearance of silver, copper and iron wheel monarchs is not definite.

original: de bas na rgyal po dharm'a aa sho ka sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya lon pa'i 'og tu 'byung ngo /🔽// / dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka'i 'grel pa /🔽bam po bzhi pa /🔽mdo las sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste zhes pa nas theg pa gsum du bshad de bstan to zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas rnyog pa lnga'i dus su ci'i phyir 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar bskal pa dang / 'khrug pa'i rnyog pa dang /
analyzed: de bas na rgyal po dharm'a aa sho ka sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya lon pa'i 'og tu 'byung ngo / // / dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka'i 'grel pa / bam po bzhi pa / mdo las sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste zhes pa nas theg pa gsum du bshad de bstan to zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas rnyog pa lnga'i dus su ci'i phyir 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar bskal pa dang / 'khrug pa'i rnyog pa dang /
translated: Therefore, King Dharmāśoka will appear one hundred years after the Buddha’s passing.🔽🔽🔽The commentary on the true Dharma by Puṇḍarīka🔽🔽🔽The passage from “Śāriputra, it is like this” up to “the three vehicles are explained and taught” is stated in order to explain why the Buddha appeared in an age of five degenerations.🔽

analyzed: dri ma mang po dang brkam pa'i sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba chung bdag la bcom ldan 'das thabs mkhas pa rnam pa gsum du ston to //🔽mu ge'i bskal pa dang mtshon gyi bskal pa dang nad kyi bskal ba byung ba'i tshe /🔽sems can 'khrug pa'i rnyog pa dang / dri ma mang zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, King Dharmāśoka will appear one hundred years after the Buddha’s parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: dri ma ni rnyog pa'am mi gtsang ba'i don mang po ni gzhig dka' ba'i don to //

original: dri ma la rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: dri ma la rnam pa drug ste /

analyzed: 'tshe ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang ; 'khrug pa dang / g-yo dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / nga rgyal dang drug go //

original: de la gang /
analyzed: de la gang /

analyzed: sems can la gnod par byed pa dga' ba ni 'tshe ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: khong khro ba'i dbang gis zhe la 'dzin pa ni khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya'o // nyes pas rkyen byas te /

original: smre sngags 'don pa ni 'khrug pa zhes @223a * //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa ni 'khrug pa zhes @223a * //

analyzed: bdag gi nyes pa 'chab cing pha rol po'i skyon rtog pa dang gzhan gyi yid dang sbyor te tshul 'chos pa ni g-yo zhes bya'o //

analyzed: bkur sti'i phyir yon tan sgyus ston pa ni brdzun zhes bya ste 'di gnyis ni 'dod chags dang gti mug gi rang bzhin no ;
translated: Pretense is the display of virtues for the sake of honor and gain. These two are by nature delusion and attachment.

original: / dar cing rgyags pa la chags par byed pa ni nga rgyal zhes bya ste 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin no //🔽sems can dag dri ma drug po mang ba'i phyir dge sbyong du mi shes /

analyzed: dge ba'i chos mi spyod pa ni sems can gyi rnyog pa'o //
translated: The turbidity of beings is the lack of practice of the wholesome dharmas, because of the multitude of the six stains in beings.

analyzed: ser sna dang 'jungs pa dang / phrag dog ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa ste /

original: chos dang zang zing bdog pa gtong mi phod pa ni ser sna zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang zang zing bdog pa gtong mi phod pa ni ser sna zhes bya'o //

analyzed: ma thob pa'i zang zing la thob par byed pa'i thabs sbyor te chags shing re ba ni brkam pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //

translated: Thus, because sentient beings have little virtue, gods and humans are

analyzed: sems can dag theg pa chen po la cig car dgod par dka' bas sangs rgyas rnams thabs mkhas pas sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig po de las theg pa gsum du bcad de bstan to //
translated: three vehicles and teach it.🔽The passage from “Śāriputra, it is like this” to “should be known as not

analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de ltar zhes pa nas sangs rgyas kyang ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pas nga rgyal gyi dbang du gyur pa la mi ston to zhes the tshom du gyur pa 'gro ba ste de dag nga
translated: even a buddha” shows that the tathāgatas do not teach those who are under🔽the power of pride.🔽How do we know that those who have doubts are under the power of pride?

analyzed: rgyal gyi dbang du gyur pa ji ltar shes she na de la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three ways.

translated: The characteristics of the noble ones of the two vehicles are taught to be unreal, the characteristics of those who are under the influence of pride are taught, and the characteristics of the true noble ones are summarized.

original: 'dir ni yang dag pa ma yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni yang dag pa ma yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Here, the unreal is taught.

analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas 'phags pa yang dag par rab tu zhi ba la zhugs pa ni /
translated: The noble ones of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas who have entered perfect peace,

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang phrad kyang phal cher theg pa chen po'i chos dang mi phrad do //
translated: even if they meet the Buddha, for the most part do not meet the Mahāyāna Dharma.

original: gang rigs ma des shing sems bskyed pa ni thos ma thag tu nyan pa dang / 'jug pa dang / khong du chud par gyur te /
analyzed: gang rigs ma des shing sems bskyed pa ni thos ma thag tu nyan pa dang / 'jug pa dang / khong du chud par gyur te /
translated: Those who have the lineage, who arouse the mind, who upon hearing it immediately listen, engage, and understand,

original: de ni 'phags pa yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa yang dag pa'o //
translated: they are the true noble ones.

original: gang de ltar mi shes pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi nye gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: gang de ltar mi shes pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi nye gnas ma yin te /
translated: Those who do not know in that way are not the Buddha's disciples.

original: 'phags pa yang dag pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa yang dag pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as unreal noble ones.

original: @223b mdo las 'di ltar sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas nga rgyal can du shes par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni nga rgyal gyi dbang du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: @223b mdo las 'di ltar sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas nga rgyal can du shes par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni nga rgyal gyi dbang du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The sutra from “Shariputra, those who…” up to “…should be known as arrogant” teaches the characteristics of those who are under the power of pride.

original: ma rabs bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa 'bras bu gsum gyi nyon mongs pa ma zad pa dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu phung po nang gi tha ma mya ngan las 'da' ba thob snyam ste /
analyzed: ma rabs bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa 'bras bu gsum gyi nyon mongs pa ma zad pa dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu phung po nang gi tha ma mya ngan las 'da' ba thob snyam ste /
translated: Those of low character who attain the fourth absorption but do not eliminate the afflictions of the three results think they will attain nirvana, the final aggregates of an arhat.

original: sangs rgyas mi 'dod pa ni nga rgyal can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi 'dod pa ni nga rgyal can zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who do not seek buddhahood are called arrogant.

original: mdo las de ci'i phyir zhes pa nas gnas ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni yang dag pa'i 'phags pa bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las de ci'i phyir zhes pa nas gnas ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni yang dag pa'i 'phags pa bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The sutra from “Why is that?” up to “it is not possible” teaches the characteristics of those who are included in the true aryas.

original: 'phags pa yang dag pa dang phrad pa rab tu zhi ba la zhugs pa na phal cher chos dang phrad do de dag spyod mi nus kyang dad cing yid ches par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa yang dag pa dang phrad pa rab tu zhi ba la zhugs pa na phal cher chos dang phrad do de dag spyod mi nus kyang dad cing yid ches par byed do //
translated: When the aryas who have encountered the true path enter into peace, they mostly encounter the Dharma. Even if they are unable to practice it, they have faith and confidence.

original: gang rigs ma nges pa ni thos nas kyang 'jug cing spyod par byed de de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dang mngon sum du gyur te chos 'di thos nas dad par mi 'gyur ba'i skabs med de gnas ma yin no zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang rigs ma nges pa ni thos nas kyang 'jug cing spyod par byed de de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dang mngon sum du gyur te chos 'di thos nas dad par mi 'gyur ba'i skabs med de gnas ma yin no zhes smos so //
translated: The indeterminate type, having heard it, will engage in and practice it. Therefore, it is said that there is no opportunity, no occasion, for them not to have faith in this Dharma when they hear it in the presence of the Tathagata.

original: mdo las de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma gtogs so zhes pa ni skabs 'dir ji ltar chos kyi snod du 'gyur zhes ba'i the tshom bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma gtogs so zhes pa ni skabs 'dir ji ltar chos kyi snod du 'gyur zhes ba'i the tshom bstan pa ste /
translated: The sutra says, except for those who have entered the nirvana of the tathagatas, which shows the doubt in this context, how can they become vessels of the Dharma?

original: la la ni sangs rgyas las chos thos nas skur ba'i sems skye ste /
analyzed: la la ni sangs rgyas las chos thos nas skur ba'i sems skye ste /
translated: Some, having heard the Dharma from the Buddha, give rise to the thought of disparaging it.

original: ci'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pas kha cig la sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur pa dang chos kyi snod du mi 'gyur ba zhes bstan pa the tshom skyes te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pas kha cig la sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur pa dang chos kyi snod du mi 'gyur ba zhes bstan pa the tshom skyes te /
translated: Why? Because the Tathagata has taught that some will not become buddhas and will not become vessels of the Dharma, giving rise to doubt.

original: de ltar snod du ma gyur pa'i sems can la chos ston pa mi mdzad na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya bar rung ngam zhes pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma gtogs so zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ltar snod du ma gyur pa'i sems can la chos ston pa mi mdzad na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya bar rung ngam zhes pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma gtogs so zhes smos so //
translated: In order to dispel this doubt, the text says, “Except for the Tathāgata’s nirvāṇa.”

original: mdo las de ci'i phyir zhes pa nas mi 'byung zhes pa'i bar du ni mya ngan las 'das nas thabs mi mkhas pa rab tu zhi ba la zhugs pa chos 'di dang phrad kyang mdo sde 'di lta bu 'dzin pa'am 'chad pa mi 'byung ngo zhes smos so
analyzed: mdo las de ci'i phyir zhes pa nas mi 'byung zhes pa'i bar du ni mya ngan las 'das nas thabs mi mkhas pa rab tu zhi ba la zhugs pa chos 'di dang phrad kyang mdo sde 'di lta bu 'dzin pa'am 'chad pa mi 'byung ngo zhes smos so
translated: In the sūtra, from “Why is that?” up to “does not occur” means that after nirvāṇa, even though one who has entered into peace without skillful means encounters this Dharma, this kind of sūtra is not held or explained.

original: // mdo las sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas the tshom med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni gang chos dang phrad pa ni nga mya ngan las 'das kyang sangs rgyas gzhan dang phrad de thabs mkhas pas bstan na chos 'di la the tshom med par 'gyur ro
analyzed: // mdo las sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas the tshom med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni gang chos dang phrad pa ni nga mya ngan las 'das kyang sangs rgyas gzhan dang phrad de thabs mkhas pas bstan na chos 'di la the tshom med par 'gyur ro
translated: In the sūtra, from “Śāriputra” up to “will be without doubt” means that even though I have entered nirvāṇa, one who encounters the Dharma encounters another buddha, and if taught with skillful means, one will be without doubt in this Dharma.

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni sngar theg pa gsum bstan pa @224a * //
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni sngar theg pa gsum bstan pa @224a * //
translated: The passage from “Śāriputra” up to “the vehicle of the buddhas” in the sutra resolves the doubt that the teaching of one vehicle contradicts the previous teaching of three vehicles.🔽The sutra says:

original: las ; da theg pa gcig bstan zhes pa'i the tshom bcad pa ste /
analyzed: las ; da theg pa gcig bstan zhes pa'i the tshom bcad pa ste /
translated: Śāriputra, the buddhas, the tathāgatas, teach the doctrine by using various methods, various expressions, and various parables, all of which are for the sake of the single buddha vehicle.🔽The earlier teaching and the later teaching are not contradictory.🔽I alone know it, you do not know it, so have faith in it, have confidence in it, and you who have generated the aspiration to enlightenment should understand it.🔽Arhats, you should have faith in it, you should have confidence in it, you should not doubt it.🔽I alone know it, you do not know it, so have faith in it, have confidence in it, and you who have generated the aspiration to enlightenment should understand it.

original: sngar bstan pa dang phyis gsungs pa mi mthun yang brdzun du mi 'gyur ba ni nga 'ba' zhig gis mkhyen gyi khyed mi shes pas dad par gyis shig / yid ches par gyis shig / khyed thog ma sems bskyed pas rtogs par gyis shig / dgra bcom pa'i
analyzed: sngar bstan pa dang phyis gsungs pa mi mthun yang brdzun du mi 'gyur ba ni nga 'ba' zhig gis mkhyen gyi khyed mi shes pas dad par gyis shig / yid ches par gyis shig / khyed thog ma sems bskyed pas rtogs par gyis shig / dgra bcom pa'i

analyzed: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni chos sna tshogs bstan pa ste /

analyzed: tshigs bcad 'dis ni dbang po ji bzhin du rgyu sna tshogs bstan pa'o // mdo las / de yi bsam pa spyod pa ji 'dra mkhyen //

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //

analyzed: ci nas sems can thams cad mgu bar byas //
translated: “In order to satisfy all sentient beings,

analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni gdon mi za ba'i tshig dang rgyu dang dpe rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa'o //

analyzed: khong du chud pa ni byang chub rtogs pa'o //

original: dad pa sna tshogs ni mos pa'i mchog ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dad pa sna tshogs ni mos pa'i mchog ces bya ba'i don to //

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las so //
