analyzed: de ltar bsam pa dang dpyod pa dang dad pa sna tshogs mkhyen pas gdon mi za ba'i tshig dang rgyu dang dpe mang po bstan pas thams cad mgu bar gyur to // mdo las de bzhin mdo sde zhes pa nas gtan @225a * //
translated: Thus, through knowing the various intentions, analyses, and faiths, he taught many incontrovertible words, causes, and examples, and everyone was satisfied.

original: la phab kyang de bzhin bshad cas pa'i bar du ni skabs 'dir mdo sde bcu gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: la phab kyang de bzhin bshad cas pa'i bar du ni skabs 'dir mdo sde bcu gnyis bstan te /
translated: The sutra from “Thus, the sutra” up to “thus explained” teaches the twelve types of sutra in this context.

original: de la yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: They are also of three types.

original: mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / ming bstan pa dang / khyad par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / ming bstan pa dang / khyad par bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the characteristics, the teaching of the names, and the teaching of the distinctions.

original: mdo sde'i mtshan nyid la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdo sde'i mtshan nyid la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristics of the sutra are also of two types.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The general characteristics and the specific characteristics.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa nas mngon par dga'o zhes pa'i bar du ni tshig gi don gang brjod pa de dag thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa nas mngon par dga'o zhes pa'i bar du ni tshig gi don gang brjod pa de dag thams cad ni spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The general characteristic is that which is expressed by all the words from “Thus have I heard” up to “was greatly pleased.”

original: 'grel pa dag las mdo sde'i tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa ma gtogs par tshig rkyang pa las tshig gi don mtshon te brjod pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa dag las mdo sde'i tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa ma gtogs par tshig rkyang pa las tshig gi don mtshon te brjod pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The particular characteristic is that which is expressed by the words of the sutra, except for the verses, and by the prose commentary.

original: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽phyis 'ongs pa la phan gdags pa dang rkyang pa las don ma nges pa nges par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te / phyis 'ongs pa la phan gdags pa dang rkyang pa las don ma nges pa nges par bstan pa'o //
translated: The metrical composition is also of two kinds:🔽that which benefits those who come later, and that which teaches the definite meaning from the indefinite meaning of the prose.

original: 'grel pa dag las mdo sde la la snga phyi mi mthun te rkyang pa las smos pa'i 'og tu tshigs su bcad de bzlas pa ni phyis 'ongs pa la phan pa'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa dag las mdo sde la la snga phyi mi mthun te rkyang pa las smos pa'i 'og tu tshigs su bcad de bzlas pa ni phyis 'ongs pa la phan pa'o //
translated: The commentary is that which explains the sutra, which sometimes is not in the same order as the prose, and which repeats the prose in verse for the benefit of those who come later.

original: rkyang pa las don ma nges pa dag tshigs su bcad de bzlas pas don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir don ma nges pa nges par bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyang pa las don ma nges pa dag tshigs su bcad de bzlas pas don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir don ma nges pa nges par bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the uncertain meaning is so called because it clarifies the meaning by repeating in verse the uncertain meaning of the prose.

original: lung bstan pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lung bstan pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of predictions:

original: nye gnas kyi skye shi'i rgyu dang 'bras bu lung bstan pa dang / nges pa'i don la gsal bar lung bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: nye gnas kyi skye shi'i rgyu dang 'bras bu lung bstan pa dang / nges pa'i don la gsal bar lung bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa dang gsum mo //
translated: the prediction of the cause and effect of birth and death of the disciples, the clear prediction of the definitive meaning, and the prediction of the bodhisattva as a buddha.

original: 'phags pa'i nye gnas dag la khyod 'das pa'i dus legs pa dang nyes pa 'di lta bu zhig byas te skye ba'i gnas kyi khyad par lung bstan pa ni skye shing rgyu dang 'bras bu lung bstan pa'o //🔽mdo sde ma nges pa nges pa'i don du lung bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nye gnas dag la khyod 'das pa'i dus legs pa dang nyes pa 'di lta bu zhig byas te skye ba'i gnas kyi khyad par lung bstan pa ni skye shing rgyu dang 'bras bu lung bstan pa'o // mdo sde ma nges pa nges pa'i don du lung bstan pa ni /
translated: The prediction of the cause and effect of birth and death is the prediction of the specific place of birth of the disciples, saying, In the past you did such and such good and bad actions.

original: nges pa'i don zab mor lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don zab mor lung bstan pa'o //
translated: The prediction of the definitive meaning is the prediction of the definitive meaning of the uncertain sūtras.🔽The prediction of the profound definitive meaning is the prediction of the bodhisattva as a buddha.

original: ma pham pa khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus rgyal po dung zhes bya ba de'i tshe byams pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa ni sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma pham pa khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus rgyal po dung zhes bya ba de'i tshe byams pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa ni sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa'o //
translated: The prediction of Maitreya, In the future, Ajita, you will become a Buddha named Maitreya is a prediction of Buddhahood.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni mdo sde dag la tshig rkyang pa las mi smos par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi 'am lnga'am drug la sogs pa don gang brjod pa tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i sde zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni mdo sde dag la tshig rkyang pa las mi smos par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi 'am lnga'am drug la sogs pa don gang brjod pa tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i sde zhes bya'o //
translated: The verse-form is a discourse in which two, three, four, five, or six verses, etc., are spoken in verse, without prose, on a certain topic. It is called the verse-form.

original: ched du brjod pa ni @225b mdo sde las gsol ba ma btab par yang dag pa'i chos dang bstan pa dang yun du gnas par bya ba'i phyir gsol ba gdab mi dgos par gsungs pa ni ched du brjod pa'i sde zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa ni @225b mdo sde las gsol ba ma btab par yang dag pa'i chos dang bstan pa dang yun du gnas par bya ba'i phyir gsol ba gdab mi dgos par gsungs pa ni ched du brjod pa'i sde zhes bya'o //
translated: The proclamation is a discourse in which, without being requested, the Buddha proclaims the true Dharma and the teaching for the sake of its long duration. It is called the proclamation.

original: gleng gzhi la yang rnam pa gsum ste gsol ba btab nas bstan pa dang nyams pa las tshul khrims bcas pa bstan pa dang / gleng ba yod pas chos bstan pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: gleng gzhi la yang rnam pa gsum ste gsol ba btab nas bstan pa dang nyams pa las tshul khrims bcas pa bstan pa dang / gleng ba yod pas chos bstan pa dang gsum mo //
translated: There are three kinds of nidana: those that are taught at the request of others, those that are taught in order to establish morality when it has declined, and those that are taught because of a dispute.

original: 'grel pa dag las glengs nas bstan pa ni gsol ba btab nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa dag las glengs nas bstan pa ni gsol ba btab nas bshad pa'o //
translated: In the commentaries, nidana means that which is taught at the request of others.

original: bslab tshig bcas pa ni bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bslab tshig bcas pa ni bcas pa'o //
translated: Sutra means that which is taught in order to establish morality when it has declined.

original: mdo sde dag las pha rol bos glengs te dper na mnyan du yod pa na mi zhig gis bya zhig bzung nas phyir yang btang ba las glengs te bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon gyi rgyu yang glengs nas bstan pa ni glengs nas bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde dag las pha rol bos glengs te dper na mnyan du yod pa na mi zhig gis bya zhig bzung nas phyir yang btang ba las glengs te bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon gyi rgyu yang glengs nas bstan pa ni glengs nas bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Sutra means that which is taught because of a dispute, such as when a man in Shravasti caught a bird, released it, and then disputed with the Bhagavan about it. The Bhagavan taught the past cause of the bird and it is called a sutra because it was taught due to a dispute.

original: dpe ni mdo sde dag las dpe rnam pa mang pos chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dpe ni mdo sde dag las dpe rnam pa mang pos chos bstan pa'o //
translated: Daka means that which teaches the Dharma through many kinds of examples in the sutras.

original: da ltar 'das pa'i sde ni skyes pa'i rabs ma gtogs par sngon 'das pa'i gang zag dang chos kyi rgyus bstan pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar 'das pa'i sde ni skyes pa'i rabs ma gtogs par sngon 'das pa'i gang zag dang chos kyi rgyus bstan pa'o //
translated: Itivrttaka means that which teaches the causes of past persons and phenomena, except for the Jataka.

original: skyes pa'i rabs kyi de ni bcom ldan 'das sngon 'das pa'i dus na che ge mo zhig na skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dka' ba spyod pa dang / mdo sde dag la 'das pa'i dus na sha ba dang dred mo dang /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs kyi de ni bcom ldan 'das sngon 'das pa'i dus na che ge mo zhig na skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dka' ba spyod pa dang / mdo sde dag la 'das pa'i dus na sha ba dang dred mo dang /
translated: The Jataka Tales are the stories of the Bhagavat's former births, deaths, transmigrations, and the difficult practices of the bodhisattva path.

original: ri bong dang bya nam mkha' lding la sogs pa'i lus byas pa bstan pa ni skyes pa'i rabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ri bong dang bya nam mkha' lding la sogs pa'i lus byas pa bstan pa ni skyes pa'i rabs zhes bya'o //
translated: The Avadanas are the stories of the Buddha's past lives as a deer, a bear, a rabbit, a garuḍa, and so on, which are taught in the sutras.

original: shin tu rgyas pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Vaipulya has two types:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la ston pa dang / rgya che la dus yun ring ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la ston pa dang / rgya che la dus yun ring ba'o //
translated: the teachings on the bodhisattva path and the vast and long duration.

original: nyan thos la'ang shin tu rgyas pa yod de /
analyzed: nyan thos la'ang shin tu rgyas pa yod de /
translated: The Vaipulya also exists for the śrāvakas,

original: 'dir ni gnyi ga la shin tu rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnyi ga la shin tu rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: but here it is called Vaipulya for both.

original: rmad du byung ba ni mdo sde dag las sangs rgyas dang nye gnas 'phags pa 'khor brgyad kyi yon tan thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa ya mtshan ngo mtshar du gyur pa bstan pa ni rmad du byung ba zhes bya'o //🔽gzhan yang mdo sde las sangs rgyas btsas ma thag tu gom pa bdun bdun gshegs pa dang / 'od zer chen pos phyogs bcu snang bar byas pa dang / spre'us sbrang rtsi phul ba dang / khyi dkar pos chos nyan pa la sogs te /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni mdo sde dag las sangs rgyas dang nye gnas 'phags pa 'khor brgyad kyi yon tan thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa ya mtshan ngo mtshar du gyur pa bstan pa ni rmad du byung ba zhes bya'o // gzhan yang mdo sde las sangs rgyas btsas ma thag tu gom pa bdun bdun gshegs pa dang / 'od zer chen pos phyogs bcu snang bar byas pa dang / spre'us sbrang rtsi phul ba dang / khyi dkar pos chos nyan pa la sogs te /
translated: The wondrous refers to the teachings in the sutras of the common and uncommon qualities of the Buddha and his noble disciples, the eight assemblies, which are wondrous and amazing.

original: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos rnams ni rmad du byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos rnams ni rmad du byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the sutras teach the wondrous as the wondrous and amazing phenomena, such as the Buddha taking seven steps immediately after birth, his great light illuminating the ten directions, the offering of honey by a monkey, a white dog listening to the Dharma, and so on.

original: gtan la phab par bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gtan la phab par bstan pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The established teachings are of two kinds:

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyis bstan pa dang / 'phags pa nye gnas kyis bstan @226a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyis bstan pa dang / 'phags pa nye gnas kyis bstan @226a * //
translated: the teachings given by the Buddha himself and the teachings given by his noble disciples.

original: pa'o ; /'grel pa dag las mdo sde gang ltag 'og gtan la phab pa ni gtan la phab par bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; /'grel pa dag las mdo sde gang ltag 'og gtan la phab pa ni gtan la phab par bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The treatises that determine the order of the sutras are called the teaching of determination.

original: gang mdo sde nges par bstan pa la yang gtan la phab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang mdo sde nges par bstan pa la yang gtan la phab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The sutras that are determined are also called the teaching of determination.

original: de la ming bstan pa ni mdo sde bcu gnyis kyi ming bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming bstan pa ni mdo sde bcu gnyis kyi ming bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of names is the teaching of the names of the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: de la khyad par la yang rnam pa gnyis te rang bzhin gyi khyad par dang / bstan pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de la khyad par la yang rnam pa gnyis te rang bzhin gyi khyad par dang / bstan pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The teaching of distinctions is of two kinds: the distinction of natures and the distinction of teachings.

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i nang na tshigs su bcad pa med la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i nang na tshigs su bcad pa med la /
translated: The distinction of natures is that among the melodious expressions, there are no verses,

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i nang na dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa med de snga phyi dang / rkyang pa dang bzlas pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i nang na dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa med de snga phyi dang / rkyang pa dang bzlas pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and among the verses, there are no melodious expressions, because they are distinct in terms of sequence, single and repeated.

original: mdo sde dag las thog ma 'di skad bdag gis thos pa nas tha ma rjes su spyad pa'i bar du mdo sde zhes smos pas sde bcu gnyis kyang bsdus te /
analyzed: mdo sde dag las thog ma 'di skad bdag gis thos pa nas tha ma rjes su spyad pa'i bar du mdo sde zhes smos pas sde bcu gnyis kyang bsdus te /
translated: The twelve branches are included in the sutras, because the sutras are mentioned from the beginning, “Thus have I heard,” to the end, “practice accordingly.”

original: mdo sde ni tshig rkyang pa 'ba' zhig la bya bas dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang tshigs su bcad pa ma gtogs par sde bdun po kun la bcu gnyis tshang bar yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde ni tshig rkyang pa 'ba' zhig la bya bas dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang tshigs su bcad pa ma gtogs par sde bdun po kun la bcu gnyis tshang bar yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since the sutra collection is only individual words, it is understood that all seven collections except for the metrical and prose narrations have the twelve.

original: bstan pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la tshang bar yong la theg pa chung ngu la dgu las med de /
analyzed: bstan pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la tshang bar yong la theg pa chung ngu la dgu las med de /
translated: The special teachings are complete in the Mahayana, but there are only nine in the Hinayana.

original: 'di'i skabs su theg pa chung ngu smos pas lung bstan pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang shin tu rgyas pa dang gsum ma smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su theg pa chung ngu smos pas lung bstan pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang shin tu rgyas pa dang gsum ma smos te /
translated: Since the Hinayana is mentioned in this context, the three of prediction, declaration and extensive teachings are not mentioned.

original: 'di ni khyad par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the special.🔽The sutra states:🔽Those who are unskilled and attached to evil🔽up to:🔽Nirvana is taught to them.

original: mdo las mi mkhas ngan la chags par gang gyur zhes pa nas de las mya ngan 'das pa nye bar bstan zhes pa'i bar du tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las mi mkhas ngan la chags par gang gyur zhes pa nas de las mya ngan 'das pa nye bar bstan zhes pa'i bar du tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
translated: These one and a half lines teach that it is difficult to realize the scriptures according to one's intellectual capacity.

original: 'di la rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di la rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: This has five aspects.

original: dbang po rtul bas go dka' ba dang chung ngu la mos shing chen pos skrag pa dang 'khor ba la chags shing 'jig rten las 'das pa la ma dad pa dang / skal ba yod kyang mi spyod pa dang / sdug bsngal mang pos mngon du gzir ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po rtul bas go dka' ba dang chung ngu la mos shing chen pos skrag pa dang 'khor ba la chags shing 'jig rten las 'das pa la ma dad pa dang / skal ba yod kyang mi spyod pa dang / sdug bsngal mang pos mngon du gzir ba ste /
translated: It is difficult for those of dull faculties to understand, they are interested in the small, they are frightened by the great, they are attached to samsara and have no faith in the supramundane, they do not practice even though they have good fortune, and they are oppressed by many sufferings.

original: de dag la mya ngan las 'das pa nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mya ngan las 'das pa nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is taught to them.

original: dbang po rtul zhing mi mkhas la ngan te 'khor ba la chags pas sangs rgyas rnams dang phrad kyang theg pa chen po'i chos zab mo mi spyod de sdig pa mi dge ba spyod pas sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po rtul zhing mi mkhas la ngan te 'khor ba la chags pas sangs rgyas rnams dang phrad kyang theg pa chen po'i chos zab mo mi spyod de sdig pa mi dge ba spyod pas sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those of dull faculties, unskilled, bad, attached to samsara, even though they meet the buddhas, do not practice the profound Dharma of the Great Vehicle. By engaging in negative actions, they experience suffering.

original: sdug bsngal thar bar bya ba'i phyir theg pa gnyis kyi mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thar bar bya ba'i phyir theg pa gnyis kyi mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
translated: Nirvana of the two vehicles is taught for the purpose of liberating them from suffering.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / de ltar rang byung ba ni thabs mdzad pa //
analyzed: mdo las / de ltar rang byung ba ni thabs mdzad pa //
translated: Thus the self-arisen one acts with skillful means.

original: zhes pa nas khyed cag sangs rgyas su yang 'grub po zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshig phyed @226b dang brgyad kyis gnas par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa nas khyed cag sangs rgyas su yang 'grub po zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshig phyed @226b dang brgyad kyis gnas par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: From you will also achieve Buddhahood up to here, in eight and a half lines, it shows the abiding to be done.

original: de la tshig gcig ni spyir bstan to //
analyzed: de la tshig gcig ni spyir bstan to //
translated: Among them, one line is the general indication.

original: tshig gcig ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig ni bshad pa'o //
translated: One line is the explanation.

original: tshig bzhis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: tshig bzhis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Four lines are the summary.

original: tshig gcig ni gnas par bskul ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig ni gnas par bskul ba'o //
translated: One line is the exhortation to abide.

original: 'di ni spyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni spyir bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the general indication.

original: gnyis thabs tsam du bstan nas mthar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes theg pa gcig la 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis thabs tsam du bstan nas mthar sangs rgyas kyi ye shes theg pa gcig la 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
translated: After indicating two methods, in the end it shows the entry into the single vehicle of the Buddha's wisdom.

original: mdo las ci'i phyir zhe na skyob pa dus la sdod ces pa nas yang dag gdon mi za ba bshad do zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dir spyir bstan pa las dmigs te /
analyzed: mdo las ci'i phyir zhe na skyob pa dus la sdod ces pa nas yang dag gdon mi za ba bshad do zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dir spyir bstan pa las dmigs te /
translated: From Why is it so? Because the Protector waits for the time up to I will explain it correctly and without doubt, it is a specific indication from the general indication here.

original: sngon khyod kyi dbang po ma smin pas theg pa chen po mi rtogs te bstan pa'i snod du ma gyur to //
analyzed: sngon khyod kyi dbang po ma smin pas theg pa chen po mi rtogs te bstan pa'i snod du ma gyur to //
translated: Previously, because your faculties were not ripe, you did not realize the Great Vehicle and were not a vessel for the teachings.

original: da ni dbang po smin pas dus la bab ste gdon mi za ba'i don bshad do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: da ni dbang po smin pas dus la bab ste gdon mi za ba'i don bshad do zhes bstan to //
translated: Now, since the faculties have ripened, the time has come. Without doubt, the meaning will be explained.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / nga yis bstan pa sde dgu de rnams kyang //
analyzed: mdo las / nga yis bstan pa sde dgu de rnams kyang //
translated: Those nine divisions of my teachings

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //

original: rab tu gzhug pa'i phyir ni ngas bshad do //
analyzed: rab tu gzhug pa'i phyir ni ngas bshad do //
translated: ...I have explained in order to introduce them.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshig phyed dang ldas bsdus pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshig phyed dang ldas bsdus pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to here, the teaching is summarized in one and a half lines.

original: de la yang gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: de la yang gsum du dbye'o //
translated: That is also divided into three.

original: tshig gcig gis ni chos chung ngu yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni chos chung ngu yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: One line teaches that the lesser Dharma is not true,

original: chen po ni yang dag pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni yang dag pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and the greater is true.

original: tshig gcig gis ni chos chen po dam par bstan te skyes bu dam pa la bshad pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni chos chen po dam par bstan te skyes bu dam pa la bshad pa bstan pa'o //
translated: One line teaches the excellent great Dharma, explaining it to excellent beings.

original: tshig gnyis kyis ni chos dang gang zag bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyis ni chos dang gang zag bstan pa ste /
translated: Two lines teach the Dharma and the person.

original: 'di ni thog ma sems bskyed pa'i mthu stobs ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa sde dgu bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ni thog ma sems bskyed pa'i mthu stobs ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa sde dgu bshad de /
translated: This explains the nine divisions of the teachings according to the power of the first generation of the mind.

original: mthar phyin pa ma yin pas chen po la rab tu gzhug go zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ma yin pas chen po la rab tu gzhug go zhes bstan to //
translated: Since it is not ultimate, it is explained as introducing to the great.

original: mdo las / 'di ltar rtag tu rnam par dag 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mdo las / 'di ltar rtag tu rnam par dag 'gyur ba //
translated: A sutra states:

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: Thus, one always becomes pure.

original: de la shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde bshad //
analyzed: de la shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde bshad //
translated: The extensive sutras are explained there.

original: ces pa'i bar du ni skabs 'dir chos chen po dam pa skyes bu dam pa la bshad pa bstan te /
analyzed: ces pa'i bar du ni skabs 'dir chos chen po dam pa skyes bu dam pa la bshad pa bstan te /
translated: From here up to the above passage, the teaching of the holy Dharma to holy beings is explained.

original: mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyod pa thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i chos spyod pa thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, all bodhisattva practices are called the deeds of a buddha's son.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras kyang yon tan lnga dang ldan ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras kyang yon tan lnga dang ldan ba'o //
translated: A buddha's son also possesses five qualities.

original: lnga gang zhe na bsam pa rnam par dag pa ste theg pa chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'ba' zhig tshol ba dang / mnyan nges pa ste nges pa'i sems kyis theg pa chen po la brtson pa dang dbang po rno ba ste sdug bsngal las 'don cing bde ba byin pa dang /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na bsam pa rnam par dag pa ste theg pa chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'ba' zhig tshol ba dang / mnyan nges pa ste nges pa'i sems kyis theg pa chen po la brtson pa dang dbang po rno ba ste sdug bsngal las 'don cing bde ba byin pa dang /
translated: What are the five? Pure intention, seeking only the gnosis of buddhahood of the Great Vehicle, certainty, striving in the Great Vehicle with a definite mind, sharp faculties, delivering from suffering and bestowing happiness,

original: tshad med pa ste sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / shin tu zab mo spyod pa ste bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la nan tan @227a * //🔽byed pa'o ; / de yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa ste sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / shin tu zab mo spyod pa ste bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la nan tan @227a * // byed pa'o ; / de yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: (1) serving many buddhas, (2) very profound practice, i.e. assiduousness in the collections of merit and knowledge, and (3) generating the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: chos bcu po 'di dang ldan na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //🔽gang zhe na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bya ba byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba spyod pa dang / chos mchog tshol ba dang / sems ma nyen zhing nges pa dang / sdug bsngal la bzod pa dang /
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di dang ldan na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o // gang zhe na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bya ba byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba spyod pa dang / chos mchog tshol ba dang / sems ma nyen zhing nges pa dang / sdug bsngal la bzod pa dang /
translated: One who has these ten dharmas is said to have generated the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: snying rje shas che ba dang / bsam pa dag pas snyoms pa dang / theg pa chen po la mos pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes tshol ba dang bcu ste /
analyzed: snying rje shas che ba dang / bsam pa dag pas snyoms pa dang / theg pa chen po la mos pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes tshol ba dang bcu ste /
translated: What are they? (1) Serving the spiritual friend, (2) serving many buddhas, (3) practicing the roots of virtue, (4) seeking the supreme Dharma, (5) having an uncorrupted, certain mind, (6) being patient with suffering, (7) having great compassion, (8) being even-minded through purity of intention, (9) being devoted to the Great Vehicle, and (10) seeking the Buddha’s knowledge.

original: yon tan 'di dag dang ldan na sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ste theg pa chen po ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag dang ldan na sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ste theg pa chen po ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has these qualities, one is called a child of the Buddha and will teach the Great Vehicle.🔽A sutra states:🔽Thus, their thoughts are fulfilled,

original: mdo las / 'di ltar de dag bsam pa rdzogs pa dang // zhes pa nas //
analyzed: mdo las / 'di ltar de dag bsam pa rdzogs pa dang // zhes pa nas //
translated: and so on up to:

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde rab tu bshad //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde rab tu bshad //
translated: They explain the extensive sutras.

original: ces pa'i bar du ni yon tan lnga dang ldan pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces pa'i bar du ni yon tan lnga dang ldan pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This passage indicates that a person who has five qualities will become enlightened in the future.

original: de yang sangs rgyas dran pa'i bsam pa rdzogs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas dran pa'i bsam pa rdzogs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They are: fulfilling the thought of remembering the Buddha and possessing pure ethics.

original: sangs rgyas dran pa la rnam pa gnyis te sems kyis dran pa dang tshig gis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dran pa la rnam pa gnyis te sems kyis dran pa dang tshig gis brjod pa'o //
translated: Remembering the Buddha has two aspects: remembering with the mind and expressing it verbally.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa bslab pa gsum rdzogs pa la lung ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa bslab pa gsum rdzogs pa la lung ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Possessing ethics means completing the three trainings.

original: de dag thos nas shin tu dga' bar 'gyur zhes smos so //
analyzed: de dag thos nas shin tu dga' bar 'gyur zhes smos so //
translated: Having heard these, they will be extremely delighted.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / 'di ltar 'dren pa'i nyan thos de dag las //
analyzed: mdo las / 'di ltar 'dren pa'i nyan thos de dag las //
translated: Thus, among the hearers of the Guide,

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: and so on up to:

original: thams cad byang chub 'gyur bar the tsom med //
analyzed: thams cad byang chub 'gyur bar the tsom med //
translated: all will attain enlightenment, of this there is no doubt.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni dad pa skyed par bskul ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni dad pa skyed par bskul ba ste /
translated: Up to here is the exhortation to generate faith.

original: chos 'di thos sam gzung yang rung theg pa chen po la gnas par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di thos sam gzung yang rung theg pa chen po la gnas par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: It shows that by hearing or upholding this Dharma, one will abide in the Great Vehicle.

original: mdo las / theg pa gcig ste gnyis su med ;
analyzed: mdo las / theg pa gcig ste gnyis su med ;
translated: In the sutra, it says: There is one vehicle, not two...

original: / ces pa nas //
analyzed: / ces pa nas //
translated: Up to:

original: theg pa sna tshogs mngon par bstan //
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs mngon par bstan //
translated: Various vehicles are taught.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni tshig phyed dang gnyis po 'dis gnyis su med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni tshig phyed dang gnyis po 'dis gnyis su med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: In these one and a half lines, non-duality is taught.

original: gnyis su med pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa med ces pa'i don to //
translated: Non-duality means there is no Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: gsum du med pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gsum du med pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa med pa ste /
translated: Non-triality means there is no Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: sangs rgyas kyis thabs su gsungs pa ma gtogs par theg pa chen po las gnyis dang gsum du med ces bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis thabs su gsungs pa ma gtogs par theg pa chen po las gnyis dang gsum du med ces bstan to //
translated: Except for what the Buddha taught as a skillful means, it shows that apart from the Great Vehicle, there are no two or three vehicles.

original: mdo las / sangs rgyas ye shes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mdo las / sangs rgyas ye shes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In the sutra, it says: In order to show the wisdom of the Buddha...

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: Up to:

original: theg pa chung ngus mi 'dren sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: theg pa chung ngus mi 'dren sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: Not led by the Lesser Vehicle, the Buddha's...

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshigs bcad byed dang bcu dgus don gang la gnas par bya @227b ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshigs bcad byed dang bcu dgus don gang la gnas par bya @227b ba bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to this point, in nineteen verses, it has been shown where one should stand in order to bring about the aims.

original: de la tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni bya ba chen po gcig bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni bya ba chen po gcig bstan pa'o //
translated: In the first half-verse, one great action is shown.

original: tshig bcu bdun gyis ni 'dzud pa dang ston pa dang / 'jug pa dang chud par byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig bcu bdun gyis ni 'dzud pa dang ston pa dang / 'jug pa dang chud par byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: In seventeen verses, the bringing about, the teaching, the entering, and the being brought about are shown.

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba ni bya ba gcig gi phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba ni bya ba gcig gi phyir te /
translated: The arising of a Buddha in the world is for one action only.

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig ste gnyis su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig ste gnyis su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is one vehicle, the Buddha-vehicle, and there is no second.🔽In a Sutra it is said:

original: mdo las / rang byung bdag nyid gcig la gnas pa dang // zhes pa nas //
analyzed: mdo las / rang byung bdag nyid gcig la gnas pa dang // zhes pa nas //
translated: The one who abides in the one self-arisen🔽.

original: de dag la yang sems can so sor 'jog //
analyzed: de dag la yang sems can so sor 'jog //
translated: And in them, the sentient beings are individually placed.

original: ces pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad bcu bdun gyis 'dzud pa dang ston pa dang / 'jug pa dang chud par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad bcu bdun gyis 'dzud pa dang ston pa dang / 'jug pa dang chud par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to this point, in seventeen verses, the bringing about, the teaching, the entering, and the being brought about are shown.

original: thog ma'i tshig gcig gis 'dzud pa bstan to //
analyzed: thog ma'i tshig gcig gis 'dzud pa bstan to //
translated: In the first verse, the bringing about is shown.

original: tshig lngas ni 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig lngas ni 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: The first five lines show the engagement.

original: tshig gcig gis ni chud par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni chud par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The last line shows the engagement in the result.

original: tshig bcus ni ston pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshig bcus ni ston pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The next ten lines show the teacher.

original: gnas pa ni brten pa'i don te mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / byang chub la bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni brten pa'i don te mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / byang chub la bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding means the meaning of support, abiding in nirvana and enlightenment.

original: stobs dang bsam gtan tshad med pas brgyan te bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba'i yon tan thams cad chos 'di gnyis kyi nang du 'du ste /
analyzed: stobs dang bsam gtan tshad med pas brgyan te bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba'i yon tan thams cad chos 'di gnyis kyi nang du 'du ste /
translated: The two dharmas include all the qualities that become the accumulations of merit and wisdom, adorned with the powers, dhyanas, and immeasurables.

original: sems can thams cad de la 'jog pas 'dzud pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad de la 'jog pas 'dzud pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since all sentient beings are placed in those two, they are called engagement.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / ser sna'i nyes pa nga la yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: mdo las / ser sna'i nyes pa nga la yod par 'gyur //
translated: “Stinginess is a fault that exists in me.

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: Up to:🔽“I am not virtuous with even one sentient being.”

original: sems can gcig kyang rung ste nga mi dge / zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad lngas ni 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gcig kyang rung ste nga mi dge / zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad lngas ni 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The next five verses show the engagement.

original: de la yang gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: de la yang gsum du dbye'o //
translated: They are divided into three.

original: tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis kyis ni mnyam pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis kyis ni mnyam pa bstan to //
translated: The first two and a half verses show equality.

original: tshig phyed dang gsum gyis ni yon tan gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig phyed dang gsum gyis ni yon tan gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: The first half of the verse shows the special qualities.

original: tshig gcig gis ni 'jug pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni 'jug pa nyid bstan te /
translated: The last half shows the engagement.

original: byang chub mchog rab ces bya ba ni bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po don dam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub mchog rab ces bya ba ni bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po don dam pa'o //
translated: The supreme enlightenment is the ultimate Great Vehicle, which is unsurpassed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bla na med pa'i theg pa mnyam pa brnyes na de la bdag gam pha rol zhes tha dad par ga la zhig 'byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bla na med pa'i theg pa mnyam pa brnyes na de la bdag gam pha rol zhes tha dad par ga la zhig 'byed de /
translated: When one attains the unsurpassed Great Vehicle of the Buddha, how can one distinguish between self and other?

original: nang gi ye shes mi mnyam na bdag 'ba' zhig theg pa chen po la 'jug par byed phyi rol gyi ye shes mi mnyam na pha rol po theg pa chung ngu la 'jog par 'gyur /
analyzed: nang gi ye shes mi mnyam na bdag 'ba' zhig theg pa chen po la 'jug par byed phyi rol gyi ye shes mi mnyam na pha rol po theg pa chung ngu la 'jog par 'gyur /
translated: If one's inner wisdom is not equal, one will engage only in the Great Vehicle oneself, while others will be placed in the Lesser Vehicle.

original: sgrib dang ma bral na bla na med pa'i theg pa chen por ga la rung ste /
analyzed: sgrib dang ma bral na bla na med pa'i theg pa chen por ga la rung ste /
translated: If one is not free from obscurations, how can one be suitable for the unsurpassed Great Vehicle?

original: de bas na ser sna'i nyes pa nga la yod na mi dge zhes smos pa yin no //🔽mdo las / nga la ser sna dag ni chung zad med //
analyzed: de bas na ser sna'i nyes pa nga la yod na mi dge zhes smos pa yin no // mdo las / nga la ser sna dag ni chung zad med //
translated: Therefore, if I have the fault of stinginess, I should say it is non-virtuous.🔽As it is said in the sutra:

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: I have not the slightest stinginess.

original: 'gro ba kun rig de @228a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun rig de @228a * //
translated: The Omniscient One of all beings.

original: bsang sangs rgyas //
analyzed: bsang sangs rgyas //
translated: The Buddha is pure.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to here, the special qualities are taught.

original: de la tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis nga 'dod chags dang bral bas 'jigs pa med pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: de la tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis nga 'dod chags dang bral bas 'jigs pa med pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: In the first two lines, the quality of being fearless through being free from desire is taught.

original: tshig 'og ma gcig gis ni phyi rol gyi rgyan dang yang dag pa'i chos kyi yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: tshig 'og ma gcig gis ni phyi rol gyi rgyan dang yang dag pa'i chos kyi yon tan bstan te /
translated: In the next line, the quality of the outer ornaments and the true Dharma is taught.

original: ser sna med ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po bcabs te /🔽theg pa chung ngu ston cing sems can bslu ba'am /
analyzed: ser sna med ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po bcabs te / theg pa chung ngu ston cing sems can bslu ba'am /
translated: As for without stinginess, the Great Vehicle is not hidden.

original: sngar theg pa chen po sbyin par bya ba las phyis ma sbyin pa ma yin pas ser sna med do //
analyzed: sngar theg pa chen po sbyin par bya ba las phyis ma sbyin pa ma yin pas ser sna med do //
translated: It is not the case that, having taught the Great Vehicle before, one does not give it later.🔽Therefore, there is no stinginess.

original: sems can gyis theg pa chen po rig cing chud kyis dogs pa'i thugs mi mnga' bas phrag dog med do //
analyzed: sems can gyis theg pa chen po rig cing chud kyis dogs pa'i thugs mi mnga' bas phrag dog med do //
translated: Since there is no fear that sentient beings will know the Great Vehicle and be lost, there is no jealousy.

original: sdig pa'i chos ni gang nyon mongs pa'i las dang bcas pa sdug bsngal ba 'khor ba'i chos yongs su bcad pas nyes pa'i skyon gang yang med de /
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos ni gang nyon mongs pa'i las dang bcas pa sdug bsngal ba 'khor ba'i chos yongs su bcad pas nyes pa'i skyon gang yang med de /
translated: Since the Dharma of evil, which is the Dharma of samsara with afflictions and karma, is completely eliminated, there are no faults or defects.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes rdzogs nas phyogs bcur seng ge'i sgra bsgrags te 'jigs pa mi mnga' bas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes rdzogs nas phyogs bcur seng ge'i sgra bsgrags te 'jigs pa mi mnga' bas /
translated: Having perfected authentic pristine consciousness, he proclaimed the lion's roar in the ten directions and was fearless.

original: 'gro ba kun rig nga sangs rgyas //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun rig nga sangs rgyas //
translated: I am the Buddha, the knower of all migrating beings.🔽In the sutra,

original: zhes bya'o // mdo las /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // mdo las /
translated: it states,

original: ji ltar mtshan rnams kyis ni nga brgyan te //
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan rnams kyis ni nga brgyan te //
translated: Just as I am adorned with the major marks,

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: up to

original: chos kyi rang bzhin phyag rgya 'di bshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin phyag rgya 'di bshad do //
translated: this is the explanation of the seal of the nature of phenomena.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni phyi rol gyi mtshan gyis brgyan pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni phyi rol gyi mtshan gyis brgyan pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This explains the adornment of the external major marks.

original: mtshan bzang pos brgyan pa'i sku'i 'od dang / ye shes kyi 'od kyis snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcud kyi 'jig rten snang bar byas nas srog chags kun gyis nga la bkur sti byas so //
analyzed: mtshan bzang pos brgyan pa'i sku'i 'od dang / ye shes kyi 'od kyis snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcud kyi 'jig rten snang bar byas nas srog chags kun gyis nga la bkur sti byas so //
translated: The light of the body adorned with the excellent major marks and the light of pristine consciousness illuminate the world of the environment and the world of the inhabitants. All living beings venerate me.

original: nang na nyon mongs pa med pas phyi rol gyi mtshan gyis brgyan te chos kyi rang bzhin gyi phyag rgya 'di bshad do //
analyzed: nang na nyon mongs pa med pas phyi rol gyi mtshan gyis brgyan te chos kyi rang bzhin gyi phyag rgya 'di bshad do //
translated: Since there are no afflictions internally, externally I am adorned with the major marks and explain this seal of the nature of phenomena.

original: phyag rgya ni stong pa gnyis kyi theg pa chen po'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni stong pa gnyis kyi theg pa chen po'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: The seal is the Mahayana seal of the two emptinesses.

original: phyag rgya 'dis btab pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos yang dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'dis btab pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos yang dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is sealed by this seal is called the authentic teaching of the Great Vehicle.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / de ltar ngas bsams sh'a ri'i bu //
analyzed: mdo las / de ltar ngas bsams sh'a ri'i bu //
translated: Thus, Shariputra,

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: up to:

original: bdag 'od rang byung 'jig rten rig par ro //
analyzed: bdag 'od rang byung 'jig rten rig par ro //
translated: I am the self-luminous one, the knower of the world.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni go bar bya ba bstan pa ste theg pa chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes ngas ji ltar rig pa bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang bstan zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni go bar bya ba bstan pa ste theg pa chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes ngas ji ltar rig pa bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang bstan zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This teaches what is to be understood. It means: Just as I, the self-luminous one, have realized the authentic wisdom of the Great Vehicle, I will also teach it to all sentient beings.🔽The sutra says:🔽As I have seen and contemplated,

original: mdo las / ji ltar mthong zhing ji ltar bsams pa dang // zhes pa nas //
analyzed: mdo las / ji ltar mthong zhing ji ltar bsams pa dang // zhes pa nas //
translated: up to:

original: dur sa de dag phyi phyir skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dur sa de dag phyi phyir skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Those cemeteries will be reborn again and again.

original: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad gcig gis chud par byed pa bstan pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad gcig gis chud par byed pa bstan pa ste //
translated: This one verse teaches what is to be accomplished.

original: sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs nas @228b smon lam bzhin du byang chub la dgod de /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs nas @228b smon lam bzhin du byang chub la dgod de /
translated: After fulfilling past aspirations, one should establish them in enlightenment according to one's aspirations.

original: byang chub ni rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub ni rgyu'i don to //
translated: Enlightenment has the meaning of cause.

original: sa dang po nas sa brgyad kyi bar du chud par byed de /
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa brgyad kyi bar du chud par byed de /
translated: From the first ground up to the eighth ground, one accomplishes.

original: phyir mi ldog pa thob pas sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa thob pas sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: and because of the attainment of irreversibility, it is the cause of becoming a Buddha.

original: 'di man chad tshig bcus ni ston pa 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad tshig bcus ni ston pa 'grel pa ste /
translated: From here on, the teacher explains in ten phrases.

original: de la thog ma'i tshig brgyad kyis mi mthun pa ston to //
analyzed: de la thog ma'i tshig brgyad kyis mi mthun pa ston to //
translated: Among them, the first eight phrases show the disagreement.

original: tshig phyi ma gnyis kyis ni phyis mthun par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma gnyis kyis ni phyis mthun par 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The last two phrases show the later agreement.

original: de la gang shes pa dang ldan pas ni de bzhin du 'dzin par 'gyur gyi gang mi shas pa rnams ni de la myos te skur pa 'debs so //
analyzed: de la gang shes pa dang ldan pas ni de bzhin du 'dzin par 'gyur gyi gang mi shas pa rnams ni de la myos te skur pa 'debs so //
translated: Among them, those who have knowledge will hold it accordingly, but those who are ignorant will be confused and slander it.

original: 'di man chad tshig drug gis mi mthun pa'i mtshan ma bstan te /
analyzed: 'di man chad tshig drug gis mi mthun pa'i mtshan ma bstan te /
translated: From here on, in six phrases, the characteristics of disagreement are shown.

original: de la yang rnam pa gnyis so ;
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis so ;
translated: And there are also two kinds.

original: / thog ma tshig gcig gis ni dge ba med la sdig pa dang bcas pas mi mthun pa bstan to //
analyzed: / thog ma tshig gcig gis ni dge ba med la sdig pa dang bcas pas mi mthun pa bstan to //
translated: In the beginning, with one phrase, the disagreement is shown by the absence of virtue and the presence of evil.

original: 'og ma tshig lngas ni sdig pa dang bcas la dge ba med pas mi mthun pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'og ma tshig lngas ni sdig pa dang bcas la dge ba med pas mi mthun pa bstan to //
translated: In the last five phrases, the disagreement is shown by the presence of evil and the absence of virtue.

original: spyod pa ma spyad tshe rabs snga ma la //
analyzed: spyod pa ma spyad tshe rabs snga ma la //
translated: In past lives, when not practicing the conduct,

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa ste ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa ste ;
translated: This refers to those who have not generated the roots of virtue that transcend the world.🔽Even if they have generated them a little, they do not become the cause of the undefiled.

original: cung zad bskyed pa yang zag pa med pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin gyi 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan gyi rgyur 'gyur bas 'di lnga la chags shing zhen te /
analyzed: cung zad bskyed pa yang zag pa med pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin gyi 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan gyi rgyur 'gyur bas 'di lnga la chags shing zhen te /
translated: Since they become the cause of the five sense pleasures, they are attached and cling to these five.

original: gti mug gi las byas pas sred pa skyes te /
analyzed: gti mug gi las byas pas sred pa skyes te /
translated: Through the karma of delusion, craving arises.

original: skye shi'i sdong po phyi phyir skye bar gyur to //
analyzed: skye shi'i sdong po phyi phyir skye bar gyur to //
translated: The trunk of birth and death is born again and again.

original: 'di man chad tshig lngas sdig pa dang bcas la dge ba med pas mi mthun par bstan te /
analyzed: 'di man chad tshig lngas sdig pa dang bcas la dge ba med pas mi mthun par bstan te /
translated: From here on, five verses show the incompatibility of having evil and not having virtue.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, there are two types.

original: de la snga ma tshig bzhis ni sdig pa dang bcas pas mi mthun pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la snga ma tshig bzhis ni sdig pa dang bcas pas mi mthun pa bstan to //
translated: Among them, the first four verses show the incompatibility of having evil.

original: 'og ma tshig gcig gis ni dge ba med pas mi mthun pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'og ma tshig gcig gis ni dge ba med pas mi mthun pa bstan to //
translated: The last verse shows the incompatibility of not having virtue.

original: snga ma la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: snga ma la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first also has two types.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags shing zhen pas mi mthun pa dang / bslab pa myos shing 'khrul pas mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags shing zhen pas mi mthun pa dang / bslab pa myos shing 'khrul pas mi mthun pa ste /
translated: It is incompatible because of attachment to and clinging to the five sense pleasures. It is incompatible because of being confused and deluded about the training.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang gis mi dge ba'i las 'ba' zhig spyad pas ngan 'gror lhung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang gis mi dge ba'i las 'ba' zhig spyad pas ngan 'gror lhung zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that one falls into miserable realms because of engaging only in nonvirtuous actions due to the power of desire.

original: las 'dren mar spyad pa 'gro ba drug tu nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'dren mar spyad pa 'gro ba drug tu nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Engaging in a mixture of actions leads to affliction in the six realms.

original: skye ba rnam bzhir las dang 'grogs pas sdug bsngal gsum dang lnga dang brgyad kyis gdungs pas btsir ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba rnam bzhir las dang 'grogs pas sdug bsngal gsum dang lnga dang brgyad kyis gdungs pas btsir ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one is tormented by the four kinds of birth, the three sufferings, the five sufferings and the eight sufferings, it is called “oppressed.”

original: phyi phyir skye bar 'gyur ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: phyi phyir skye bar 'gyur ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: The continuity of samsara is the repeated occurrence of birth.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / bsod nams chung bas sdug bsngal kun gyis btsir //
analyzed: mdo las / bsod nams chung bas sdug bsngal kun gyis btsir //
translated: Oppressed by all suffering due to having little merit.

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: Up to:

original: tshe rabs skye ba stong phrag du ma'o //🔽zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshig phyed @229a * //
analyzed: tshe rabs skye ba stong phrag du ma'o // zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshig phyed @229a * //
translated: In thousands of lives and births.

original: dang gnyis kyis bslab pa 'khrugs pas mi mthun pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dang gnyis kyis bslab pa 'khrugs pas mi mthun pa bstan pa ste /
translated: From here on, the following one and a half lines teach incompatibility due to confusion about the training.

original: thog ma'i tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang mthar lta bas lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: thog ma'i tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang mthar lta bas lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: The first one and a half verses show how the sixty-two views arise from the view of the transitory collection and the extreme views.

original: phyi ma tshig gcig gis ni lta ba bsnyems pa dang tshul khrims bsnyems pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / de ma yin pa gzhan yang skye ba bstan to //
analyzed: phyi ma tshig gcig gis ni lta ba bsnyems pa dang tshul khrims bsnyems pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / de ma yin pa gzhan yang skye ba bstan to //
translated: The last verse shows how the pride of views and the pride of morality arise from them, and how other views arise from them.

original: sems can thog ma med pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chung bas sdug bsngal gyis btsir bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can thog ma med pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chung bas sdug bsngal gyis btsir bar gyur to //
translated: Since beginningless time, sentient beings have had little accumulation of merit and wisdom, and so have been pressed by suffering.

original: de dag kyang thar pa'i lam 'dod mod kyi yang dag pa dang log pa ma rtogs te mu stegs can du gyur na log par lta ba la slob pa dang / spyod pa 'khrul pas log par lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang thar pa'i lam 'dod mod kyi yang dag pa dang log pa ma rtogs te mu stegs can du gyur na log par lta ba la slob pa dang / spyod pa 'khrul pas log par lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Although they desire the path of liberation, they do not understand what is correct and what is false, and so become tīrthikas. When they study false views, they are called “those with false views” because their conduct is confused.

original: lta ba la rnam pa mang ste gang sems can gyi 'byung ba'i lam gyi bar du gcod cing rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur ba la lta ba stug po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba la rnam pa mang ste gang sems can gyi 'byung ba'i lam gyi bar du gcod cing rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur ba la lta ba stug po zhes bya'o //
translated: There are many kinds of views. Those that obstruct the path of sentient beings and prevent liberation are called “thick views.”

original: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba lnga la bzhi ni yod par lta ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba lnga la bzhi ni yod par lta ba'o //
translated: “ Existence and nonexistence” refers to the five views. Four of them are views of existence.

original: ngan par lta ba ni med par lta ba'o //
analyzed: ngan par lta ba ni med par lta ba'o //
translated: Bad views are views of nonexistence.

original: gzhan yang lta ba sna tshogs ni yod med ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang lta ba sna tshogs ni yod med ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, various views are called “existence and nonexistence.”

original: gzhan yang yod pa ni bdag gi phung po phyi ma yod par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang yod pa ni bdag gi phung po phyi ma yod par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, existence is grasping at the existence of one’s own aggregates in the future.

original: rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: This is the view of eternalism.

original: med pa ni bdag gi phung po phyi ma med par 'dzin pa ste chad par lta ba'o //
analyzed: med pa ni bdag gi phung po phyi ma med par 'dzin pa ste chad par lta ba'o //
translated: Nonexistence is grasping at the nonexistence of one’s own aggregates in the future. This is the view of nihilism.

original: mthar lta ba dang log par lta ba las lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis su 'dzin pa ni yod med ces bya'o //
analyzed: mthar lta ba dang log par lta ba las lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis su 'dzin pa ni yod med ces bya'o //
translated: Grasping at the sixty-two views that arise from the views of extremes and wrong views is called “existence and nonexistence.”

original: de ltar ngar 'dzin par lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis la sogs par 'dzin cing chags te gtong du mi btub bas log par byed par nga rgyal can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ngar 'dzin par lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis la sogs par 'dzin cing chags te gtong du mi btub bas log par byed par nga rgyal can zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, one is called a “conceited one who acts perversely” because one grasps and is attached to the sixty-two views of the self, and so on, and cannot let go of them.

original: 'di man chad tshig gcig gis ni dge ba med pas mi mthun pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'di man chad tshig gcig gis ni dge ba med pas mi mthun pa bstan te /
translated: From here on, one verse shows the incompatibility of the absence of virtue.

original: gang dge ba dang ldan pa ni bsnyen pa bzhi la bsnyen par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dge ba dang ldan pa ni bsnyen pa bzhi la bsnyen par bya'o //
translated: One who is endowed with virtue should approach the four forms of reliance.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang yang dag pa'i chos nyen pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / thos pa bzhin du nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang yang dag pa'i chos nyen pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / thos pa bzhin du nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: Relying on a spiritual friend, listening to the true Dharma, proper mental attention, and practice in accord with what one has heard.

original: byis pa g-yo byed pa sdig pa can ni tshe rabs du mar sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yang mi thos na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang gang zhig phrad de /
analyzed: byis pa g-yo byed pa sdig pa can ni tshe rabs du mar sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yang mi thos na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang gang zhig phrad de /
translated: The childish, deceitful evildoers do not hear the name of the Buddha even in many lifetimes, so how could they meet a spiritual friend?

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyang mi mthong /🔽chos kyang mi thos te /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyang mi mthong / chos kyang mi thos te /
translated: Thus, they do not see the Buddha,🔽and do not hear the Dharma.

original: chos thos pa'i skal ba med pa /
analyzed: chos thos pa'i skal ba med pa /
translated: They are not fortunate enough to hear the Dharma.

original: yid la byed pa dang nan tan du spyod par ga la zhig 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang nan tan du spyod par ga la zhig 'gyur te /
translated: How could they have mental attention and practice assiduously?

original: de ni shin tu gdul dka' bas thog ma nas @229b theg pa chen po bstan par dka'o //
analyzed: de ni shin tu gdul dka' bas thog ma nas @229b theg pa chen po bstan par dka'o //
translated: Since they are very difficult to discipline, it is difficult to teach them the Great Vehicle from the beginning.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / nga'i thabs kyis de la sh'a ri'i bu //
analyzed: mdo las / nga'i thabs kyis de la sh'a ri'i bu //
translated: “O Śāriputra, by my method,🔽up to: I teach them nirvāṇa.”

original: zhes pa nas de dag mya ngan las 'da' ba nye bar bstan zhes pa'i bar du ni mi mthun pa bsdu ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa nas de dag mya ngan las 'da' ba nye bar bstan zhes pa'i bar du ni mi mthun pa bsdu ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches the inclusion of those who are incompatible.

original: ngas sngar thabs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal zhi ba tsam bstan to //
analyzed: ngas sngar thabs kyi mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal zhi ba tsam bstan to //
translated: Previously I taught the nirvāṇa of the method, which is merely the pacification of suffering.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / 'di ltar rtag tu ngas bshad mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: mdo las / 'di ltar rtag tu ngas bshad mya ngan 'das //
translated: “Thus I always teach nirvāṇa,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to:

original: theg pa 'di ni gcig ste gnyis su med //
analyzed: theg pa 'di ni gcig ste gnyis su med //
translated: This vehicle is one, not two.”

original: ces pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshigs bcad bdun cu rtsa phyed dang gcig gis chos la gnas pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshigs bcad bdun cu rtsa phyed dang gcig gis chos la gnas pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage, up to the end of the seventy-fifth verse, teaches the abiding in the Dharma.

original: de la rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three parts to that.

original: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan to //
translated: In the first half-verse, the Dharma of the buddhas of the ten directions is taught.

original: bar gyi tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa phyed dang dgus ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: bar gyi tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa phyed dang dgus ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan to //
translated: The thirty-five and a half verses in the middle teach the Dharma of the Buddhas of the three times.

original: tha ma tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa phyed dang gcig gis ni nga yang de bzhin no zhes pa bstan to //
analyzed: tha ma tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa phyed dang gcig gis ni nga yang de bzhin no zhes pa bstan to //
translated: The last thirty-five and a quarter verses teach “I am also like that.”

original: 'di ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the Dharma of the Buddhas of the ten directions.

original: mdo las / theg pa gcig ste gnyis su med //
analyzed: mdo las / theg pa gcig ste gnyis su med //
translated: In the sutra it says: “There is one vehicle, not two.”

original: ces 'byung na gsum med par bya ste /
analyzed: ces 'byung na gsum med par bya ste /
translated: But it is not three.

original: gcig tu bsdur ga la zhig rung /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdur ga la zhig rung /
translated: How could it be appropriate to include it in one?

original: mdo las / sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang byung ba //
analyzed: mdo las / sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang byung ba //
translated: In the sutra it says: “The Tathagatas of the past who have appeared…”

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: Up to:

original: de dag tshad bzung du ni yod med pa //
analyzed: de dag tshad bzung du ni yod med pa //
translated: “It is not possible to measure them.”

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa phyed dang dgus dus gsum kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa phyed dang dgus dus gsum kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa ste /
translated: From here on, the thirty-five and a half verses teach the Dharma of the Buddhas of the three times.

original: de la yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are also three parts to that.

original: thog ma'i tshig nyi shu rtsa phyed dang brgyad kyis ni sngon 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: thog ma'i tshig nyi shu rtsa phyed dang brgyad kyis ni sngon 'das pa bstan to //
translated: The first twenty-five and a half verses teach the past.

original: bar gyi tshig drug gis ni ma 'ongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig drug gis ni ma 'ongs pa bstan to //
translated: The six intermediate words indicate the future.🔽The four final words indicate the present.

original: tha ma'i tshig bzhis ni da ltar bstan te 'das pa bstan pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tha ma'i tshig bzhis ni da ltar bstan te 'das pa bstan pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The teaching of the past is twofold:

original: thog ma'i tshig phyed dang lngas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa thog mar bkri ba'i thabs tsam bstan nas phyis yang dag pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma'i tshig phyed dang lngas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa thog mar bkri ba'i thabs tsam bstan nas phyis yang dag pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The first five and a half words indicate the teaching of the Buddha's Dharma, first teaching the mere method of guidance and later the truth.

original: tshig nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis ni sems can rnams chos thos nas mthar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis ni sems can rnams chos thos nas mthar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The twenty-three words indicate that after sentient beings hear the Dharma, in the end they attain omniscient wisdom.

original: snga ma la yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: snga ma la yang bzhi ste /
translated: The former also has four parts:

original: tshig gcig gis ni sangs rgyas mang ba bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni sangs rgyas mang ba bstan to //
translated: One word indicates the many buddhas.

original: tshig gcig gis ni thabs tsam bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni thabs tsam bstan to //
translated: One word indicates the mere method.

original: tshig gcig gis ni yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni yang dag par bstan to //
translated: One word indicates the truth.

original: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni ci'i phyir thabs dang yang dag pa bstan pa brjod do //🔽mdo las / skyes bu dam pa de dag thams cad kyi //
analyzed: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni ci'i phyir thabs dang yang dag pa bstan pa brjod do // mdo las / skyes bu dam pa de dag thams cad kyi //
translated: One and a half words express why the method and truth are taught.🔽As it says in the sutra:

original: zhes pa @230a * //
analyzed: zhes pa @230a * //
translated: All those sublime beings...

original: nas ; thabs la mkhas pa brgya phrag du ma yis //
analyzed: nas ; thabs la mkhas pa brgya phrag du ma yis //
translated: and by many hundreds of skillful means.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni thabs tsam du bstan pa brjod pa'o //🔽mdo las / de dag kun gyi theg pa gcig tu bstan //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni thabs tsam du bstan pa brjod pa'o // mdo las / de dag kun gyi theg pa gcig tu bstan //
translated: Up to here, the teaching of mere skillful means is expressed.

original: zhes pa nas //🔽srog chags du ma bsam gyis mi khyab rnams //
analyzed: zhes pa nas // srog chags du ma bsam gyis mi khyab rnams //
translated: In the sutra it is said: They all teach the One Vehicle.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni yang dag pa bstan pa'o //🔽mdo las / rgyal ba'i thabs gzhan rnam pa tha dad pas //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni yang dag pa bstan pa'o // mdo las / rgyal ba'i thabs gzhan rnam pa tha dad pas //
translated: Up to here, the correct teaching is expressed.

original: zhes pa nas /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten lhar bcas la //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten lhar bcas la //
translated: In the sutra it is said: The Victor, with different skillful means.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni ci'i phyir rgyal bas thabs tsam bstan pa dang / yang dag pa bstan pa brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni ci'i phyir rgyal bas thabs tsam bstan pa dang / yang dag pa bstan pa brjod pa ste /
translated: Up to here, the reason why the Victor teaches mere skillful means and the correct teaching is expressed.

original: sems can mang po cig car theg pa gcig la 'jug mi nus te de bas na dbang po dang sbyar te /
analyzed: sems can mang po cig car theg pa gcig la 'jug mi nus te de bas na dbang po dang sbyar te /
translated: Many beings cannot enter the One Vehicle at once, therefore, in accordance with their faculties,

original: sngar thabs rnam pa tha dad pa bstan te /
analyzed: sngar thabs rnam pa tha dad pa bstan te /
translated: previously different skillful means were taught.

original: phyis theg pa gcig tu bstan to //🔽mdo las / sems can gang gis de la mngon sum der //
analyzed: phyis theg pa gcig tu bstan to // mdo las / sems can gang gis de la mngon sum der //
translated: Later, the One Vehicle was taught.

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: In the sutra it is said: Those beings who directly perceive that.🔽Up to here,

original: de dag thams cad byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag thams cad byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: All of them will attain enlightenment.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshig nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis sems can mang po chos thos nas mthar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshig nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis sems can mang po chos thos nas mthar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to this point, in twenty-three verses it is shown how many sentient beings, having heard the Dharma, will ultimately attain omniscient gnosis.

original: de la yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Here too there are three parts.

original: thog ma'i tshig gnyis kyis ni sangs rgyas da ltar bzhugs pa brjod do //
analyzed: thog ma'i tshig gnyis kyis ni sangs rgyas da ltar bzhugs pa brjod do //
translated: The first two lines speak of the present buddhas.

original: tshig nyi shus ni 'das pa'i sangs rgyas brjod do //
analyzed: tshig nyi shus ni 'das pa'i sangs rgyas brjod do //
translated: The twenty lines speak of the past buddhas.

original: tshig gcig gis ni bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: The one line teaches the summary.

original: 'di ni thog ma ste sangs rgyas dang phrad nas chos thos pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bsdu ba bzhi la sogs pa ni bsod nams rnam pa tha dad pa zhes bya ste /

translated: This is the beginning: having met the buddhas and heard the Dharma, the six perfections, the four ways of gathering, and so on are called the different kinds of merit.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rgyur 'gyur ba bsgom zhing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas de dag thams cad byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rgyur 'gyur ba bsgom zhing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas de dag thams cad byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Meditating on them as the cause of buddhahood and practicing the bodhisattva deeds, all of them will attain enlightenment.

original: mdo las / mya ngan las 'das rgyal ba de dag gi //
analyzed: mdo las / mya ngan las 'das rgyal ba de dag gi //
translated: The sutra says:

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: Those who have attained nirvana, those victors,🔽...

original: de dag thams cad byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag thams cad byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: All of them will attain enlightenment.

original: zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad nyi shus sangs rgyas 'das pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad nyi shus sangs rgyas 'das pa bstan pa ste /
translated: From here up to this point, in twenty verses, it teaches the buddhas of the past.

original: de la rnam pa lnga'o ;
analyzed: de la rnam pa lnga'o ;
translated: There are five parts to that.

original: / tshig gcig gis ni byang chub sems dpa' bstan to //
analyzed: / tshig gcig gis ni byang chub sems dpa' bstan to //
translated: One verse teaches about the bodhisattvas.

original: tshig gcig gis ni byams pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni byams pa bstan to //

analyzed: tshig phyed dang lngas ni mchod rten byas pa bstan to //

analyzed: tshig phyed dang bdun gyis ni sku gzugs byas pa bstan to //
translated: Seven and a half verses teach about making images.

analyzed: tshig bdun gyis mchod pa byas pa bstan to //
translated: Seven verses teach about making offerings.

analyzed: tshig @230b gcig gis ni sangs rgyas brjod pa bstan to //

analyzed: 'di ni thog ma ste / bzod kyang zhi la dul ba med dam /
translated: This is the beginning.🔽If one has patience but lacks peace and discipline,

analyzed: gang bzod cing zhi la dul ba ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is patient, peaceful and disciplined is called the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: tshul bzhin du phan pa'i don du 'gyur ba la rab tu zhi zhing dul na de dag byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is peaceful and disciplined for the sake of proper benefit, they will attain enlightenment.

original: 'di'ang sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas phyi ma gdul dka' ba rnams kyi spyod pa yin gyi sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i tshe spyod pa 'dis rgyur bya ba ma yin no //

translated: This is also the conduct of those difficult to train in the future after the Buddha's nirvana, but during the Buddha's lifetime, this conduct is not to be practiced.

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas thun mong du spyod pa yin te /
translated: The six perfections are also practiced in common after the Buddha's nirvana.

analyzed: de dag kyang byang chub thob par 'gyur ro // mdo las / gang gis ring bsrel la ni mchod byed pa //
translated: They too will attain enlightenment.🔽A sutra states:

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: Those who make offerings to the relics🔽...

original: de dag gis kyang byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: They too will attain enlightenment.

analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang lngas mchod rten byas pas byang chub thob pa bstan pa ste /

analyzed: thog ma'i tshig gnyis kyis ni mchod rten mang po la rin po ches brgyan ba bstan to //
