translated: Thus, the principle of reality always abides,🔽and🔽it is the source of the three natures.

original: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni mtshan nyid gsum gyi khungs bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni mtshan nyid gsum gyi khungs bstan to //
translated: This verse explains the source of the three natures.

original: theg pa gcig ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid la bya ste sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: theg pa gcig ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid la bya ste sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The one vehicle is the perfected nature, as explained above.

original: chos kyi gnas nyid ni chos thams cad la yang dag bar gnas pas chos kyi gnas nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi gnas nyid ni chos thams cad la yang dag bar gnas pas chos kyi gnas nyid do //
translated: The principle of reality is the reality of all things, and it is the source of the three natures.

original: chos la nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa yod de nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnam pa thob pa ni chos mi 'gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos la nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa yod de nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnam pa thob pa ni chos mi 'gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The Dharma has defilement and purity. Having abandoned defilement and obtained purity, the Dharma is unchanging.

original: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid rtag tu gnas pas mi g-yo bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid rtag tu gnas pas mi g-yo bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It is unshakably stable, because its true nature always abides.

original: snying po byang chub la bzhugs shing chos thams cad la thabs mkhas pas shin tu ston to //
analyzed: snying po byang chub la bzhugs shing chos thams cad la thabs mkhas pas shin tu ston to //
translated: It is well taught, because the Buddha, dwelling at the site of enlightenment, teaches all things by means of skillful means.

original: chos thams cad la rnam pa gnyis te stong pa nyid dang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam pa gnyis te stong pa nyid dang yod pa nyid do //
translated: All things have two natures, emptiness and existence.

original: stong pa la khyad par med pas mtshan nyid gcig ste /
analyzed: stong pa la khyad par med pas mtshan nyid gcig ste /
translated: Emptiness is undifferentiated and has one characteristic.

original: kun tu rtog pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: It is called imagination.

original: / yod pa la khyad par yod de rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: / yod pa la khyad par yod de rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Existence is differentiated and has two natures.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ste rtag pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ste rtag pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The permanent is the perfected nature.

original: mi rtag pa ni gzhan gyi dbang las kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni gzhan gyi dbang las kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The impermanent is the other-dependent, the nature of action.

original: de la yang gnyis te zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang gnyis te zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is also twofold, with and without impurity.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni gzhan gyi dbang las mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni gzhan gyi dbang las mtshan nyid do //
translated: The contaminated is the dependent characteristic.

original: zag pa med pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The uncontaminated is the perfected characteristic.

original: de bas na yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de bas na yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Therefore, in terms of the perfected characteristic,

original: de la theg pa gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la theg pa gcig ces bya'o //
translated: it is said to be the One Vehicle.

original: theg pa gcig gis yang dag pa nyid rig pas chos kyi gnas nyid dang chos mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: theg pa gcig gis yang dag pa nyid rig pas chos kyi gnas nyid dang chos mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: By means of the One Vehicle, one realizes reality, the reality of phenomena and the immutability of phenomena.

original: de la mi g-yo bar gnas nas sems can la thabs mkhas pas chos ston to //🔽mdo las / lha mi kun gyi mchod pa phyogs bcu na //
analyzed: de la mi g-yo bar gnas nas sems can la thabs mkhas pas chos ston to // mdo las / lha mi kun gyi mchod pa phyogs bcu na //
translated: Abiding unmoved by that, one teaches the Dharma to sentient beings by skillful means.🔽The sutra says:

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: The offerings of all gods and humans in the ten directions🔽up to

original: de dag rnams kyang theg pa mchog 'di 'chad //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyang theg pa mchog 'di 'chad //
translated: they too explain this supreme vehicle.

original: ces pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang lngas da ltar gyi don ston to //
analyzed: ces pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang lngas da ltar gyi don ston to //
translated: From here up to the next half-verse, the meaning of the present is taught.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / thabs la mkhas pas rab tu 'chad pa dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las / thabs la mkhas pas rab tu 'chad pa dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: skillfully explaining

original: dad bzhi ba'i sa 'di rig nas so //
analyzed: dad bzhi ba'i sa 'di rig nas so //
translated: having understood this stage of faith.

original: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni sngar thabs tsam bstan pa la phyis yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni sngar thabs tsam bstan pa la phyis yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: This verse shows that after the method was taught previously, the real thing is taught later.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / lus can kun gyi spyod pa rig pa dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las / lus can kun gyi spyod pa rig pa dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: Knowing the conduct of all embodied beings,🔽up to:

original: sna tshogs mngon par bsgrub pa rab tu @233a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs mngon par bsgrub pa rab tu @233a * //
translated: Teaching the accomplishment of the various.

original: bstan // zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni ci'i phyir sngar thabs tsam bstan la phyis yang dag pa bstan pa nyid ston pa ste /
analyzed: bstan // zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni ci'i phyir sngar thabs tsam bstan la phyis yang dag pa bstan pa nyid ston pa ste /
translated: This verse shows why the method was taught previously and the real thing is taught later.

original: lus can kun gyi spyod pa ni sems kyi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lus can kun gyi spyod pa ni sems kyi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The conduct of all embodied beings is the characteristic of mental conduct.

original: ci bsams pa ni kun tu 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ci bsams pa ni kun tu 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: What is thought is the characteristic of omnipresence.

original: mthu ni las kyi mthu'o //
analyzed: mthu ni las kyi mthu'o //
translated: Power is the power of karma.

original: stobs zhes kyang bya ste sems can gyi dbang po sna tshogs shes pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: stobs zhes kyang bya ste sems can gyi dbang po sna tshogs shes pa'i stobs so //
translated: It is also called strength, the strength of knowing the various faculties of sentient beings.

original: brtson 'grus ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i stobs so //
translated: Diligence is the strength of the possible and impossible.

original: de ltar sems can gyi dad pa rig nas dpe dang gzhi rnam pa mang po sems can gyi dbang po bzhin du sna tshogs mngon pa ston te /
analyzed: de ltar sems can gyi dad pa rig nas dpe dang gzhi rnam pa mang po sems can gyi dbang po bzhin du sna tshogs mngon pa ston te /
translated: Thus, knowing the faith of sentient beings, he teaches the many analogies and bases in various ways, in accordance with the faculties of sentient beings.

original: ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang mtshan nyid gsum rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang mtshan nyid gsum rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Buddhas of the future will also know the three natures.

original: da ltar bzhugs pa yang sems can gyi dbang po mkhyen pas sngar thabs tsam bstan nas phyis yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: da ltar bzhugs pa yang sems can gyi dbang po mkhyen pas sngar thabs tsam bstan nas phyis yang dag par ston to //
translated: The present Buddhas, knowing the faculties of sentient beings, first teach just the methods and later the reality.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / 'dren pa'i dbang po rgyal ba nga yang 'dir //
analyzed: mdo las / 'dren pa'i dbang po rgyal ba nga yang 'dir //
translated: I, the leader, the Victor, am also like this here.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: de ni nga yi rang rig ye shes stobs //
analyzed: de ni nga yi rang rig ye shes stobs //
translated: That is the power of my self-cognizing wisdom.

original: zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad sum cus nga yang de bzhin no zhes pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad sum cus nga yang de bzhin no zhes pa bstan pa ste /
translated: From here on, in thirty verses, it is taught that I am also like that.

original: de la tshigs bcad gnyis kyis dngos su dmigs te bstan to //
analyzed: de la tshigs bcad gnyis kyis dngos su dmigs te bstan to //
translated: Among them, two verses directly point out and teach.

original: nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis ni rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis ni rgyas par bstan to //
translated: Twenty-eight verses extensively teach.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / nga yis mthong ba'i sems can dbul po rnams //
analyzed: mdo las / nga yis mthong ba'i sems can dbul po rnams //
translated: The poor sentient beings I see

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: 'dod pas 'di dag rtag tu ldongs par byas //
analyzed: 'dod pas 'di dag rtag tu ldongs par byas //
translated: Desire always blinds them.

original: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni rgyas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni rgyas par bstan pa ste /
translated: This verse teaches in detail.

original: thog ma'i tshig nyi shu rtsa phyed dang gcig gis ni sngar theg pa gsum thabs tsam du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma'i tshig nyi shu rtsa phyed dang gcig gis ni sngar theg pa gsum thabs tsam du bstan pa ste /
translated: The first twenty-one and a half verses teach that previously the three vehicles were taught as mere expedients.

original: tshig rkyang pa las sems can gyi mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rkyang pa las sems can gyi mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: From the single statement, “Knowing the various aspirations of living beings,” the teaching is given.

original: tshigs bcad bdun gyis ni da ltar yang dag pa nyid du bstan pa brjod de /
analyzed: tshigs bcad bdun gyis ni da ltar yang dag pa nyid du bstan pa brjod de /
translated: The seven verses teach the present true teaching.

original: sngar sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig pu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngar sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig pu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'o //
translated: Previously, the single vehicle of the buddhas was taught in order to attain the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: snga ma la yang rnam pa bzhi ste tshigs bcad phyed dang bzhis ni skye ba'i gnas su bgegs las thar bar bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: snga ma la yang rnam pa bzhi ste tshigs bcad phyed dang bzhis ni skye ba'i gnas su bgegs las thar bar bya ba bstan to //
translated: The previous has four parts. The first four and a half verses teach the liberation from obstacles in the place of birth.

original: tshigs gsum gyis ni grol bar bya bar mi nus pa sems pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs gsum gyis ni grol bar bya bar mi nus pa sems pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The three verses teach the thought that cannot be liberated.

original: tshig phyed dang bcu gnyis kyis ni thabs tsam du bstan par dgongs so //
analyzed: tshig phyed dang bcu gnyis kyis ni thabs tsam du bstan par dgongs so //
translated: The first half of the verse shows the method.

original: tshig phyed dang bzhis ni theg pa gsum sprul pa bstan to //🔽snga ma la yang gnyis te tshig gcig gis ni dge ba med pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig phyed dang bzhis ni theg pa gsum sprul pa bstan to // snga ma la yang gnyis te tshig gcig gis ni dge ba med pa bstan to //
translated: The second half of the verse shows the three vehicles as emanations.🔽The first half of the verse has two parts. The first line shows the absence of virtue.

original: tshig phyed dang gsum @233b gyis ni sdig pa yod par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig phyed dang gsum @233b gyis ni sdig pa yod par bstan to //
translated: The second line shows the presence of sin.

original: nga yis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni spyan lnga'i nang nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
analyzed: nga yis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni spyan lnga'i nang nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
translated: The line I see is from the perspective of the five eyes, it is seen with the Buddha eye.

original: shes rab dang bsod nams spong ba ni 'gro ba drug gi sems can thog ma med pa nas bsod nams dang yi shes kyi rgyur 'gyur ba mi byed 'phags pa'i nor bdun dang mi ldan lha dang mi'i chos kyi nor bdun dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang thabs mkhas pa med pa ni shes rab dang bsod nams spangs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang bsod nams spong ba ni 'gro ba drug gi sems can thog ma med pa nas bsod nams dang yi shes kyi rgyur 'gyur ba mi byed 'phags pa'i nor bdun dang mi ldan lha dang mi'i chos kyi nor bdun dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang thabs mkhas pa med pa ni shes rab dang bsod nams spangs pa'o //
translated: Abandoning wisdom and merit means that from beginningless time, sentient beings in the six realms have not accumulated the causes of merit and wisdom, are not endowed with the seven noble riches, the seven dharmic riches of gods and humans, the six perfections, and skillful means, and have abandoned wisdom and merit.

original: 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang gsum gyis ni sdig pa yod par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang gsum gyis ni sdig pa yod par bstan pa ste /
translated: The next one and a half verses show the presence of evil.

original: de la tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni da ltar gyi dus na 'khor bar nub cing sdug bsngal skye ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni da ltar gyi dus na 'khor bar nub cing sdug bsngal skye ba bstan to //
translated: Of those, the first one and a half verses show that in the present time, beings are sunk in cyclic existence and generate suffering.

original: tshigs bcad gcig gis ni grol bar 'dod kyang log par lta ba spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad gcig gis ni grol bar 'dod kyang log par lta ba spyod pa bstan to //
translated: One verse shows that even though they desire liberation, they practice wrong views.

original: 'jig rten na g-yag rnga ma la chags pa bzhin du sems can dag kyang 'dod pa lnga la chags nas sdug bsngal gyis gdungs te ngan song du lhung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na g-yag rnga ma la chags pa bzhin du sems can dag kyang 'dod pa lnga la chags nas sdug bsngal gyis gdungs te ngan song du lhung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as yaks in the world are attached to their tails, so too sentient beings, attached to the five sense objects, are tormented by suffering and fall into miserable realms.🔽A sutra says:

original: mdo las / sangs rgyas mthu chen rnams kyang yongs mi tshol //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las / sangs rgyas mthu chen rnams kyang yongs mi tshol // zhes pa nas /
translated: Even the powerful buddhas do not seek them.

original: nga yi snying rje stobs chen de dag la //
analyzed: nga yi snying rje stobs chen de dag la //
translated: Those with my great power of compassion

original: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni grol bar 'dod la log par lta ba spyod pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis ni grol bar 'dod la log par lta ba spyod pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This verse shows that even though they desire liberation, they practice wrong views.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po dang ye shes kyi sdug bsngal gcod pa ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba dang 'dra bar ngan pa lta bar lhung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po dang ye shes kyi sdug bsngal gcod pa ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba dang 'dra bar ngan pa lta bar lhung ste /
translated: The Buddha's great power and knowledge are not like the views of the tirthikas, which fall into bad views.

original: lus sdug bsngal bar byas nas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las grol bar 'dod pa ni mi gsha'o //
analyzed: lus sdug bsngal bar byas nas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las grol bar 'dod pa ni mi gsha'o //
translated: It is not right to desire liberation from the suffering of cyclic existence by making the body suffer.

original: lo drug gi bar du nas 'bru re las ma zos kyang byang chub ma thob na tsher phung gi steng na nyal bas byang chub ga la zhig thob ste /
analyzed: lo drug gi bar du nas 'bru re las ma zos kyang byang chub ma thob na tsher phung gi steng na nyal bas byang chub ga la zhig thob ste /
translated: Even though he did not eat anything but a grain of barley for six years, he did not attain enlightenment. How could he attain enlightenment by lying on a heap of thorns?

original: khyi rdol bsnyegs pa dang 'dra ba'i seng ge ltar mi bsnyegs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyi rdol bsnyegs pa dang 'dra ba'i seng ge ltar mi bsnyegs pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not like a dog chasing a stone, but like a lion who does not chase after it.

original: 'di man chad tshig gsum gyis grol bar bya mi nus pa sems pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad tshig gsum gyis grol bar bya mi nus pa sems pa bstan pa ste /
translated: From here on, three verses show the thought that cannot be liberated.

original: de la yang gsum mo //
analyzed: de la yang gsum mo //
translated: It also has three parts.

original: tshigs bcad phyed kyis ni sngon spyod pa'i rgyu sems pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs bcad phyed kyis ni sngon spyod pa'i rgyu sems pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Half a verse shows the thought that is the cause of previous conduct.

original: tshig gcig gis ni 'bras bu thob nas kyang sems pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni 'bras bu thob nas kyang sems pa bstan to //
translated: One verse shows the thought even after attaining the result.

original: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni mi nus par sems pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni mi nus par sems pa bstan to //
translated: The first two lines show that he is unable to bear it.

original: 'di ni dang po ste sems can dag rgyu 'di gnyis dang ldan pas nga'i snying rje stobs che de dag la'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste sems can dag rgyu 'di gnyis dang ldan pas nga'i snying rje stobs che de dag la'o zhes bstan to //
translated: This is the first, and it shows that my compassion is strong for those sentient beings who have these two causes.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / de dag ngas bsams byang chub snying po der //
analyzed: mdo las / de dag ngas bsams byang chub snying po der //
translated: I think of them, and in the essence of enlightenment🔽.🔽.🔽.🔽.

original: zhes pa nas /🔽de yi drung na phan tshun 'chag cing gnas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas / de yi drung na phan tshun 'chag cing gnas /
translated: and so on, up to:🔽They stand around him, walking here and there.🔽

original: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis 'bras bu thob @234a * //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du tshigs bcad 'dis 'bras bu thob @234a * //
translated: This verse shows the result.🔽

original: nas dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nas dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the transcendent state.🔽

original: mngon par sangs rgyas nas shing rgyal gyi drung du phan tshun 'chag cing sems can gyi don ji ltar bya ba dgongs pa'o //🔽gzhan yang sdong po brtag pa ni don la thugs bzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par sangs rgyas nas shing rgyal gyi drung du phan tshun 'chag cing sems can gyi don ji ltar bya ba dgongs pa'o // gzhan yang sdong po brtag pa ni don la thugs bzhag pa bstan to //
translated: Having attained manifest enlightenment, he contemplated how to benefit sentient beings while strolling back and forth in front of the king of trees.🔽🔽Moreover, the analysis of the trunk teaches the meaning of the mind being set at rest.

original: 'chag pa ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: Walking is the performance of the benefit of sentient beings.🔽

original: sdong po la brtag pa ni skye ba rnam bzhi'i skyabs mdzad par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sdong po la brtag pa ni skye ba rnam bzhi'i skyabs mdzad par dgongs pa'o //
translated: The examination of the trunk is the intention to grant protection to the four kinds of beings.🔽

original: 'chag pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes sbyin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes sbyin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Walking is intended as the giving of merit and knowledge.🔽The Sutra says:

original: mdo las / ye shes 'di ni dam pa ngo mtshar che /
analyzed: mdo las / ye shes 'di ni dam pa ngo mtshar che /
translated: This knowledge is sublime and wondrous.

original: sems can 'di dag mi mkhas gti mug ldongs //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag mi mkhas gti mug ldongs //
translated: These sentient beings are ignorant and blind.

original: zhes bya ba ni thar bar byar mi rung bar dgongs pa ste rgyu rnam bzhi'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thar bar byar mi rung bar dgongs pa ste rgyu rnam bzhi'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is intended as the unsuitability of liberation, for four reasons.

original: / chos zab pas shes par dka' ba dang / dbang po rtul bas shes par dka' ba dang / 'dod pa la chags pas gtong mi phod pa dang / gti mug gis ldongs pas thar bar byar mi rung ngo snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: / chos zab pas shes par dka' ba dang / dbang po rtul bas shes par dka' ba dang / 'dod pa la chags pas gtong mi phod pa dang / gti mug gis ldongs pas thar bar byar mi rung ngo snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The Dharma is difficult to understand because it is profound, and it is difficult to understand because of dull faculties. It is not possible to give it up because of attachment to desire, and it is not possible to liberate those who are blind with ignorance.🔽The Sutra says:

original: mdo las / de tshe nga la gsol ba tshangs pa dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las / de tshe nga la gsol ba tshangs pa dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: At that time, Brahma and others🔽...

original: thams cad thal mo sbyar nas gus par 'khod //
analyzed: thams cad thal mo sbyar nas gus par 'khod //
translated: all respectfully stood with palms together.

original: ces pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang bcu gnyis thabs tsam du bstan par dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang bcu gnyis thabs tsam du bstan par dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: From here up to the end of the twelve and a half verses, it is taught as merely an intention.

original: de la yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa bzhi'o //

original: chos chen po las nyams pas gdung bar gyur pa dang / theg pa chung ngus bton pas 'gyod pa dang / thos pas mya ngan zad pas dga' ba dang sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams byang chub thob par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos chen po las nyams pas gdung bar gyur pa dang / theg pa chung ngus bton pas 'gyod pa dang / thos pas mya ngan zad pas dga' ba dang sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams byang chub thob par rtogs pa'o //
translated: They are distressed because they have fallen from the great Dharma, they regret having been rescued by the Lesser Vehicle, they rejoice in the exhaustion of sorrow through learning, and they realize that the Buddha's children will attain enlightenment.

original: 'di ni chos chen po nyams pas gdung bar gyur ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni chos chen po nyams pas gdung bar gyur ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows their distress because they have fallen from the great Dharma.

original: bdag cag gis sngon byang chub sems dpa' la lung bstan pa thos kyang lung bstan pa ma thob po snyam nas gdung bar gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang gzigs pa las nyams pas gdung bar gyur to //
analyzed: bdag cag gis sngon byang chub sems dpa' la lung bstan pa thos kyang lung bstan pa ma thob po snyam nas gdung bar gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang gzigs pa las nyams pas gdung bar gyur to //
translated: They are distressed, thinking, We have heard the predictions of the bodhisattvas in the past, but we have not received any predictions ourselves, and they are distressed because they have fallen from the transcendent wisdom and insight of the Tathagata.

original: mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas she dag gis spyod do zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chung ngus bton pas 'gyod pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas she dag gis spyod do zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chung ngus bton pas 'gyod pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage from the sutra beginning with the words Then the Licchavi Vimalakirti addressed the Buddha and ending with the words They are not to be found in the sutras of the Buddha that belong to the vehicle of the sravakas shows their regret at having been rescued by the Lesser Vehicle.

original: 'di la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Here also there are two aspects.

original: chung dus gnas pas 'gyod pa dang / log par gyur pas 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: chung dus gnas pas 'gyod pa dang / log par gyur pas 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Regret at having remained in the Lesser Vehicle and regret at having gone astray.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gang zag la bdag med pa yang dag pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gang zag la bdag med pa yang dag pa nyid de /
translated: The ultimate realm is the reality of the selflessness of persons.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' dang bdag cag zhugs par mtshungs na ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag theg pa chung ngus bton snyam du 'gyod do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' dang bdag cag zhugs par mtshungs na ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag theg pa chung ngus bton snyam du 'gyod do //
translated: Since the bodhisattvas and we have entered that equally, why does the Lord think that we are to be delivered by the Lesser Vehicle?

original: mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas de snyam du sems so zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dir bdag 'gyod pa bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas de snyam du sems so zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dir bdag 'gyod pa bstan te /
translated: In the sutra, from the words “Lord” up to “think thus” show the regret here.

original: nongs zhes bya ba ni sdig pa la bya'o //
analyzed: nongs zhes bya ba ni sdig pa la bya'o //
translated: “ Fault” means evil.

original: mdo las ci'i slad du zhes pa nas bton par 'gyur zhig na zhes pa'i bar du ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las ci'i slad du zhes pa nas bton par 'gyur zhig na zhes pa'i bar du ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: In the sutra, from the words “why” up to “be delivered” show the question “why?”

original: de yang bla na med pa'i byang chub tu brtsams pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi phyogs dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang mngon par shes pa dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bla na med pa'i byang chub tu brtsams pa'i rgyu byang chub kyi phyogs dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang mngon par shes pa dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the cause of the undertaking of unsurpassed enlightenment is the factors of enlightenment, the perfections, the superknowledges, and the maturation of sentient beings.

original: bsdad pa ni re ba'i don te de bas na bdag cag gis bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur gyur ba re ba'i sems kyis bsdad na ni theg pa chen po'i chos la bton par 'gyur ba zhig na bdag cag la re ba med pas na theg
analyzed: bsdad pa ni re ba'i don te de bas na bdag cag gis bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur gyur ba re ba'i sems kyis bsdad na ni theg pa chen po'i chos la bton par 'gyur ba zhig na bdag cag la re ba med pas na theg
translated: The meaning of to dwell is to hope. Therefore, if we dwell with a hopeful mind that becomes the cause of unsurpassed enlightenment, we will be established in the Mahayana Dharma. But since we have no hope, we have not been established in the Mahayana.

original: pa chen po la dgod par ma gyur to snyam du 'gyod do //
analyzed: pa chen po la dgod par ma gyur to snyam du 'gyod do //
translated: Thus, they regret.

original: byang chub kyi sems la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The thought of enlightenment has three aspects:

original: 'dus byas las skye ba dang / byang chub tshol ba dang sems can la shin tu dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas las skye ba dang / byang chub tshol ba dang sems can la shin tu dgongs pa'o //
translated: arising from conditioned phenomena, seeking enlightenment, and being deeply concerned for sentient beings.

original: mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas dgra bcom pa thob po zhes pa'i bar du ni shin tu 'gyod pa bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas dgra bcom pa thob po zhes pa'i bar du ni shin tu 'gyod pa bstan te /
translated: In the sutra, from Bhagavan up to attained arhatship, it shows deep regret.

original: @238a * // bcom ldan 'das kyis ldem po ngag tu gsungs pa na ma rig pa nas thabs tsam du bstan pa thos ma thag tu gzung ba dang / bsgoms pa dang / bsams pa dang / yid la byas pas theg pa chen po lam bkod pa ni bdag cag gis nongs so snyam du 'gyod par gyur to //
analyzed: @238a * // bcom ldan 'das kyis ldem po ngag tu gsungs pa na ma rig pa nas thabs tsam du bstan pa thos ma thag tu gzung ba dang / bsgoms pa dang / bsams pa dang / yid la byas pas theg pa chen po lam bkod pa ni bdag cag gis nongs so snyam du 'gyod par gyur to //
translated: When the Bhagavat taught the indirect teachings, we immediately heard the teachings on the mere means from ignorance, and we thought, “It is our fault that we were placed on the path of the Great Vehicle through hearing, contemplating, and mentally engaging in those teachings.”

original: de la thos nas mya ngan zad pas dga' ba ni sngon theg pa chen po'i rnam par grol ba la skal pa med snyam du 'dzin te /
analyzed: de la thos nas mya ngan zad pas dga' ba ni sngon theg pa chen po'i rnam par grol ba la skal pa med snyam du 'dzin te /
translated: There, having heard that, we were delighted by the exhaustion of suffering. Previously, we thought that we did not have the fortune for liberation in the Great Vehicle.

original: de bcom ldan 'das la theg pa chung ngu gnyis nges pa'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das la theg pa chung ngu gnyis nges pa'i don ma yin te /
translated: We realized that the two Lesser Vehicles are not of definitive meaning,

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la skal pa yod par rtogs pas mya ngan zad nas dga' ba dang bsil ba thob pa gyur to /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la skal pa yod par rtogs pas mya ngan zad nas dga' ba dang bsil ba thob pa gyur to /
translated: and we attained the delight and coolness of the exhaustion of suffering through realizing that we have the fortune for the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: de ltar the tshom med pas bde ba dang bsil bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar the tshom med pas bde ba dang bsil bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, we became happy and cool through being free of doubt.

original: mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyi sras thu bo zhes pa nas yongs su gdung ba dang bral lo zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams byang chub thob par rtogs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyi sras thu bo zhes pa nas yongs su gdung ba dang bral lo zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams byang chub thob par rtogs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The sutra from “the foremost of the Lord’s sons” up to “free from all distress” teaches the realization of the attainment of enlightenment by the sons of the Buddha.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes thob cing sangs rgyas kyi thugs las byung bas sras thu bo'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes thob cing sangs rgyas kyi thugs las byung bas sras thu bo'o //
translated: They are the foremost sons because they have attained the wisdom of the aryas and have been born from the mind of the Buddha.

original: so so'i skye bo las gzhan pa ni thugs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo las gzhan pa ni thugs las byung ba'o //
translated: They are born from the mind because they are different from ordinary beings.

original: chos kyi gsung rab las byung bas zhal nas skyes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi gsung rab las byung bas zhal nas skyes pa'o //
translated: They are born from the mouth because they have been born from the speech of the excellent teaching of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rjes su tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni chos las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni chos las skyes pa'o //
translated: They are born from the Dharma because they are born from the Dharma through proper attention to the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sku'i rjes su de dang 'dra ba'i chos thob pa ni chos kyi sprul pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i rjes su de dang 'dra ba'i chos thob pa ni chos kyi sprul pa'o //
translated: They are emanations of the Dharma because they attain the Dharma that is similar to the Dharma body.

original: chos kyi nye mtshams chos kyis grub pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos rin po che la longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi nye mtshams chos kyis grub pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos rin po che la longs spyod pa ste /
translated: They are established by the Dharma because they enjoy the precious immaculate Dharma.

original: chos ni chos dkon mchog dang 'phags pa'i nor bdun no //
analyzed: chos ni chos dkon mchog dang 'phags pa'i nor bdun no //
translated: The Dharma is the jewel of the Dharma and the seven noble riches.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar chos la longs spyod pa dang 'dra bar bdag kyang chos kyi nor la longs spyod par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar chos la longs spyod pa dang 'dra bar bdag kyang chos kyi nor la longs spyod par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas enjoy the Dharma, so also I will enjoy the wealth of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi skyon dang bcas pa mi gtsang ba'i mngal nas skyes pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi skyon dang bcas pa mi gtsang ba'i mngal nas skyes pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The phrase sons of the Buddha is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from wombs that are impure and flawed by worldly faults.

original: thugs las byung ba ni pha ma'i khu ba mi gtsang ba las 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thugs las byung ba ni pha ma'i khu ba mi gtsang ba las 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase born from the mind is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the impure substances of the parents.

original: zhal nas skyes pa ni chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags las 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhal nas skyes pa ni chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags las 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase born from the mouth is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is not in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.

original: chos las skyes pa ni chos kyi sku'i rigs 'tshob pa bstan pa ste /🔽ji ltar bram ze dag rigs 'tshob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos las skyes pa ni chos kyi sku'i rigs 'tshob pa bstan pa ste / ji ltar bram ze dag rigs 'tshob pa bzhin no //
translated: The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.🔽The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born from the desire that is in accord with the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sprul pa ni chos kyi nor la longs spyod pa ste ji ltar 'jig rten na pha'i nor la bu dag spyod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sprul pa ni chos kyi nor la longs spyod pa ste ji ltar 'jig rten na pha'i nor la bu dag spyod pa bzhin no //
translated: The phrase born from the Dharma is meant to contrast with the fact that ordinary beings are born

original: mdo las de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las de nas tshe dang ldan pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Then the venerable Ananda, having risen from his seat,🔽having arranged his upper robe over one shoulder,🔽having placed his right knee on the ground,🔽having saluted the Lord with folded hands,🔽said this to the Lord:

original: @238b theg pa mchog 'dir bdag ni yongs smin mdzad //
analyzed: @238b theg pa mchog 'dir bdag ni yongs smin mdzad //
translated: I am fully ripened for this supreme vehicle.

original: ces pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad kyis bstan te /
analyzed: ces pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad kyis bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the verses from here on.

original: tshigs bcad nyi shu rtsa phyed dang drug la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshigs bcad nyi shu rtsa phyed dang drug la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two parts to the twenty-five and a half verses:

original: thog ma'i tshig phyed dang gsum gyis ni gleng ba bstan to //
analyzed: thog ma'i tshig phyed dang gsum gyis ni gleng ba bstan to //
translated: The first three and a half verses teach the introduction,

original: tshigs bcad nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis ni bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis ni bshad pa bstan to //
translated: and the twenty-three verses teach the explanation.

original: gleng pa bstan pa la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: gleng pa bstan pa la yang gnyis te /
translated: The teaching of the introduction is also twofold:

original: thog ma'i tshig gcig gis ni the tsom med pas rab tu dga' ba bstan ta //
analyzed: thog ma'i tshig gcig gis ni the tsom med pas rab tu dga' ba bstan ta //
translated: The first verse teaches the joy of being free from doubt,

original: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni the tsom dang mya ngan zad pas ngo mtshar du gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni the tsom dang mya ngan zad pas ngo mtshar du gyur pa bstan to //
translated: and the one and a half verses teach the wonder of the exhaustion of doubt and sorrow.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung de ngo mtshar gyur //
analyzed: mdo las / bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung de ngo mtshar gyur //
translated: The speech of the Sugata is wondrous!

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: gsung thos pa yis thams cad med par gyur //
analyzed: gsung thos pa yis thams cad med par gyur //
translated: By hearing this speech, all is destroyed.

original: zhes pa'i bar du the tsom dang mya ngan zad pas ngo mtshar du gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du the tsom dang mya ngan zad pas ngo mtshar du gyur pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is shown that they were amazed because their doubts and sorrow were dispelled.

original: sngon theg pa chen po ma thos pa the tshom dang mya ngan du 'gyur ba las da theg pa chen po thos pas the tsom dang mya ngan slos pa bsal zhes smos so //
analyzed: sngon theg pa chen po ma thos pa the tshom dang mya ngan du 'gyur ba las da theg pa chen po thos pas the tsom dang mya ngan slos pa bsal zhes smos so //
translated: It is said that they had doubts and sorrow because they had not previously heard the Mahayana, but now, having heard the Mahayana, their doubts and sorrow were dispelled.

original: mya ngan slos pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur du dogs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan slos pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur du dogs pa'o //
translated: Sorrow is the fear that one will not become a Buddha.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / gdugs la spyod cing phan tshun 'chi ba dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las / gdugs la spyod cing phan tshun 'chi ba dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: They were engaged in the parasol, and they died one after another.

original: kye ma sdig gi sems kyis bdag bslus pas //
analyzed: kye ma sdig gi sems kyis bdag bslus pas //
translated: Alas! I was deceived by a sinful mind.

original: zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad ni 'gyod pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad ni 'gyod pa bstan pa ste /
translated: From here on, it shows regret.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'gyod pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'gyod pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Alas! means extreme regret.

original: sngar theg pa chung ngu la gnas pas theg pa chen po la skal pa med pa tsam du 'dzin pas sdig pa'i sems kyis bslus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngar theg pa chung ngu la gnas pas theg pa chen po la skal pa med pa tsam du 'dzin pas sdig pa'i sems kyis bslus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that they were deceived by a sinful mind because, by abiding in the Hinayana, they held the Mahayana to be unworthy, and thus were deceived.

original: mdo las / zag pa med pa'i chos su 'dra ba la //
analyzed: mdo las / zag pa med pa'i chos su 'dra ba la //
translated: In the same way, they are similar in the uncontaminated dharma.🔽Up to: I will not explain.

original: zhes pa nas 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du tshig 'di ni cis 'gyod pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa nas 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du tshig 'di ni cis 'gyod pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage shows the regret of the bodhisattvas.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings yang dag pa nyid de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings yang dag pa nyid de /
translated: The uncontaminated dharmadhatu is reality.

original: shes pa med pa dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas su 'gyur zhing chos 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: shes pa med pa dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas su 'gyur zhing chos 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Those who do not know that will not become buddhas in the future and will not explain the dharma.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / bdag ni sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan las nyams //
analyzed: mdo las / bdag ni sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan las nyams //
translated: I have fallen from the thirty-two marks.🔽Up to: I am confused.

original: zhes pa nas bdag rmongs so zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang drug gis chos chen po las nyams pas 'gyod pa bstan pa ste 'di la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye'o //
analyzed: zhes pa nas bdag rmongs so zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang drug gis chos chen po las nyams pas 'gyod pa bstan pa ste 'di la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye'o //
translated: From here onward, the next six and a half verses show the regret of falling from the great dharma. This also has two parts.

original: de la yang tshig phyed dang bzhis ni chos chen po gang nyams pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la yang tshig phyed dang bzhis ni chos chen po gang nyams pa bstan te /
translated: In the first four and a half verses, it shows what the great dharma is that they have fallen from.

original: tshigs bcad gnyis kyis ni bdag 'gyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad gnyis kyis ni bdag 'gyod pa bstan to //
translated: In the next two verses, it shows their regret.

original: chos gang nyams pa bstan pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /🔽thog ma'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis ni phyi nang gi @239a * //
analyzed: chos gang nyams pa bstan pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste / thog ma'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis ni phyi nang gi @239a * //
translated: The teaching on the degeneration of any dharma is also divided into two.

original: mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: The first two verses teach the qualities of being adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni grags pa dang rnyed pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: tshig phyed dang gnyis kyis ni grags pa dang rnyed pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: The last one and a half verses teach the qualities of fame and gain.

original: mtshan gyis brgyan pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshan gyis brgyan pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Being adorned with the major and minor marks is also twofold.

original: tshigs bcad gcig gis ni mtshan rdzogs pas bdud btul ba'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad gcig gis ni mtshan rdzogs pas bdud btul ba'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: One verse teaches the quality of subduing demons through perfecting the major marks.

original: tshigs bcad gcig gis ni dpe byad rdzogs pas ma 'dres pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs bcad gcig gis ni dpe byad rdzogs pas ma 'dres pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: One verse teaches the quality of being unmixed through perfecting the minor marks.

original: 'dir ni mtshan rdzogs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'dir ni mtshan rdzogs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: Here it is the quality of perfecting the major marks.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po las rgyas par bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po las rgyas par bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The so-called thirty-two major marks are explained extensively in the Great Perfection of Wisdom.🔽A sutra says:

original: mdo las / thub pa chen po'i dpe byad bzang po gang //
analyzed: mdo las / thub pa chen po'i dpe byad bzang po gang //
translated: The good minor marks of the Great Sage🔽...

original: zhes pa nas ;
analyzed: zhes pa nas ;

original: de las bdag cag nyams shing ches bslus so //
analyzed: de las bdag cag nyams shing ches bslus so //
translated: We have been deceived and have fallen away from that.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni dpe byad bzang po rdzogs pas ma 'dres pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni dpe byad bzang po rdzogs pas ma 'dres pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to here, the qualities of the unmixed are taught by the perfection of the excellent minor marks.
