analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mang po yang dag 'dzud //
translated: I will lead many bodhisattvas to the highest state.

original: zhes pa'i bar du theg pa chen po la phyogs pa'i rgyu chen po bskyed pas sangs rgyas su 'grub cing lha dang mi la sogs pas mchod pa dang ; byang chub sems dpa' mang po bla na med pa'i gnas su 'jog par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du theg pa chen po la phyogs pa'i rgyu chen po bskyed pas sangs rgyas su 'grub cing lha dang mi la sogs pas mchod pa dang ; byang chub sems dpa' mang po bla na med pa'i gnas su 'jog par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that by generating the great cause of turning to the Great Vehicle, one will accomplish Buddhahood, and will be worshipped by gods, humans, and so forth, and will establish many bodhisattvas in the unsurpassed state.🔽The sutra says, Having thus requested, the Lord said to the venerable Śāriputra, and continues up to I became his disciple. From here onward, the noble Śāriputra's past conduct

original: mdo las de skad ces gsol pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes pa nas nga'i rjes su slob par gyur to zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i sngon gyi spyod
analyzed: mdo las de skad ces gsol pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes pa nas nga'i rjes su slob par gyur to zhes pa'i bar du 'di man chad 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i sngon gyi spyod
translated: and attainment of the state of an arhat are taught.

original: pa bstan pa dang da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dang phrad pa dang / phyis kyang yang dag pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba ston pa la 'di ni dang po'o //🔽sh'a ri'i bu sngon sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig mang po'i thad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa las bram zhes mig @241a * //
analyzed: pa bstan pa dang da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dang phrad pa dang / phyis kyang yang dag pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba ston pa la 'di ni dang po'o // sh'a ri'i bu sngon sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig mang po'i thad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa las bram zhes mig @241a * //
translated: This is the first of the teachings on the past, present and future.

original: bslangs te / mig byin pa dang / mig sa la brdzis te don med par byas pa dang / sems chen po las nur te theg pa chung du la zhugs pa sngon gyi spyod pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bslangs te / mig byin pa dang / mig sa la brdzis te don med par byas pa dang / sems chen po las nur te theg pa chung du la zhugs pa sngon gyi spyod pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Shariputra, in the past, having practiced the bodhisattva deeds in the presence of many trillions of buddhas, he was asked for his eyes by a brahmin, and he gave his eyes, and he trampled his eyes on the ground and made them useless, and he turned away from the great mind and entered the lesser vehicle. This is the teaching on his past conduct.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu khyod byang chub sems dpa'i man ngag dang zhes pa nas pa'i gsung rab 'di las skyes par gyur to zhes pa'i bar du ni da ltar gyi dus nas sangs rgyas dang phrad pa bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu khyod byang chub sems dpa'i man ngag dang zhes pa nas pa'i gsung rab 'di las skyes par gyur to zhes pa'i bar du ni da ltar gyi dus nas sangs rgyas dang phrad pa bstan te /
translated: Shariputra, you are the foremost of those who have attained the eye of Dharma, and so on up to, you have been born from this teaching of the Tathagata. This teaches that in the present time he has met the Buddha.

original: sngon spyod pa chen po las nyams pa dang thabs kyis bsgyur te stong pa zag pa med pa'i ye shes rtogs shing theg pa chen po'i chos la gnas par gyur pa 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung de las skyes pa'o ;
analyzed: sngon spyod pa chen po las nyams pa dang thabs kyis bsgyur te stong pa zag pa med pa'i ye shes rtogs shing theg pa chen po'i chos la gnas par gyur pa 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung de las skyes pa'o ;
translated: This very fact that he fell from the great practice in the past, transformed it by means of skillful means, realized the emptiness of uncontaminated pristine wisdom, and came to abide in the Mahayana Dharma was born from the Tathagata's speech.

original: / mdo las sh'a ri'i bu khyod 'di ltar zhes pa nas mya ngan las 'das so snyam du sems te zhes pa'i bar du ni phyis yang dag pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba bstan te /
analyzed: / mdo las sh'a ri'i bu khyod 'di ltar zhes pa nas mya ngan las 'das so snyam du sems te zhes pa'i bar du ni phyis yang dag pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba bstan te /
translated: From the sutra, Shariputra, you think... up to you think they have attained nirvana, it teaches that later they will abide in reality.

original: mi dran nas zhes pa ni drang ba'i don la brten cing nges pa'i don brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mi dran nas zhes pa ni drang ba'i don la brten cing nges pa'i don brjod pa'o //
translated: Not remembering means relying on the provisional meaning and expressing the definitive meaning.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos pa'i ye shes dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid mthar phyin pa'i gnas tsam du gnas shing theg pa chen po'i ye shes dang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos pa'i ye shes dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid mthar phyin pa'i gnas tsam du gnas shing theg pa chen po'i ye shes dang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: The noble shravakas merely abide in the state of perfected wisdom and nirvana, and do not accomplish the Mahayana wisdom and nirvana.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu ngas khyod kyi spyod pa dang zhes pa nas nyan thos pa rnams la yang dag par bstan to zhes pa'i bar du sngon theg pa chen po spyod pa'i sems dran pa dang bskul ba ste /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu ngas khyod kyi spyod pa dang zhes pa nas nyan thos pa rnams la yang dag par bstan to zhes pa'i bar du sngon theg pa chen po spyod pa'i sems dran pa dang bskul ba ste /
translated: The sutra from “Śāriputra, I have taught your conduct” up to “I have taught it to the śrāvakas” is the recollection of the mind that previously practiced the Mahāyāna and the exhortation.

original: dam pa'i chos dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa byang chub sems dpa' la gdams pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gzung ba ni mdo sde 'di nyid kyi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa byang chub sems dpa' la gdams pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gzung ba ni mdo sde 'di nyid kyi rnam grangs te /
translated: The teaching of the inconceivable Dharma, the instructions to the bodhisattvas, and the support of the buddhas are synonyms of this very sūtra.

original: 'di theg pa chen po la 'jug pa'i thabs dang spyod pa thob par 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di theg pa chen po la 'jug pa'i thabs dang spyod pa thob par 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the method for entering the Mahāyāna and the attainment of the conduct.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu khyod ni 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes pa nas 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad dum bu bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu khyod ni 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes pa nas 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad dum bu bzhir dbye ste /
translated: The sutra from “Śāriputra, you should think in this way” up to “having perfected these” is divided into four sections below.

original: sngar lung bstan pa dang / lha dang mis mchod cing bstod pa'o //
analyzed: sngar lung bstan pa dang / lha dang mis mchod cing bstod pa'o //
translated: The first is the prophecy and the worship and praise by gods and humans.

original: dang po la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po la yang gnyis te /
translated: The first has two parts:

original: rgyu'i sgo nas lung bstan pa dang / 'bras bu'i sgo nas lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgo nas lung bstan pa dang / 'bras bu'i sgo nas lung bstan pa'o //
translated: The prediction is from the point of view of cause and from the point of view of effect.

original: de'i dang po la yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i dang po la yang bzhi ste /
translated: The first of these is fourfold.

original: bskal pa tshad med ces pa ni dus bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa tshad med ces pa ni dus bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement “in an immeasurable eon” indicates the time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bye ba khrag khrig ces pa ni bshes gnyen dam pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bye ba khrag khrig ces pa ni bshes gnyen dam pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement “ten billion thus-gone ones” indicates the excellent friend.🔽The statement “upholding the true Dharma and having benefited many beings” indicates the cause.

original: dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang / sems can mang po la phan pa sna tshogs byas nas bla na med pa'i @241b sangs rgyas su 'grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang / sems can mang po la phan pa sna tshogs byas nas bla na med pa'i @241b sangs rgyas su 'grub ces pa'o //
translated: The statement “will attain unsurpassed buddhahood” indicates the effect.

original: mdo las pad mo'i 'od ces bya ba zhes pa nas 'jig rten du 'byung ngo zhes pa'i bar du ni 'bras bu dngos su lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las pad mo'i 'od ces bya ba zhes pa nas 'jig rten du 'byung ngo zhes pa'i bar du ni 'bras bu dngos su lung bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement “in the sutra, ‘Padma-prabha’…” up to “…will appear in the world” is the actual prediction of the effect.

original: de yang tshig rkyang pa dang tshigs su bcad pa dbye'o //
analyzed: de yang tshig rkyang pa dang tshigs su bcad pa dbye'o //
translated: This is divided into prose and verse.

original: tshig rkyang pa la yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: tshig rkyang pa la yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The prose is also sixfold.

original: nang gi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ; phyi'i zhing rgyan dam pa dang ldan pa dang / chos ston pa'i lugs gcig pa dang bskal ba'i ming mi mthun pa dang / 'khor bzang ngan dang chos gnas pa'i yun ring thung dang drug las 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: nang gi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ; phyi'i zhing rgyan dam pa dang ldan pa dang / chos ston pa'i lugs gcig pa dang bskal ba'i ming mi mthun pa dang / 'khor bzang ngan dang chos gnas pa'i yun ring thung dang drug las 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: The first of these is the name of the buddhafield, which is the name of the buddha who will appear there.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan 'dogs pa yang la la ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas mthong ba las dras te mtshan btags pa dang sems bskyed pa'i sgo dang / mtshan ma las mtshan 'dogs pa dang / yul dang sems can gyi don mdzad pa las mtshan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan 'dogs pa yang la la ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas mthong ba las dras te mtshan btags pa dang sems bskyed pa'i sgo dang / mtshan ma las mtshan 'dogs pa dang / yul dang sems can gyi don mdzad pa las mtshan 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The names of buddhas are also given in various ways: some are given according to what they have seen in the past, such as Dipamkara, who was so named because the other bodhisattvas saw light radiating from his forehead when he generated the mind of enlightenment; some are given according to their marks, such as Sakyamuni, who was so named because he was born into the Shakya family; some are given according to their deeds, such as Kashyapa, who was so named because his father was called the “sun” and his mother the “moon.”

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan padmo'i 'od ces btags pa ni me tog gi char ba bcing 'od kyis snang bar mdzad pas de bzhin gshegs pa padmo'i ye shes 'od kyis snang bar mdzad pa las padmo'i 'od ces gdags pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan padmo'i 'od ces btags pa ni me tog gi char ba bcing 'od kyis snang bar mdzad pas de bzhin gshegs pa padmo'i ye shes 'od kyis snang bar mdzad pa las padmo'i 'od ces gdags pa dang /
translated: The noble Shariputra was given the name Lotus Light when he attained full awakening. He was called Lotus Light because he illuminated with the light of a rain of flowers, and because the Tathagata Lotus Wisdom Light illuminated him.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi ro myong bas ye shes kyi 'od shar te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi ro myong bas ye shes kyi 'od shar te /
translated: The light of wisdom arose from the taste of the sublime Dharma.

original: theg pa rnam pa gnyis la snang bar mdzad pa'i padmo'i 'od ces btags so //
analyzed: theg pa rnam pa gnyis la snang bar mdzad pa'i padmo'i 'od ces btags so //
translated: He was called Lotus Light because he illuminated the two types of vehicles.

original: de la lung ston pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la lung ston pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of predictions:

original: ci'i phyir lung ston pa dang / sus lung ston pa dang / dogs pa bsal ba dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung ston pa dang / sus lung ston pa dang / dogs pa bsal ba dang bzhi'o //
translated: the reason for the prediction, who gives the prediction, and dispelling doubts.

original: ci'i phyir lung bstan pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung bstan pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The reason for the prediction is fivefold:

original: 'phags pa nyan thos pa'i rnams nges pa'i sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos pa'i rnams nges pa'i sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: The noble Shravakas give rise to the definite mind.

original: nyan thos pa'i chos nyid ma yin pa dang / bdag med pa dang rnam gnyis nyan thos pas chud par bya ba ma yin par sems pa dag sems nges pas theg pa chen po la bzhugs pa'i phyir lung bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku mnyam pa nyid 'dus byas kyi dbye ba tsam du zad kyi theg pa rnam gsum yang dag pa'i gzhung mi mthun pa med par lung bstan pa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos pa'i chos nyid ma yin pa dang / bdag med pa dang rnam gnyis nyan thos pas chud par bya ba ma yin par sems pa dag sems nges pas theg pa chen po la bzhugs pa'i phyir lung bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku mnyam pa nyid 'dus byas kyi dbye ba tsam du zad kyi theg pa rnam gsum yang dag pa'i gzhung mi mthun pa med par lung bstan pa dang /
translated: The prediction was made in order to establish in the Great Vehicle those who think that the reality of the Listeners' Vehicle is not the reality of the Great Vehicle, that the two kinds of no-self are not to be realized by the Listeners, and that the Listeners' Vehicle is not the ultimate refuge.🔽The prediction was made in order to establish in the Great Vehicle those who think that the Thus-Gone One’s dharmakāya is the same, that the three vehicles are not different, and that the Listeners and the Self-realized Buddhas are not ultimately different from the bodhisattvas.🔽The prediction was made in order to eliminate the doubts of the noble bodhisattvas who think that the Listeners will never attain the nirvāṇa of the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa nyan thos pa rnams theg pa chen po'i mya ngan las 'das pa gtan mi 'thog pa tsam du sems pa'i the tshom bcad pa'i phyir lung bstan pa dang / lung bstan pa 'dis kun la sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i rgyu yod par bstan pas sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa la mang po gzud pa'i phyir lung bstan @242a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa nyan thos pa rnams theg pa chen po'i mya ngan las 'das pa gtan mi 'thog pa tsam du sems pa'i the tshom bcad pa'i phyir lung bstan pa dang / lung bstan pa 'dis kun la sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i rgyu yod par bstan pas sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa la mang po gzud pa'i phyir lung bstan @242a * //
translated: This prediction was made in order to establish in the Buddha’s conduct many beings by teaching that all have the cause for buddhahood.

original: pa dang ; theg pa gcig po 'di rtogs pas lung bstan pa dang lnga'o //
analyzed: pa dang ; theg pa gcig po 'di rtogs pas lung bstan pa dang lnga'o //
translated: and the prediction by understanding this one vehicle.

original: sus lung ston pa ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: sus lung ston pa ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The one who predicts is threefold:

original: ci la gnas pa dang lung ston pa'i rang bzhin dang / lung ston pa'i las so //
analyzed: ci la gnas pa dang lung ston pa'i rang bzhin dang / lung ston pa'i las so //
translated: the basis of the prediction, the nature of the prediction, and the action of the prediction.

original: ci la gnas te lung ston pa ni lung ston pa rnam pa drug las /
analyzed: ci la gnas te lung ston pa ni lung ston pa rnam pa drug las /
translated: The basis of the prediction is the six kinds of prediction.

original: lnga ni bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig gis mkhyen cing lung ston /
analyzed: lnga ni bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig gis mkhyen cing lung ston /
translated: Five of these are known and predicted by the Lord alone,

original: gcig ni byang chub sems dpas lung ston te /
analyzed: gcig ni byang chub sems dpas lung ston te /
translated: and one is predicted by the Bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas lung ston pa lnga ni bye brag tu lung ston pa dang / mthun par lung ston pa dang / phyis lung ston pa dang / bkol ba med pa'i lung ston pa dang / spyod pa las lung ston pa'o//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas lung ston pa lnga ni bye brag tu lung ston pa dang / mthun par lung ston pa dang / phyis lung ston pa dang / bkol ba med pa'i lung ston pa dang / spyod pa las lung ston pa'o//
translated: The five kinds of prediction by the Tathagata are: prediction of the particular, prediction of the general, prediction of the future, prediction without prompting, and prediction of conduct.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni rgyu dang ldan pa tsam la lung ston te //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni rgyu dang ldan pa tsam la lung ston te //
translated: The Bodhisattva predicts merely on the basis of the cause.

original: ji ltar rtag tu mi brnyas byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes lung ston pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag tu mi brnyas byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes lung ston pa ste /
translated: Just as the Bodhisattva is always not despised, so he is a predictor of all beings, saying, “You have the nature of the Tathāgata.”

original: lung ston par nus pa de gnyis las gzhan med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lung ston par nus pa de gnyis las gzhan med do zhes pa'o //
translated: There is no other predictor than these two.

original: lung ston pa'i rang bzhin ni phyis thob pa'i ye shes dang / kun rdzob kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: lung ston pa'i rang bzhin ni phyis thob pa'i ye shes dang / kun rdzob kyi ye shes so //
translated: The nature of the predictor is the subsequent pristine wisdom and the conventional pristine wisdom.

original: lung ston pa'i las ni tshig gis spyod pa ste /
analyzed: lung ston pa'i las ni tshig gis spyod pa ste /
translated: The action of the predictor is the verbal activity.

original: sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa la ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽sus lung ston pa ni gang la brten pa dang rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa la ldan pa dang bcas pa'o // sus lung ston pa ni gang la brten pa dang rang bzhin no //
translated: It is associated with the emanation body, etc.🔽The one who predicts is based on the support and the nature.

original: gang lung bstan par bya ba nyid gang la brten pa ste /
analyzed: gang lung bstan par bya ba nyid gang la brten pa ste /
translated: The one who is to be predicted is based on the support.

original: lung bstan par bya ba rnam pa drug la /
analyzed: lung bstan par bya ba rnam pa drug la /
translated: There are six kinds of those to be predicted.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa nyan thos chen po bzhi so sor phye ste lung bstan pa dang / 'phags pa gang po la sogs pa dge slong lnga brgya mtshan gcig pa la sogs pa spyir mthun par lung bstan pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa dbang po zhan pa rnams phyis lung bstan pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa nyan thos chen po bzhi so sor phye ste lung bstan pa dang / 'phags pa gang po la sogs pa dge slong lnga brgya mtshan gcig pa la sogs pa spyir mthun par lung bstan pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa dbang po zhan pa rnams phyis lung bstan pa dang /
translated: Those of weak faculties, such as those in training and those no longer in training, were predicted later.

original: lhas byin lta bu lung bstan pas bkol ba med par lung bstan pa dang / spyod pa las lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lhas byin lta bu lung bstan pas bkol ba med par lung bstan pa dang / spyod pa las lung bstan pa ste /
translated: Those who were not to be trained, such as Devadatta, were predicted without being trained.

original: dge slong ma dang lha'i bu mo la sogs pa lung bstan pa dang / rgyu dang ldan pa tsam las lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma dang lha'i bu mo la sogs pa lung bstan pa dang / rgyu dang ldan pa tsam las lung bstan pa ste /
translated: The prediction of conduct is the prediction of nuns, daughters of gods, and so forth.

original: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par lung bstan pa ste /
translated: The prediction of mere possession of the cause is the prediction that all sentient beings possess the essence of buddhahood.

original: zhib tu mdo 'di nyid kyi so so'i le'u las 'byung ba bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhib tu mdo 'di nyid kyi so so'i le'u las 'byung ba bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: This should be applied in detail according to what appears in each chapter of this very sutra.

original: dogs pa bsal ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos pa rnams lung bstan pa nges par sangs rgyas su 'grub pa yin nam /
analyzed: dogs pa bsal ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos pa rnams lung bstan pa nges par sangs rgyas su 'grub pa yin nam /
translated: If it is certain that the noble sravakas are predicted to become buddhas,

original: thabs kyis bstan /
analyzed: thabs kyis bstan /
translated: then it is taught by means of an example.

original: de ste nges par 'grub pa yin na ni byang chub sems dpa'i @242b spyod pa rlabs po che de snyed spyad kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de ste nges par 'grub pa yin na ni byang chub sems dpa'i @242b spyod pa rlabs po che de snyed spyad kyang ci dgos /
translated: If it is certain that they will become buddhas, then what is the need for them to practice the bodhisattvas' vast activities?

original: de ste nges par 'grub pa ma yin na ni 'grub par ci'i phyir lung bstan /🔽de ni 'phags pa nyan thos pa rnams theg pa chen por nges pa'i sems bskyed pa la dgongs te lung bstan gyi grub zin pa'i rang bzhin las lung bstan pa ma yin pa dang / yang de bzhin gshegs pas theg pa gsum mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de ste nges par 'grub pa ma yin na ni 'grub par ci'i phyir lung bstan / de ni 'phags pa nyan thos pa rnams theg pa chen por nges pa'i sems bskyed pa la dgongs te lung bstan gyi grub zin pa'i rang bzhin las lung bstan pa ma yin pa dang / yang de bzhin gshegs pas theg pa gsum mnyam pa ste /
translated: If it is not certain that they will become buddhas, then why are they predicted to become buddhas?🔽The noble sravakas are predicted to become buddhas with the intention that they will generate the mind intent on the Mahayana, but they are not predicted to become buddhas based on their already having the nature of having become buddhas.

original: theg pa gcig por bsdu zhing chos kyi sku dang / 'phags pa nyan thos pas lus su yang mnyam pa nyid pas lung bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: theg pa gcig por bsdu zhing chos kyi sku dang / 'phags pa nyan thos pas lus su yang mnyam pa nyid pas lung bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The Tathagata subsumes the three vehicles into the single vehicle and predicts that the noble sravakas will become buddhas because they are equal in terms of the dharmakaya and because they are equal in terms of the arya sravakas' bodies.

original: spyod pa dang yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa'i sgo nas lung bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa dang yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa'i sgo nas lung bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a prediction in terms of all the perfections of conduct and qualities.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de'i tshe na zhes pa nas lha dang mi mang pos rab tu gang zhes pa'i bar du ni phyi'i zhing rgyan dam pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de'i tshe na zhes pa nas lha dang mi mang pos rab tu gang zhes pa'i bar du ni phyi'i zhing rgyan dam pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The sutra from “At that time, Shariputra” up to “filled with many gods and humans” describes the outer realm endowed with the excellent ornaments.

original: zhing rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhing rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the pure realm.

original: de la yang dga' ba 'ba' zhig gis bskyed pa'i phyir rdul med pa'i phyir zhing zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang dga' ba 'ba' zhig gis bskyed pa'i phyir rdul med pa'i phyir zhing zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is generated only by joy, it is called a realm because it is free from dust.

original: dri ma'i skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma'i skyon med pa'o //
translated: This is free from the fault of stains.

original: nga rgyal gyi sems spangs pas na mnyam zhing mtho dman med pa dang / sems can gyi sems rnam par dag pa phyir zhing rnam par dag pa rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa dang / gsod pa dang 'phrogs pa'i sems dang bral ba'i phyir bde ba skyed pa nad dang mu ge med pa'i zhing dang /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi sems spangs pas na mnyam zhing mtho dman med pa dang / sems can gyi sems rnam par dag pa phyir zhing rnam par dag pa rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa dang / gsod pa dang 'phrogs pa'i sems dang bral ba'i phyir bde ba skyed pa nad dang mu ge med pa'i zhing dang /
translated: Since the mind of pride is abandoned, it is even, without high and low, and since the minds of sentient beings are pure, the realm is pure, adorned with various ornaments, and since it is free from the minds of killing and stealing, it is a realm that generates bliss, free from sickness and famine.

original: sdig pa'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba'i phyir lha dang mis yongs su rgyas pa'o //🔽mdo las beed'urya las byas pa zhes bya ba nas me tog 'bras bur ldan no zhes pa'i bar du ni sems kyi skyon dang bral ba'i phyir zhing bee d'urya ltar rnam par dag pa stong pa brgyad la gnas shing 'phags pa'i lam brgyad sgrub pa'i phyir gser gyi
analyzed: sdig pa'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba'i phyir lha dang mis yongs su rgyas pa'o // mdo las beed'urya las byas pa zhes bya ba nas me tog 'bras bur ldan no zhes pa'i bar du ni sems kyi skyon dang bral ba'i phyir zhing bee d'urya ltar rnam par dag pa stong pa brgyad la gnas shing 'phags pa'i lam brgyad sgrub pa'i phyir gser gyi
translated: It is filled with gods and men because it is free from sinful friends.

original: thig gis phyogs brgyad du re'u mig bris pa'o //
analyzed: thig gis phyogs brgyad du re'u mig bris pa'o //
translated: The sutra states, “made of beryl” up to “flowers and fruits.” Because it is free from the faults of mind, the ground is pure like beryl, and because it is the basis of the eight liberations and the accomplishment of the eightfold noble path, it is marked with golden lines in the eight directions.

original: gzungs gzhi la gnas pa'i phyir skyed mos tshal dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gzungs gzhi la gnas pa'i phyir skyed mos tshal dang ldan pa /
translated: Because it is the basis of the dhāraṇīs, it has a pleasure grove.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun spyod pa'i phyir rin po che'i shing me tog dang / 'bras bur ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun spyod pa'i phyir rin po che'i shing me tog dang / 'bras bur ldan pa'o //
translated: Because it is the practice of the seven factors of enlightenment, it has jeweled trees with flowers and fruits.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu padmo'i 'od de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa nas theg pa gsum nyid brtsams te chos ston zhes pa'i bar du ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang chos ston pa'i lugs mthun pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu padmo'i 'od de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa nas theg pa gsum nyid brtsams te chos ston zhes pa'i bar du ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang chos ston pa'i lugs mthun pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The sutra from “Shariputra, the Tathagata Padma Shine” up to “he teaches the Dharma beginning with the three vehicles” teaches the system of teaching the Dharma of the past tathagatas.

original: de la sngar ni lugs mthun pa bstan /
analyzed: de la sngar ni lugs mthun pa bstan /
translated: In that, the forward system is taught.

original: de'i 'og tu ni de'i gtan tshigs bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni de'i gtan tshigs bstan te /
translated: After that, the reason for that is taught.

original: zhing rnam par dag pa zhes smos pa nyid sprul pa'i zhing du lta'o //
analyzed: zhing rnam par dag pa zhes smos pa nyid sprul pa'i zhing du lta'o //
translated: The phrase “pure realm” itself is seen as a manifested realm.

original: mdo las gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas smon lam gyi dbang gis chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni @243a * //
analyzed: mdo las gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas smon lam gyi dbang gis chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni @243a * //
translated: The sutra from “Furthermore, Shariputra” up to “he teaches the Dharma through the power of aspiration”

original: de'i gtan tshigs bstan te /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs bstan te /
translated: teaches the reason for that.

original: sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang thabs la mkhas pa'i smon lam gyi dbang gis 'jig rten rnyog pa'i dus su byung zhing chos ston pa bzhin padmo'i de bzhin gshegs pa yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthu bzhin drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi sems can
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang thabs la mkhas pa'i smon lam gyi dbang gis 'jig rten rnyog pa'i dus su byung zhing chos ston pa bzhin padmo'i de bzhin gshegs pa yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthu bzhin drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi sems can
translated: The Tathagata Sakyamuni, through the power of his aspirations of skill in means, appeared in a time of degeneration and taught the Dharma.

original: rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: rnams la chos ston to //
translated: Likewise, the Tathagata Padma, in accordance with the power of his past aspirations, taught the Dharma to beings of provisional and definitive meaning.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu bskal ba de'i ming zhes pa nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rin po che zhes bya ste zhes pa'i bar du ni bskal pa mi mthun pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu bskal ba de'i ming zhes pa nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rin po che zhes bya ste zhes pa'i bar du ni bskal pa mi mthun pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The sutra from Shaariputra, the name of that eon... up to ...the bodhisattvas are called Ratnas teaches the dissimilar eons.

original: mdo las de'i tshe de'i dus zhes pa nas mang por byung ste zhes pa'i bar du ni 'khor gyi khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las de'i tshe de'i dus zhes pa nas mang por byung ste zhes pa'i bar du ni 'khor gyi khyad par bstan te /
translated: The sutra from At that time, at that moment... up to ...many appeared teaches the distinctions of the retinue.

original: de yang so sor smos pa dang / spyir bsdu ba la /
analyzed: de yang so sor smos pa dang / spyir bsdu ba la /
translated: This has specific and general summaries.

original: dang po la rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: dang po la rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: The first has ten aspects.

original: 'di ni grangs dpag tu med pa ji ltar tsan dan gyi tshal tsan dan gyis bskor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni grangs dpag tu med pa ji ltar tsan dan gyi tshal tsan dan gyis bskor ba bzhin no //
translated: This is like countless figures, like a sandalwood forest surrounded by sandalwood.

original: mdo las de bzhin gshegs pas bgrangs ba ni zhes pa nas rin po che'i padmo'i steng nas 'gro ba zhes pa'i bar du ni rin po che padmo'i steng nas 'gro ba ston te /
analyzed: mdo las de bzhin gshegs pas bgrangs ba ni zhes pa nas rin po che'i padmo'i steng nas 'gro ba zhes pa'i bar du ni rin po che padmo'i steng nas 'gro ba ston te /
translated: The sutra states, from the Tathagata's enumeration up to moving on the jeweled lotus, which shows moving on the jeweled lotus.

original: de yang sems rnam pa dag pa dgu la rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir te rnam par dag pa dgu ni tshul khrims dang sems dang ldan pa dang the tshom dang bral ba dang lam shes pa dang spyod pa shes pa dang smon lam shes pa dang /
analyzed: de yang sems rnam pa dag pa dgu la rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir te rnam par dag pa dgu ni tshul khrims dang sems dang ldan pa dang the tshom dang bral ba dang lam shes pa dang spyod pa shes pa dang smon lam shes pa dang /
translated: That is because one always abides in the nine pure aspects of mind. The nine pure aspects are: possessing morality, possessing mind, being free from doubt, knowing the path, knowing conduct, knowing aspiration,

original: mi dmigs par 'gog pa dang zhing rnam par dag pa ste dgu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs par 'gog pa dang zhing rnam par dag pa ste dgu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: non-apprehending cessation, and pure realm. It is because one possesses these nine.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dman pa she dag pa las thob pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dman pa she dag pa las thob pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not obtained from inferior roots of virtue.

original: mdo las dge ba'i rtsa ba yun ring po nas spyad pa zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su bstod pa zhes pa'i bar du ni de yang yon tan gnyis te /
analyzed: mdo las dge ba'i rtsa ba yun ring po nas spyad pa zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su bstod pa zhes pa'i bar du ni de yang yon tan gnyis te /
translated: This has two qualities:

original: yun ring po nas smon lam chen po btag pa'i dbang gis thos pa phun sum tshogs shing mang po kun gyis shes pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po nas smon lam chen po btag pa'i dbang gis thos pa phun sum tshogs shing mang po kun gyis shes pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: Because they have made great prayers for a long time, they are teachers who have perfected learning and are known by many.🔽The sutra states:🔽Those who strive for the wisdom of the Buddha...🔽and that realm will be filled.

original: mdo las sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la brtson pa zhes pa nas zhing de yongs su gang bar 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du ni bla na med pa'i mos pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mdo las sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la brtson pa zhes pa nas zhing de yongs su gang bar 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du ni bla na med pa'i mos pa dang ldan pa /
translated: This is connected with those who have unsurpassed interest,

original: snying rje chen pos 'gro ba 'dren par sems pa bsam bdag pas g-yo dang sgyu med pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos 'gro ba 'dren par sems pa bsam bdag pas g-yo dang sgyu med pa /
translated: who think of leading beings with great compassion, who are without deceit or fraud due to the nature of their thoughts,

original: sems spyod pa phyir ma nur pa nyon mongs pa mi bskyod pa'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa dag gis zhing de yongs su gang zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems spyod pa phyir ma nur pa nyon mongs pa mi bskyod pa'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa dag gis zhing de yongs su gang zhes sbyar ro //
translated: and who are mindful due to not regressing in their mental conduct and not producing afflictions.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar yang zhes pa nas bskal pa brgyad du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa gnas pa'i yun ring thung yod par bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar yang zhes pa nas bskal pa brgyad du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das de'i bstan pa gnas pa'i yun ring thung yod par bstan te /
translated: The passage from “Śāriputra, it is like this” to “for eight eons” teaches the duration of the teaching of that Bhagavān.

original: de bzhin gshegs @243b pa'i sku tshe'i tshad dang skye ba dang sangs rgyas su grub pa lung bstan pa dang / bstan pa ji srid du gnas pa bstan pa la 'di ni dang po'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa ni sems can bsod nams dang shes rab chung bas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku tshe yang thung bar bstan padmo'i 'od de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing na sems can bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan ma bshad kyang dge ba la rab tu rtsol
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @243b pa'i sku tshe'i tshad dang skye ba dang sangs rgyas su grub pa lung bstan pa dang / bstan pa ji srid du gnas pa bstan pa la 'di ni dang po'o // bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa ni sems can bsod nams dang shes rab chung bas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku tshe yang thung bar bstan padmo'i 'od de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing na sems can bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan ma bshad kyang dge ba la rab tu rtsol
translated: This is the first of the teachings on the lifespan of the Tathāgata, his birth, his attainment of buddhahood, his predictions, and the duration of his teaching.🔽Since the beings in the realm of the Tathāgata Padmaprabha have little merit and wisdom, the Bhagavān’s lifespan is taught to be short.

original: zhing bsod nams shes rab che ba sha dag pas sku tshe yang ring ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhing bsod nams shes rab che ba sha dag pas sku tshe yang ring ba bstan to //
translated: But in the realm of the Tathāgata Padmaprabha, the beings strive in virtue and have great merit and wisdom, so the Bhagavān’s lifespan is taught to be long.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu padmo'i 'od ces pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu padmo'i 'od ces pa nas /
translated: The passage from “Śāriputra, it is like this” to “for eight eons” teaches the duration of the teaching of that Bhagavān.

original: byang chub tu lung bstan nas zhes pa'i bar du ni ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas su 'grub pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu lung bstan nas zhes pa'i bar du ni ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas su 'grub pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to the point “he was predicted to enlightenment” indicates that he will become a Buddha in the future.

original: de yang dang por dus bstan /
analyzed: de yang dang por dus bstan /
translated: Moreover, first the time is indicated.

original: de'i 'og tu dngos su lung bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dngos su lung bstan /
translated: After that, the actual prediction is made.

original: de'i 'og tu zhing bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhing bstan pa'o //
translated: After that, the realm is indicated.

original: mdo las yongs su mya ngan las 'das te zhes pa nas 'jig rten du 'byung ngo zhes pa'i bar du dngos su lung bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las yongs su mya ngan las 'das te zhes pa nas 'jig rten du 'byung ngo zhes pa'i bar du dngos su lung bstan te /
translated: The sutra says, “After he passed into parinirvana,” up to “he will appear in the world.”

original: dam pa'i chos 'di thos pas mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir stobs brjid pa padma 'dor ba nyid du khyu mchog gi 'gros lta bur de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'di thos pas mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir stobs brjid pa padma 'dor ba nyid du khyu mchog gi 'gros lta bur de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he heard this holy Dharma, he will become a Tathagata, like the gait of the bull among men, who will attain manifest enlightenment and cast off the lotus of pride.🔽The sutra says, “Sharivara, he will be like that,” up to “they will be similar.”

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu bzhes pa nas de dag 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhing padmo'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing dang 'dra bar rgyu dam pa nyid kyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu bzhes pa nas de dag 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhing padmo'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing dang 'dra bar rgyu dam pa nyid kyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: The realm of that Tathagata is like the realm of the Lotus Tathagata, generated by the highest cause.

original: mdo las yang sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas gzugs brnyan gnas par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas de'i bstan pa yun ji srid du gnas pa ston te /
analyzed: mdo las yang sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas gzugs brnyan gnas par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das nas de'i bstan pa yun ji srid du gnas pa ston te /
translated: remain” shows how long the teaching will last after the Buddha has passed🔽into extinction.

original: yang dag pa'i bstan pa ni lung dang spyod pa dang mngon par grub pa dang bcas pa'o//
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bstan pa ni lung dang spyod pa dang mngon par grub pa dang bcas pa'o//
translated: The true teaching consists of the scriptures, the practice, and the realization.

original: chos kyi gzugs brnyan ni mngon par grub pa med de /
analyzed: chos kyi gzugs brnyan ni mngon par grub pa med de /
translated: The image of the teaching is the absence of realization.

original: lung dang spyod pa tsam du zad pa la bstan pa de yang med par gyur ba'i dus na lung nyi tshe bzhugs so //
analyzed: lung dang spyod pa tsam du zad pa la bstan pa de yang med par gyur ba'i dus na lung nyi tshe bzhugs so //
translated: When the true teaching is no longer present, only the scriptures and the practice remain.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa yang dag pa ni yun thung /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa yang dag pa ni yun thung /
translated: The true teaching of the Bhagavat Sakyamuni will last a long time.

original: chos kyi gzugs brnyan ring ste /
analyzed: chos kyi gzugs brnyan ring ste /
translated: The image of the teaching will remain for a long time.

original: bud med rab tu byung ba las yang dag pa'i bstan pa lo lnga brgyas thung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med rab tu byung ba las yang dag pa'i bstan pa lo lnga brgyas thung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The true teaching will last for five hundred years less than the image of the teaching.

original: padmo'i 'od de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i bstan pa dang / chos kyi gzugs brnyan dus mnyam par gnas so //
analyzed: padmo'i 'od de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i bstan pa dang / chos kyi gzugs brnyan dus mnyam par gnas so //
translated: The light of the lotus is the perfect teaching of the Tathagata, and the reflection of the Dharma abides simultaneously.

original: mdo las de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa nas srog chags bye ba phrag stong rnam par 'dul zhes pa'i bar du @244a * //
analyzed: mdo las de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa nas srog chags bye ba phrag stong rnam par 'dul zhes pa'i bar du @244a * //
translated: The sutra says, “Then the Bhagavat, up to taming ten thousand times ten million living beings.”

original: 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang bcu gcig la tshigs bcad bcus ni gong du lung bstan pa la bzlas tshig gcig gis ni bsdus te dbye ba'i tshul gong ma dag dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di man chad tshigs bcad phyed dang bcu gcig la tshigs bcad bcus ni gong du lung bstan pa la bzlas tshig gcig gis ni bsdus te dbye ba'i tshul gong ma dag dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
translated: From here on, there are eleven and a half verses. With ten verses, it is a single repetition of the prophecy above, and the method of division is similar to the previous ones.

original: kun du spyan zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gnyis dang ldan pa'o //🔽mdo las / sangs rgyas bye ba mang la bkur sti byas //
analyzed: kun du spyan zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gnyis dang ldan pa'o // mdo las / sangs rgyas bye ba mang la bkur sti byas //
translated: “ All-seeing” means possessing both omniscience and knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: The sutra says, “Having made offerings to many millions of buddhas,”🔽up to

original: byang chub dam pa'i mchog kyang thob par 'ong //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa'i mchog kyang thob par 'ong //
translated: “they will attain the supreme, excellent enlightenment.”

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni rgyu'i sgo nas lung bstan pa la sngon bshes gnyen dam pa la brten pa dang / byang chub kyi spyod pa rdzogs par byas pa bstan to ;
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni rgyu'i sgo nas lung bstan pa la sngon bshes gnyen dam pa la brten pa dang / byang chub kyi spyod pa rdzogs par byas pa bstan to ;
translated: Up to this point, the prophecy from the point of view of cause is taught: reliance on a holy spiritual friend in the past and the completion of the conduct of enlightenment.

original: / mdo las /
analyzed: / mdo las /
translated: The sutra says:

original: tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab bskal pa na //
analyzed: tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab bskal pa na //
translated: In an inconceivable, immeasurable eon,

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: Up to:

original: blta na sdug pa me tog 'bras bus brgyan //
analyzed: blta na sdug pa me tog 'bras bus brgyan //
translated: Beautiful to behold, adorned with flowers and fruits.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas su 'grub pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas su 'grub pa nyid bstan te /
translated: Up to this point, the achievement of buddhahood is taught.

original: 'di man chad bskal pa'i ming bstan pa dang / zhing gi rgyan bstan pa dang / 'khor bzang ngan bstan pa dang / sku tshe'i tshad bstan pa la 'di ni dang po'i gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di man chad bskal pa'i ming bstan pa dang / zhing gi rgyan bstan pa dang / 'khor bzang ngan bstan pa dang / sku tshe'i tshad bstan pa la 'di ni dang po'i gnyis so //
translated: From here on, the teaching of the name of the eon, the teaching of the adornments of the realm, the teaching of the good and bad retinue, and the teaching of the lifespan are the first two.

original: phyi'i zhing gi rgyan bstan pa yang ming dang dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sa gzhi dang lam dang rin po che'i shing dang / me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i zhing gi rgyan bstan pa yang ming dang dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sa gzhi dang lam dang rin po che'i shing dang / me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the adornments of the outer realm is the teaching of the name and the characteristics of purity, the ground, the paths, the jeweled trees, the flowers, the fruits, and so forth.

original: mdo las / dran ldan byang chub sems dpa' de ma mang //
analyzed: mdo las / dran ldan byang chub sems dpa' de ma mang //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are mindful are not many.

original: zhes pa nas ;
analyzed: zhes pa nas ;
translated: Up to:

original: de dag sangs rgyas zhing der skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas zhing der skye bar 'gyur //
translated: They will be born in that buddha realm.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'khor gyi khyad par bstan te phyir mi ldog pa sprul te 'ong ba dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bsten pa rgyu dam pa bskyed pa sha stag ces sbyar ro //

analyzed: mdo las phyug po rin po che zhes pa nas sgo gcig pa zhes pa'i bar du ni 'byor ba bstan te /
translated: The

original: phyug cing rin po che mang ba ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyug cing rin po che mang ba ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Rich and with many jewels means endowed with the seven noble riches.

original: khang pa zhes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid khang khyim lta bur blta'o //🔽yang na 'jig rten gyi rgyal po chen po ngos bzhi la dbang @246a * //
analyzed: khang pa zhes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid khang khyim lta bur blta'o // yang na 'jig rten gyi rgyal po chen po ngos bzhi la dbang @246a * //
translated: The house is the fruitional consciousness itself, which should be seen as a house.

original: byed pa bzhin bcom ldan 'das kyang sems can mang po'i gnas dang bdag por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa bzhin bcom ldan 'das kyang sems can mang po'i gnas dang bdag por gyur pa'o //
translated: Or, just as a great king of the world rules over the four continents, the Bhagavān is the abode and lord of many sentient beings.

original: sgo gcig pa zhes pa sgo ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i dgos pa byed pa bzhin theg pa gcig po'i bstan pa 'dis sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'da' ba'i gnas su 'dis 'jug pa'i phyir sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgo gcig pa zhes pa sgo ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i dgos pa byed pa bzhin theg pa gcig po'i bstan pa 'dis sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'da' ba'i gnas su 'dis 'jug pa'i phyir sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: The single door is like a door that serves the purpose of exiting and entering. This teaching of the single vehicle is called a door because it causes all sentient beings to enter the state of nirvāṇa.

original: mdo las zhig la thug pa rtsvas g-yogs pa zhes pa nas srog chags brgya phrag gcig gam gnyis sam lnga'i bar du de na gnas zhes pa'i bar du ni 'gro ba rnam lnga g-yang za ba'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mdo las zhig la thug pa rtsvas g-yogs pa zhes pa nas srog chags brgya phrag gcig gam gnyis sam lnga'i bar du de na gnas zhes pa'i bar du ni 'gro ba rnam lnga g-yang za ba'i dpe ste /
translated: The sūtra says, “It is covered with grass up to the eaves” and “one or two or five hundred living beings live there.”

original: 'di man chad srog chags mang du gnas pa dang khang khyim rnyings pa dang phyogs bzhi nas me 'bar ba dang / bu mang po de na gnas pa'i dpe ston pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad srog chags mang du gnas pa dang khang khyim rnyings pa dang phyogs bzhi nas me 'bar ba dang / bu mang po de na gnas pa'i dpe ston pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: The rest of the passage is an illustration of the dwelling of many creatures, the old age of the house, the fire blazing up on all sides, and the many children dwelling there. This is the first illustration.

original: mdo las khyims rnams kyang 'drums pa zhes pa nas gogs par gyur pa'i khang pa de la zhes pa'i bar du ni gnas rnying pa bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las khyims rnams kyang 'drums pa zhes pa nas gogs par gyur pa'i khang pa de la zhes pa'i bar du ni gnas rnying pa bstan te /
translated: The passage from “the houses are dilapidated” up to “the house is in danger of collapsing” in the sutra teaches the old dwelling.

original: dpe rnam pa bzhi zhing ston to //🔽khang pa'i dpe ni gzugs kyi dpe'o//
analyzed: dpe rnam pa bzhi zhing ston to // khang pa'i dpe ni gzugs kyi dpe'o//
translated: It teaches the four kinds of illustrations.🔽The house is the illustration of form.

original: rtsig pa ni 'du shes kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa ni 'du shes kyi dpe'o //
translated: The walls are the illustration of perception.

original: ka ba'i rtsa ba rul pa ni 'du byed kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: ka ba'i rtsa ba rul pa ni 'du byed kyi dpe'o //
translated: The rotten foundation is the illustration of the volitional factors.

original: gdung ma g-yo ba ni tshor ba'i dpe'o //
analyzed: gdung ma g-yo ba ni tshor ba'i dpe'o //
translated: The swaying beams are the illustration of feeling.

original: spyir khang pa g-yo ba ni rnam par shes pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: spyir khang pa g-yo ba ni rnam par shes pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The swaying of the house in general is the illustration of consciousness.

original: phung po bzhi rnam par shes pa la brten zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phung po bzhi rnam par shes pa la brten zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the four aggregates are based on consciousness.

original: mdo las glo bur du me'i phung po chen po ngos thams cad nas rab tu 'bar bar gyur la zhes pa la me kun nas 'bar zhes pa ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi po dag gis phung po lnga 'joms zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mdo las glo bur du me'i phung po chen po ngos thams cad nas rab tu 'bar bar gyur la zhes pa la me kun nas 'bar zhes pa ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi po dag gis phung po lnga 'joms zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The sutra says: “Suddenly a great mass of fire appears, burning on all sides.” The phrase “fire burning on all sides” means that the four characteristics of arising and destruction destroy the five aggregates.

original: glo bur zhes pa ni lugs dang rgyu med par nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid skad cig gcig la skye zhing 'byung zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: glo bur zhes pa ni lugs dang rgyu med par nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid skad cig gcig la skye zhing 'byung zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word “suddenly” means that the characteristics of the afflictions arise and appear in one instant, without order or cause.

original: kun nas zhes pa ni skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang shi bas 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas zhes pa ni skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang shi bas 'joms pa'o //
translated: “On all sides” means that they are destroyed by birth, old age, sickness, and death.

original: mdo las skyes bu de la yang zhes pa nas phyi rol tu byung bar gyur na zhes pa'i bar du ni 'gro ba rnam lnga'i sems can thams cad la bcom ldan 'das sras dang 'dra ba'i phyir bu zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: mdo las skyes bu de la yang zhes pa nas phyi rol tu byung bar gyur na zhes pa'i bar du ni 'gro ba rnam lnga'i sems can thams cad la bcom ldan 'das sras dang 'dra ba'i phyir bu zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: The sutra says: “That person . . . comes out from it.” All sentient beings of the five destinies are called “sons” because they are like the Buddha’s sons.

original: mdo dag las theg pa rnam pa gsum so so'i spyod pa dang / rigs las byang chub sems dpa' ni grangs bcu dang sbyar /
analyzed: mdo dag las theg pa rnam pa gsum so so'i spyod pa dang / rigs las byang chub sems dpa' ni grangs bcu dang sbyar /
translated: In the sutras, the conduct of each of the three vehicles is taught, and the bodhisattva is associated with the number ten,

original: rang sangs rgyas ni grangs nyi shu dang sbyar /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ni grangs nyi shu dang sbyar /
translated: the pratyekabuddha with the number twenty,

original: nyan thos ni grangs sum cu dang sbyar zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos ni grangs sum cu dang sbyar zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and the śrāvaka with the number thirty.

original: mdo las de nas sh'a ri'i bu skyes bu de zhes pa nas sems mi dga' bar gyur to zhes pa'i bar du ni drang ba'i thabs @246b sbyor ba'i dpe ston te //
analyzed: mdo las de nas sh'a ri'i bu skyes bu de zhes pa nas sems mi dga' bar gyur to zhes pa'i bar du ni drang ba'i thabs @246b sbyor ba'i dpe ston te //
translated: Then Śāriputra, that man... up to... his mind became unhappy. This shows the example of the method of leading.

original: 'dis bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen pos sems can la dgongs shing 'dren pa'i dpe ston pa la me dang kun las 'bar ba'i don ni gong du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen pos sems can la dgongs shing 'dren pa'i dpe ston pa la me dang kun las 'bar ba'i don ni gong du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the example of the Bhagavān's great compassion for sentient beings and his leading them is shown. The meaning of the burning of the house was taught above.

original: mdo las 'di ltar bdag ni me'i phung po 'di zhes pa nas phyir 'byung bar yang yid la bya ba mi bskyed do snyam du sems so zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dis bcom ldan 'das thugs rjes sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par dgongs pa'i dpe ste /🔽'bar ba'i sgo zhes pa ni theg pa gcig bu ston pa dam pa'i chos la skur ba 'debs shing ma dad pa rnams nyon mongs pa phrag dog gi sems kyis mdo sde 'di la 'jug pa stong pa rnam pa gnyis dang phan pa rnam gnyis kyi spyod pa
analyzed: mdo las 'di ltar bdag ni me'i phung po 'di zhes pa nas phyir 'byung bar yang yid la bya ba mi bskyed do snyam du sems so zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dis bcom ldan 'das thugs rjes sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par dgongs pa'i dpe ste / 'bar ba'i sgo zhes pa ni theg pa gcig bu ston pa dam pa'i chos la skur ba 'debs shing ma dad pa rnams nyon mongs pa phrag dog gi sems kyis mdo sde 'di la 'jug pa stong pa rnam pa gnyis dang phan pa rnam gnyis kyi spyod pa
translated: The sutra says, “I think, ‘I am this mass of fire,’ up to ‘I do not generate the idea that I will emerge from it.’ ” This is an example of the Lord’s compassionate thought to benefit sentient beings.🔽The “door of blazing” means that those who deprecate and lack faith in the excellent Dharma that teaches the single vehicle, with minds of afflictive jealousy, enter this sutra.

original: sreg ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: sreg ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “burn” is that they burn the two kinds of emptiness and the two kinds of benefit.

original: rtse dga' zhes pa ni gnas dang khams dang theg pa la sogs pa la chags shing bag med par spyod pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtse dga' zhes pa ni gnas dang khams dang theg pa la sogs pa la chags shing bag med par spyod pa'i don to //
translated: “Playful” means that they are attached to places, elements, vehicles, and so on, and they engage in conduct carelessly.

original: mi shes khong du mi chud pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpog pa'i sgo nas mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes khong du mi chud pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpog pa'i sgo nas mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Ignorant and not understanding” means that they do not engage in it through direct perception and inference.

original: yang na mi dang mi 'jigs skye zhing spong bar mi byed ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na mi dang mi 'jigs skye zhing spong bar mi byed ces pa'i don to //
translated: Or else, it means that one does not generate fear of people and does not abandon them.

original: phyir 'byung bar yid la mi byed pa ni theg pa chen po'i mya ngan las 'da' ba mi tshol ba'o //
analyzed: phyir 'byung bar yid la mi byed pa ni theg pa chen po'i mya ngan las 'da' ba mi tshol ba'o //
translated: Not paying attention to going forth is not seeking the Nirvana of the Great Vehicle.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu skyes bu de zhes pa nas 'byung ngo snyam du bsams pa dang zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chen po 'dir gzud pa yang theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu skyes bu de zhes pa nas 'byung ngo snyam du bsams pa dang zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chen po 'dir gzud pa yang theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu bstan te /
translated: In the sutra, from “ Shariputra, that person” up to “ thinks that he will come out” shows the result of the Great Vehicle, which is the entrance into the Great Vehicle.

original: gzud pa dang rgyu bstan te gzud pa dang / theg pa chen po'i spyod pa bstan te gzud pa dang / chen po la reg pa bskyed de gzud pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: gzud pa dang rgyu bstan te gzud pa dang / theg pa chen po'i spyod pa bstan te gzud pa dang / chen po la reg pa bskyed de gzud pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first of the four entrances: the entrance through teaching the result of the Great Vehicle, the entrance through teaching the cause of the Great Vehicle, the entrance through teaching the practice of the Great Vehicle, and the entrance through generating the touch of greatness.

original: theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu ni ye shes rnam gnyis dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu ni ye shes rnam gnyis dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: The result of the Great Vehicle is endowed with the two kinds of exalted wisdom.

original: / stobs dang ldan pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes rnam gnyis sku lta bur lta ba de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: / stobs dang ldan pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes rnam gnyis sku lta bur lta ba de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with power means endowed with the two kinds of correct exalted wisdom that are like the body.

original: stobs che ba zhes pa ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i sku'i yan lag lta bur blta bas de gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir theg pa rnam gnyis pa theg pa chen po la mngon du dad pa med kyis kyang yon tan de gnyis kyi mthus bsgyur🔽zhing theg pa chen po la 'dzud ces pa'o //
analyzed: stobs che ba zhes pa ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i sku'i yan lag lta bur blta bas de gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir theg pa rnam gnyis pa theg pa chen po la mngon du dad pa med kyis kyang yon tan de gnyis kyi mthus bsgyur zhing theg pa chen po la 'dzud ces pa'o //
translated: Because they possess those two, even those who do not have manifest faith in the Mahayana are led to the Mahayana by the power of those two qualities.

original: theg pa bar ma ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes rnam gnyis kyi mthus 'dzud do //
analyzed: theg pa bar ma ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes rnam gnyis kyi mthus 'dzud do //
translated: The intermediate vehicle is led by the power of the two kinds of exalted wisdom of the Bhagavān.

original: nyan thos pa rnams ni bus pa mang du blangs te sgor 'byin pa bzhin mngon par shes pa'i mthus theg pa chen po la @247a * //
analyzed: nyan thos pa rnams ni bus pa mang du blangs te sgor 'byin pa bzhin mngon par shes pa'i mthus theg pa chen po la @247a * //
translated: The śrāvakas are led to the Mahayana by the power of the six higher perceptions, like a child who takes many things and is led out the door.

original: 'dzud do // mdo las de yang 'di snyam du sems te khang pa 'di srang gcig la sgo yang dog ces pa ni theg pa chen po'i rgyud bstan te 'dzud pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzud do // mdo las de yang 'di snyam du sems te khang pa 'di srang gcig la sgo yang dog ces pa ni theg pa chen po'i rgyud bstan te 'dzud pa ste /
translated: In the sūtra, it says, He thinks like this: 'This house has one door and the doorway is narrow,'  which teaches the continuum of the Mahayana.

original: de las rgyu bstan pa yang theg pa chen po'i spyod pa chen po la brten pa dang / skur ba'i sems skyes na ngan song du ltung bar bstan pa dang / dka' ba sna tshogs ston cing theg pa chen po nyid gsangs te smon pa dang gsum las 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: de las rgyu bstan pa yang theg pa chen po'i spyod pa chen po la brten pa dang / skur ba'i sems skyes na ngan song du ltung bar bstan pa dang / dka' ba sna tshogs ston cing theg pa chen po nyid gsangs te smon pa dang gsum las 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.🔽Since the Great Vehicle is the only path for leaving the three realms, it is called the only path.

original: khams gsum nas 'byung ba'i srang theg pa chen po gcig yin pa'i phyir srang gcig ces pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la nyan thos pa'i spyod pas mi chud pa'i phyir sgo yang dog pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: khams gsum nas 'byung ba'i srang theg pa chen po gcig yin pa'i phyir srang gcig ces pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la nyan thos pa'i spyod pas mi chud pa'i phyir sgo yang dog pa zhes smos te /
translated: Since the deeds of the bodhisattva are not included in the deeds of the sravakas, it is said that the door is narrow.

original: rgya mtsho shin tu yangs kyang mi ro zhag tu mi 'jog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya mtsho shin tu yangs kyang mi ro zhag tu mi 'jog pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as a corpse is not allowed to remain in the very vast ocean.

original: mdo las khye'u 'di dag kyang zhes pa nas byis pa de dag la 'bod de zhes pa'i bar du ni gang 'di la ma dad pa rnams ngan song du ltung ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las khye'u 'di dag kyang zhes pa nas byis pa de dag la 'bod de zhes pa'i bar du ni gang 'di la ma dad pa rnams ngan song du ltung ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The sutra from “these boys” up to “calling out to those children” teaches that those who lack faith in this will fall to the lower realms.

original: sems can rnams 'jig rten las 'byung ba'i rgyud yod du zin gyis kyang 'byung bar rtsol ba med pas na byis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'jig rten las 'byung ba'i rgyud yod du zin gyis kyang 'byung bar rtsol ba med pas na byis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though the continua of sentient beings do have the cause of emerging from the world, they do not strive to emerge, and so they are called “foolish.”

original: ji ltar byis pa legs nyes kyi bye brag mi shes pa bzhin theg pa chen po 'di'i yon tan ma rtogs shing /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa legs nyes kyi bye brag mi shes pa bzhin theg pa chen po 'di'i yon tan ma rtogs shing /
translated: Just as the foolish do not know the difference between good and bad, so they do not understand the virtues of this Great Vehicle.

original: skur pa'i sems bskyed pa rnams sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong ba yang ji ltar me'i phung po las byol bar mi sems pa'i byis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skur pa'i sems bskyed pa rnams sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong ba yang ji ltar me'i phung po las byol bar mi sems pa'i byis pa bzhin no //
translated: And those who have generated the spirit of refutation experience various sufferings, just like the foolish who do not think to avoid a mass of flames.

original: mdo las khyim 'di la zhes pa nas tshur sheg phyir 'byung zhes pa'i bar du ni sems can rnams la theg pa chen po gsangs te bstan pa'i dpe dang / theg pa chen po'i spyod pa bstan te 'dzud pa ston pa la de yan chad rgyu dang 'bras bu dang spyod pa la gzud pa'i dpe bstan to //
analyzed: mdo las khyim 'di la zhes pa nas tshur sheg phyir 'byung zhes pa'i bar du ni sems can rnams la theg pa chen po gsangs te bstan pa'i dpe dang / theg pa chen po'i spyod pa bstan te 'dzud pa ston pa la de yan chad rgyu dang 'bras bu dang spyod pa la gzud pa'i dpe bstan to //
translated: The passage from the sutra beginning with “This house” and ending with “Come out!” illustrates the introduction of sentient beings to the Great Vehicle through the teaching of the Great Vehicle in a condensed form, and the teaching of the practice of the Great Vehicle. Up to this point, the text has presented the illustrations of the introduction to cause, effect, and practice.

original: mdo las de ltar phan par 'dod pa'i skyes bu des zhes pa nas khyim 'di nas gdon to snyam zhes pa'i bar du ni phung po lnga la chags shing nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi mes gdung bar byed pa'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mes tshig ces🔽pa'i don to //
analyzed: mdo las de ltar phan par 'dod pa'i skyes bu des zhes pa nas khyim 'di nas gdon to snyam zhes pa'i bar du ni phung po lnga la chags shing nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi mes gdung bar byed pa'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mes tshig ces pa'i don to //
translated: The sutra from “That person who wishes to benefit in that way” up to “I will take them out of this house” means that because they are attached to the five aggregates and are tormented by the fire of various afflictions, they are burned by the fire of incorrectness.

original: snyam pa ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba brnyes pa'i sa na bzhugs pa bzhin sems can thams cad kyang sa der gdon cing 'jog ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: snyam pa ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba brnyes pa'i sa na bzhugs pa bzhin sems can thams cad kyang sa der gdon cing 'jog ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “I will take them out of this house” is that just as the tathagatas abide on the ground of attaining the bliss of nirvana, I will take all sentient beings and place them on that ground.

original: mdo las skyes bu des byis pa de dag gi bsam pa shes zhes pa nas rnam pa du ma yin na zhes pa'i bar du ni @247b theg pa rnam gsum dngos su bshad pa'i dpe ston par gleng pa la sngar so so'i dbang po shes pa dang /
analyzed: mdo las skyes bu des byis pa de dag gi bsam pa shes zhes pa nas rnam pa du ma yin na zhes pa'i bar du ni @247b theg pa rnam gsum dngos su bshad pa'i dpe ston par gleng pa la sngar so so'i dbang po shes pa dang /
translated: The sutra from “That person who knows the thoughts of those children” up to “in many ways” is the introduction to teaching the example that directly explains the three vehicles. The first is the knowledge of individual faculties,

original: phyis dngos su ston pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: phyis dngos su ston pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: and the later direct teaching is the first.

original: byis pa de dag gi bsam pa dang dad pa rig nas zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum gyi rigs shes pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa de dag gi bsam pa dang dad pa rig nas zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum gyi rigs shes pa ste /
translated: means knowing the lineages of the three vehicles.

original: dbang po mtho dman shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po mtho dman shes pa'o //
translated: Knowing the high and low faculties.

original: mdzes pa dang sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba dang zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum gyi don to //
analyzed: mdzes pa dang sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba dang zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum gyi don to //
translated: Beautiful, lovely, and pleasing means the meaning of the three vehicles.

original: mdo las de dag dkon par gyur te zhes pa nas myur du brgyugs te shog shig ces pa'i bar du theg pa rnam gsum gyi dpe shing rta rnam gsum dang sbyar te ston la sngar sbyin no bya bar gleng ba dang / rnam gsum gyi ming bstan pa dang ;
analyzed: mdo las de dag dkon par gyur te zhes pa nas myur du brgyugs te shog shig ces pa'i bar du theg pa rnam gsum gyi dpe shing rta rnam gsum dang sbyar te ston la sngar sbyin no bya bar gleng ba dang / rnam gsum gyi ming bstan pa dang ;
translated: In the sutra, from those have become rare up to quickly run and come here, the three vehicles are taught by applying the three chariots as examples. The previous statement I will give and the teaching of the names of the three,

original: dngos su byin pa dang gsum du bgo ste /
analyzed: dngos su byin pa dang gsum du bgo ste /
translated: are divided into three: the actual giving.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: theg pa rnam pa gsum gyi mthu dang spyod rlabs khyad par yod pa'i phyir dpe yang bzang ngan gsum du bkod do //
analyzed: theg pa rnam pa gsum gyi mthu dang spyod rlabs khyad par yod pa'i phyir dpe yang bzang ngan gsum du bkod do //
translated: Because there are differences in the power and conduct of the three vehicles, the examples are also arranged as three, good and bad.

original: phyi sgor bkod ces pa ni 'jig rten gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan thams cad theg pa de gsum gyi sgo nas 'jug cing 'thob pa'i phyir sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi sgor bkod ces pa ni 'jig rten gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan thams cad theg pa de gsum gyi sgo nas 'jug cing 'thob pa'i phyir sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: The outer gate is called a gate because one enters and obtains all the various roots of virtue and all the qualities of meditative concentration through these three vehicles.

original: bstan pa 'di la brten te theg pa rnam gsum gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i 'bras bu phyis thob par byed pa'i phyir phyi sgor bkod ces bya ste /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la brten te theg pa rnam gsum gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i 'bras bu phyis thob par byed pa'i phyir phyi sgor bkod ces bya ste /
translated: The outer gate is called a gate because one later obtains the fruit of nirvana through the three vehicles in dependence on this teaching.

original: rgyu la brten te 'bras bu 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la brten te 'bras bu 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one obtains the fruit in dependence on the cause.

original: theg pa 'di rnam gsum yang skyed pa dang phyin par byed pa'i don du 'dra bas ji ltar shing rta yang mang nyung skyed pa la mi 'dra yang spyir shing rta zhes ming gcig ste /
analyzed: theg pa 'di rnam gsum yang skyed pa dang phyin par byed pa'i don du 'dra bas ji ltar shing rta yang mang nyung skyed pa la mi 'dra yang spyir shing rta zhes ming gcig ste /
translated: These three vehicles are similar in that they generate and carry. Just as a cart is a general name for a vehicle, although it is not similar in carrying much or little.

original: 'dus ma byas la dbye ba med mod kyi 'dus byas kyi sgo nas che chung rim par dbye ba'i phyir glang dang ra dang ri dags kyi shing rta zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la dbye ba med mod kyi 'dus byas kyi sgo nas che chung rim par dbye ba'i phyir glang dang ra dang ri dags kyi shing rta zhes smos so //
translated: Although the unconditioned has no divisions, it is divided into great and small in dependence on the conditioned, and thus it is called an elephant cart, a goat cart, and a deer cart.

original: mdo las de nas byis pa de dag ces pa nas de nas myur du phyir 'thon to zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs rab la brten pas khams gsum las thar pa'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las de nas byis pa de dag ces pa nas de nas myur du phyir 'thon to zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs rab la brten pas khams gsum las thar pa'i dpe bstan te /
translated: The passage from the sutra beginning with “Then those children” up to “then they quickly come out” teaches the example of liberation from the three realms by relying on the teachings of the Bhagavat.

original: de yang bus pa rnams nyon mongs pa las thar ba dang / pha bde bar 'dug pa'i dpes sems can rnams theg pa rnam gsum la bkod pas bcom ldan 'das dgyes zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang bus pa rnams nyon mongs pa las thar ba dang / pha bde bar 'dug pa'i dpes sems can rnams theg pa rnam gsum la bkod pas bcom ldan 'das dgyes zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of “the Bhagavat is pleased by establishing sentient beings in the three vehicles” is illustrated by the example of the children being liberated from the afflictions and the father sitting in comfort.

original: gcig gis gcig bdas shing brgyugs te zhes pa ni brtson 'grus chen po rtsol ba bstan to //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig bdas shing brgyugs te zhes pa ni brtson 'grus chen po rtsol ba bstan to //
translated: “They chased and ran after each other” teaches the exertion of great effort.

original: mdo las de nas skyes bu des zhes pa nas 'jigs pa med pa thob par gyur te zhes pa'i bar du /🔽dpong sa bzhi mdo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mdo las de nas skyes bu des zhes pa nas 'jigs pa med pa thob par gyur te zhes pa'i bar du / dpong sa bzhi mdo zhes pa ni /
translated: The passage from the sutra beginning with “Then that man” up to “attained fearlessness”🔽“The crossroads”

original: @248a * // bden pa rnam bzhi'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @248a * // bden pa rnam bzhi'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: teaches the meaning of the four truths.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos pa rnams lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir skyabs dang sgrib pa med pa ni bla gab med par gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos pa rnams lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir skyabs dang sgrib pa med pa ni bla gab med par gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: The noble listeners attain nirvana with remainder, so they are liberated from the defilements, and the bodhisattvas attain nirvana without remainder, so they are liberated from the obscurations to omniscience. Thus, they are a refuge and are free of obscurations, like those who live in the open air.

original: mdo las de nas byis pa de dag ces pa nas bdag cag stsal du gsol zhes pa'i bar du ni dpe snga mas ni drang ba'i don bstan /
analyzed: mdo las de nas byis pa de dag ces pa nas bdag cag stsal du gsol zhes pa'i bar du ni dpe snga mas ni drang ba'i don bstan /
translated: In the sutra, the passage from “Then those children” up to “Please give them to us” teaches the former example, the provisional meaning.

original: dpe 'dis ni nges pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: dpe 'dis ni nges pa'i don ston te /
translated: This example teaches the definitive meaning.

original: de yang bu rnams kyis sbyin par byas pa de bslangs pa dang / phas gcig byin pa bstan pa dang / phas bsams pa'i don dang bus pa rnams kyi bsam pa dang 'gal ba dang bzhir dbye ba la 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: de yang bu rnams kyis sbyin par byas pa de bslangs pa dang / phas gcig byin pa bstan pa dang / phas bsams pa'i don dang bus pa rnams kyi bsam pa dang 'gal ba dang bzhir dbye ba la 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first of the four divisions: the children’s request for what their father has given, the father’s giving of one, the contradiction between the father’s intention and the children’s thoughts, and the father’s giving of many.

original: theg pa rnam pa gnyis pa dag ni phung po dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba thob du zin gyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ma thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma thob pa de gnyis kyi dper bus pa phyir 'thon pa rnams pha la so so nas sngar byin par bya ba de bslangs zhes par sbyar ro //
analyzed: theg pa rnam pa gnyis pa dag ni phung po dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba thob du zin gyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ma thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma thob pa de gnyis kyi dper bus pa phyir 'thon pa rnams pha la so so nas sngar byin par bya ba de bslangs zhes par sbyar ro //
translated: The two kinds of vehicles, although they have attained the liberation of being free from the aggregates, have not attained the great nirvana, and the bodhisattvas have not attained the gnosis of omniscience. The analogy for these two is that the children who have come out of the house each ask for their share of the gifts.

original: yang na lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob tu zin gyis kyang lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob pa'i phyir sbyin par byas pa de blangs so //
analyzed: yang na lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob tu zin gyis kyang lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob pa'i phyir sbyin par byas pa de blangs so //
translated: Or else, although they have attained nirvana with remainder, they have not attained nirvana without remainder, so they take what has been given.

original: mdo las de nas sh'a ri'i bu skyes bu des zhes pa nas bdag gi bu rnams la rlung ltar mgyogs shing mthu dang ldan pa'i glang po che'i shing rta byin te zhes pa'i bar du ni phas kun la 'dra bar byin pa bstan te de yang shing rta
analyzed: mdo las de nas sh'a ri'i bu skyes bu des zhes pa nas bdag gi bu rnams la rlung ltar mgyogs shing mthu dang ldan pa'i glang po che'i shing rta byin te zhes pa'i bar du ni phas kun la 'dra bar byin pa bstan te de yang shing rta
translated: The sutra from then the man said to his sons up to he gave his sons chariots swift as the wind and powerful elephants shows that the father gave them all equally.

original: byin pa dang / de'i rgyan dang glang de'i mtshan dang de'i 'khor bstan pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: byin pa dang / de'i rgyan dang glang de'i mtshan dang de'i 'khor bstan pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: The first of these is the giving of the chariot, its ornaments, the elephant and its retinue.

original: glang po che'i shing rta ni theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu bstan te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can nam ye shes bzhi dang lnga'i dngos po'o ;
analyzed: glang po che'i shing rta ni theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu bstan te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can nam ye shes bzhi dang lnga'i dngos po'o ;
translated: The elephant chariot indicates the result of the Mahayana, which has the nature of omniscient wisdom or the nature of the four or five wisdoms.🔽The sutra also says:

original: / mdo las kyang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo ni dpes shing rta bzhin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: / mdo las kyang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo ni dpes shing rta bzhin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: The essence of thatness is like a chariot.

original: glang de yang rlung bzhin du mgyogs pa'i dpes theg pa chen po 'di la gnas pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la myur du son par byed pa'i phyir mgyogs par bstan to //
analyzed: glang de yang rlung bzhin du mgyogs pa'i dpes theg pa chen po 'di la gnas pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la myur du son par byed pa'i phyir mgyogs par bstan to //
