translated: The elephant is like the wind in speed, and so it is taught to be fast, because one who abides in this Mahayana vehicle quickly reaches the stage of nonregression.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas @248b chos ston pa yang sems can la dbye ba dang rim pa mi mdzad mod kyi so so'i snod ji bzhin pa las mya ngan las 'da' ba thob pa'ang khyim bdag des bu rnams la 'dra bar glang po che'i shing rta byin pa'i dpe
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas @248b chos ston pa yang sems can la dbye ba dang rim pa mi mdzad mod kyi so so'i snod ji bzhin pa las mya ngan las 'da' ba thob pa'ang khyim bdag des bu rnams la 'dra bar glang po che'i shing rta byin pa'i dpe
translated: The Tathagata does not make distinctions and classifications of sentient beings in teaching the Dharma, but in accordance with their individual vessels, they attain nirvana, as in the example of the householder who gave the same elephant chariot to his sons.

original: bstan to // mdo las rin po che bdun las byas pa logs dang ldan pa dril bu mang pos rab tu dbyangs pa mtho zhing brtan pa zhes pa ni shing rta de'i rgyan bstan te /
analyzed: bstan to // mdo las rin po che bdun las byas pa logs dang ldan pa dril bu mang pos rab tu dbyangs pa mtho zhing brtan pa zhes pa ni shing rta de'i rgyan bstan te /
translated: The sutra teaches that the chariot is made of the seven precious substances, has sides, is adorned with many bells, is high and firm, and so on, which are the ornaments of that chariot.

original: de la yang rnam pa bcu yod pa la 'dir bzhi zhig ston te /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa bcu yod pa la 'dir bzhi zhig ston te /
translated: Among the ten aspects, four are taught here.

original: de'i tshad dang rgyan dang kha lo sgyur ba dang 'phyang ba mang po ston to //
analyzed: de'i tshad dang rgyan dang kha lo sgyur ba dang 'phyang ba mang po ston to //
translated: It teaches its size, ornaments, charioteer, and many hanging ornaments.

original: mtho zhing brtan pa ni tshad de de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi dpe ste /
analyzed: mtho zhing brtan pa ni tshad de de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi dpe ste /
translated: The height and firmness is the example of the Tathagata's wisdom.

original: phyogs thams cad du gzigs shing 'phags par gyur ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du gzigs shing 'phags par gyur ces pa'i don to //
translated: It is said that he sees in all directions and is exalted.

original: rin po che mang po ni de'i rgyan te yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan par bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes nyid do //
analyzed: rin po che mang po ni de'i rgyan te yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan par bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes nyid do //
translated: The many jewels are its ornaments. The Blessed One's wisdom itself is to be adorned with all good qualities.

original: logs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni kha lo sgyur ba dang ldan pa ste gzungs rnam bzhis brtan zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: logs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni kha lo sgyur ba dang ldan pa ste gzungs rnam bzhis brtan zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: Possessing sides means possessing a charioteer, which means being firm with the four retentions.

original: / dril bu rab tu dbyangs zhes pa ni sbyang par bya ba'i rgyan te spobs pa rnam pa bdun la sogs pas spobs pa'i rgyan zhes pa'i don te //
analyzed: / dril bu rab tu dbyangs zhes pa ni sbyang par bya ba'i rgyan te spobs pa rnam pa bdun la sogs pas spobs pa'i rgyan zhes pa'i don te //
translated: The ringing of the bells is the ornament of what is to be purified, which means the ornament of eloquence with the seven kinds of eloquence and so on.

original: mdo las rin po che ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan zhes pa ni rgyan de ni gdugs kyis 'gebs pa'i rgyan te /
analyzed: mdo las rin po che ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan zhes pa ni rgyan de ni gdugs kyis 'gebs pa'i rgyan te /
translated: The sutra says adorned with the marvelous and wonderful ornaments of jewels, which means that this ornament is the ornament of covering with parasols.

original: 'gro ba mang po la tshad med pa bzhi'i gdugs kyis 'gebs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po la tshad med pa bzhi'i gdugs kyis 'gebs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means that he covers the many beings with the parasol of the four immeasurables.

original: mdo las rin po che'i phreng bas mdzes par brgyan pa zhes pa nas rten pa dmar ba gnyis su bzhag pa zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di la rgyan bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdo las rin po che'i phreng bas mdzes par brgyan pa zhes pa nas rten pa dmar ba gnyis su bzhag pa zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di la rgyan bzhi ste /
translated: The sutra speaks of the four adornments from “adorned with a jeweled garland” to “two red supports.”

original: phreng ba dang me tog dang gding ba dang rgyab rten dang bzhi la phreng ba ni smon lam rgya chen po bzhi'i don te ;
analyzed: phreng ba dang me tog dang gding ba dang rgyab rten dang bzhi la phreng ba ni smon lam rgya chen po bzhi'i don te ;
translated: The garland is the meaning of the four vast aspirations.

original: bzhi'i ni byang chub sems dpa' dge ba ci brtsams pa rnams sems can thams cad la bsngo ste /🔽sems can sdug bsngal las thar bar gyur cig / bde ba ma thob pa rnams bde dang ldan par shog shig / sdig pa spong dge ba la 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems ma bskyed pa rnams sems de bskyed par gyur cig / bla na med pa'i byang
analyzed: bzhi'i ni byang chub sems dpa' dge ba ci brtsams pa rnams sems can thams cad la bsngo ste / sems can sdug bsngal las thar bar gyur cig / bde ba ma thob pa rnams bde dang ldan par shog shig / sdig pa spong dge ba la 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems ma bskyed pa rnams sems de bskyed par gyur cig / bla na med pa'i byang
translated: The four are that whatever virtue bodhisattvas undertake they dedicate it to all sentient beings,

original: chub kyi 'bras bu ma thob pa rnams thob par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: chub kyi 'bras bu ma thob pa rnams thob par gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa'o //
translated: praying that sentient beings be freed from suffering, that those who have not attained happiness come to possess it, that those who have not developed the thought of awakening, which is to abandon evil and engage in virtue, come to develop that thought and that those who have not attained the fruit of unsurpassable awakening come to attain it.

original: rin po che'i me tog gi phreng ba zhes pa ni bsdu ba rnam bzhi'i don te /
analyzed: rin po che'i me tog gi phreng ba zhes pa ni bsdu ba rnam bzhi'i don te /
translated: The term “garland of precious flowers” refers to the meaning of the four principles for attracting disciples.

original: sbyin pa dang tshig snyan pa dang phan par spyod pa dang don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshig snyan pa dang phan par spyod pa dang don mthun pa'o //
translated: They are generosity, pleasant speech, meaningful conduct, and practicing what one preaches.

original: @249a * // gding ba ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ste rgyu dang log par spyod pa sgo gsum nas mi rgyu zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: @249a * // gding ba ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ste rgyu dang log par spyod pa sgo gsum nas mi rgyu zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The term “covering” refers to right livelihood, which means not engaging in the three doors of negative action.

original: rten dmar po zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde ba la brten nas zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: rten dmar po zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde ba la brten nas zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The term “red support” refers to the bliss of nirvana.

original: zag pa med pa'i 'gog pa la gnas shing 'phags pa'i lam 'phel bar byed pa'i don tam /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i 'gog pa la gnas shing 'phags pa'i lam 'phel bar byed pa'i don tam /
translated: It means abiding in the uncontaminated cessation and increasing the noble path.

original: dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dbang po lngas brten zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dbang po lngas brten zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Or it means being supported by the five faculties such as faith.

original: mdo las glang dkar po rab tu dkar zhing zhes pa nas byis pa rnams la re re byin te zhes pa'i bar du ni glang dkar po rtsa ba'i ye shes dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdo las glang dkar po rab tu dkar zhing zhes pa nas byis pa rnams la re re byin te zhes pa'i bar du ni glang dkar po rtsa ba'i ye shes dang sbyar ro //
translated: In the sutra, from “the white elephant, very white” up to “each child was given one,” the white elephant is applied to the fundamental wisdom.

original: glang zhes pa ni shing rta 'dren pa'i don te /
analyzed: glang zhes pa ni shing rta 'dren pa'i don te /
translated: The term “elephant” means to lead a chariot.

original: 'gro ba mang po 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po 'dren pa'o //
translated: It is the leader of many beings.

original: dkar po zhes pa ni kha dog thams cad kyi gzhi ste padmo dkar po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dkar po zhes pa ni kha dog thams cad kyi gzhi ste padmo dkar po dang 'dra'o //
translated: White is the basis of all colors, like a white lotus.

original: yang glang de la yon tan rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang glang de la yon tan rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, the elephant has three kinds of qualities:

original: dgra 'dul ba'i don te sgrib pa rnam gnyis 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: dgra 'dul ba'i don te sgrib pa rnam gnyis 'joms pa'o //
translated: The meaning of subduing enemies is the destruction of the two obscurations.

original: mdzes pa'i don te 'phags pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i don te 'phags pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of beauty is the adornment of all the qualities of the noble ones.

original: 'degs pa'i don te bdag dang gzhan dgrol ba'o //
analyzed: 'degs pa'i don te bdag dang gzhan dgrol ba'o //
translated: The meaning of lifting is the liberation of self and others.

original: yang na glang gis drang ba'i shing rta ni ra dang ri dvags kyis drang ba'i shing rta las khyad par du bstan te theg pa chen po 'di yang theg pa rnam pa gnyis las 'phags zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na glang gis drang ba'i shing rta ni ra dang ri dvags kyis drang ba'i shing rta las khyad par du bstan te theg pa chen po 'di yang theg pa rnam pa gnyis las 'phags zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Or, the elephant-drawn chariot is taught as superior to the goat-drawn and deer-drawn chariots, meaning that this Great Vehicle is superior to the two kinds of vehicles.

original: stobs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Powerful means perfect wisdom,

original: nang gi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of inner qualities.

original: kha dog dkar ba zhes pa ni sgrib pa thams cad bsal te tshul khrims kyi yon tan dang ldan pa bstan to //
analyzed: kha dog dkar ba zhes pa ni sgrib pa thams cad bsal te tshul khrims kyi yon tan dang ldan pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “white in color” indicates that he has eliminated all obscurations and possesses the quality of morality.

original: yang mdzes pa zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pas lha dang mis mchod par 'os pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang mdzes pa zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pas lha dang mis mchod par 'os pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “beautiful” indicates that he is worthy of being worshipped by gods and humans because he is adorned with the major and minor marks of a great being.

original: yang stobs dang ldan pa ni mnga' ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: yang stobs dang ldan pa ni mnga' ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “powerful” indicates that he possesses abundant strength.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis mi bsnyengs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis mi bsnyengs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase “unassailable in every way” means that he is not subject to fear.

original: rlung bzhin du mgyogs pa zhes pa ni thugs rjes sems can 'dren pa dang yod pa dang med pa'i chos gzigs pa la thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i don te /
analyzed: rlung bzhin du mgyogs pa zhes pa ni thugs rjes sems can 'dren pa dang yod pa dang med pa'i chos gzigs pa la thogs pa med par 'jug pa'i don te /
translated: The phrase “swift as the wind” means that he is engaged in the activity of leading sentient beings to spiritual awakening and in the activity of perceiving both existent and nonexistent entities without any obstruction.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa nas des 'di snyam du bsams so zhes pa'i bar du ni pha de'i bsam pa bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa nas des 'di snyam du bsams so zhes pa'i bar du ni pha de'i bsam pa bstan te /
translated: The passage from the sutra that begins with the words “Why is that?” and ends with the phrase “he thought to himself” indicates the father’s thoughts.

original: bang mdzod dang nor mang po dag ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: bang mdzod dang nor mang po dag ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The phrase “his great wealth and his many treasuries” refers to the conditioned and unconditioned forms of excellence.

original: bang mdzod ces pa ni sde snod gnyis dang gsum du ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bang mdzod ces pa ni sde snod gnyis dang gsum du ldan pa'o //
translated: The treasury is the two or three baskets.🔽The passage from the sutra that begins, “What can I do for these children who have been given bad vehicles?”

original: mdo las bdag gis byis pa 'di rnams bzhon pa ngan @249b pa byin te ci zhig bya snyam zhes pa nas 'di dag thams cad la snyoms par bsam gyi mi snyoms par mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa phyir bus pa
analyzed: mdo las bdag gis byis pa 'di rnams bzhon pa ngan @249b pa byin te ci zhig bya snyam zhes pa nas 'di dag thams cad la snyoms par bsam gyi mi snyoms par mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa phyir bus pa
translated: and ends with “I will think of all of them equally, not unequally,” refers to those who have not generated the thought of awakening.

original: zhes gdags so //
analyzed: zhes gdags so //
translated: They are called “children” because they are like children.

original: theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'i phyir nga'i bur 'dra'o zhes smas so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'i phyir nga'i bur 'dra'o zhes smas so //
translated: They are called “my sons” because they have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: thugs rjes dgongs pa gnyis su mi mdzad pa'i phyir snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rjes dgongs pa gnyis su mi mdzad pa'i phyir snyoms pa'o //
translated: They are called “equal” because he does not think of them in two different ways through compassion.🔽The passage from the sutra that begins, “I myself have many treasuries” and ends with “what need is there to mention my sons?”

original: mdo las bdag kyang bang mdzod mang gi zhes pa nas bdag gi bu rnams lta ci smos zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas 'gro ba lngar skyes pa'i sems can thams cad dang rigs med pa dang rigs nges pa rnams
analyzed: mdo las bdag kyang bang mdzod mang gi zhes pa nas bdag gi bu rnams lta ci smos zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas 'gro ba lngar skyes pa'i sems can thams cad dang rigs med pa dang rigs nges pa rnams
translated: refers to the Bhagavān, who has great compassion for all sentient beings born in the five migrations, those without lineage, and those of fixed lineage.

original: la yang snyoms par ston na theg pa chen po'i rigs can dang rigs ma nges pa rnams la lta ci smos zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: la yang snyoms par ston na theg pa chen po'i rigs can dang rigs ma nges pa rnams la lta ci smos zhes pa'i don to //
translated: If it is taught to those of uncertain lineage, what need is there to mention those of the Mahayana lineage?

original: mdo las de'i tshe byis pa de dag kyang zhes pa nas de ji snyam du sems zhes pa'i bar du ni rnams kyis sngar bsam pa'i re ba las 'gal ba bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las de'i tshe byis pa de dag kyang zhes pa nas de ji snyam du sems zhes pa'i bar du ni rnams kyis sngar bsam pa'i re ba las 'gal ba bstan te /
translated: The sutra from “at that time, those children” up to “what do you think?” teaches the contradiction with the former aspiration of the children.

original: sngar theg pa rnam gsum bstan la phyis theg pa chen po 'ba' zhig bstan pas /
analyzed: sngar theg pa rnam gsum bstan la phyis theg pa chen po 'ba' zhig bstan pas /
translated: The former teaching of the three vehicles is contradicted by the later teaching of only the Great Vehicle.

original: 'gal zhes pa'i don to //🔽mdo las skyes bu des byis pa de dag la zhes pa nas /
analyzed: 'gal zhes pa'i don to // mdo las skyes bu des byis pa de dag la zhes pa nas /
translated: This is the meaning of the contradiction.🔽The sutra from “that man to those children” up to “would that be a lie?” teaches the former example of definitive meaning and the later example of resolving doubts.

original: de brdzun du smras par mi 'gyur ram zhes pa'i bar du ni sngar ni nges pa'i don gyi dpe bstan phyis the tshom dgrol ba'i dpe bstan te gong du bcom ldan 'das ni bden par gsung ba yang dag pa nyid du gsung pa'o zhes 'byung ba la theg
analyzed: de brdzun du smras par mi 'gyur ram zhes pa'i bar du ni sngar ni nges pa'i don gyi dpe bstan phyis the tshom dgrol ba'i dpe bstan te gong du bcom ldan 'das ni bden par gsung ba yang dag pa nyid du gsung pa'o zhes 'byung ba la theg
translated: The above statement “the Bhagavan speaks the truth, he speaks only what is correct” is a doubt about the Great Vehicle.

original: pa rnam gsum bstan pa 'dir theg pa chen po gcig tu bsdus na gsung dam par gyur ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa rnam gsum bstan pa 'dir theg pa chen po gcig tu bsdus na gsung dam par gyur ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this passage is that if these three vehicles are included in the single Great Vehicle, then the Buddha's word is true.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra replied:🔽Blessed One, it is not so, up to: because it gives them life.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so zhes pa nas srog dang ldan par bgyis pa'i slad du'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dris pa'i lan btab pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta ma lags so zhes pa nas srog dang ldan par bgyis pa'i slad du'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dris pa'i lan btab pa ste /
translated: This is the reply to the question,

original: sngar gleng ba dang phyis dgrol ba'o //
analyzed: sngar gleng ba dang phyis dgrol ba'o //
translated: which was raised earlier and is now resolved.

original: nyon mongs pa las ston pa dang ngan 'gro gsum las thar par byas pa ni srog dang ldan par byas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las ston pa dang ngan 'gro gsum las thar par byas pa ni srog dang ldan par byas pa'o //
translated: Giving them life means that they are freed from the afflictions and the three lower realms.🔽The sutra says: Why is this? Up to: because that person would not be a liar.

original: mdo las de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes pa nas skyes bu de sho be mchi bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni khams gsum 'bar ba'i khang pa dang 'dra ba las thar bar byas pa'i phyir brdzun du mi 'gyur ba dang / skyes bu de thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: mdo las de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes pa nas skyes bu de sho be mchi bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni khams gsum 'bar ba'i khang pa dang 'dra ba las thar bar byas pa'i phyir brdzun du mi 'gyur ba dang / skyes bu de thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas /
translated: This shows that it is not a lie to free them from the burning house of the three realms, and that the person is skilled in means.

original: chen po sbyin pa'i bsam pas chung ngur brjod de chen po thab par byas pas 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: chen po sbyin pa'i bsam pas chung ngur brjod de chen po thab par byas pas 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because there is no contradiction in the great being expressed in the small by the intention of giving, and the great being being the basis.

original: @250a * // mdo las de ci'i slad du zhe na bcom ldan 'das skyes bu de sho bo mchi ba ma lags so zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa che po bstan pa'i phyir brdzun du mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @250a * // mdo las de ci'i slad du zhe na bcom ldan 'das skyes bu de sho bo mchi ba ma lags so zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa che po bstan pa'i phyir brdzun du mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: From the sutra, “Why is it so? Bhagavan, that person is not a thief.” Up to this point, it is shown that it is not a lie in order to teach the Great Vehicle.

original: mdo las de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: mdo las de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: From the sutra, “Having said this, the Bhagavan said to the Venerable Shariputra:

original: sh'a ri'i bu legs so legs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu legs so legs so //
translated: “Shariputra, good, good!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just so.

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin no zhes pa ni don de nyid yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bstan par byas so //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin no zhes pa ni don de nyid yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bstan par byas so //
translated: As it is said, the Bhagavan also taught that this is the meaning.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang zhes pa'i bar du ni dpe dag kyang snga ma ni drang ba'i don gyi dpe /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang zhes pa'i bar du ni dpe dag kyang snga ma ni drang ba'i don gyi dpe /
translated: From the sutra, “Shariputra, in the same way…” up to “…the wisdom of the Tathagata,” the previous example is an example of the provisional meaning.

original: phyi ma ni nges pa'i don dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni nges pa'i don dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The latter is applied to the definitive meaning.

original: de la de'i gnas dang khyim bdag dang / rgan dang 'byor pa dang / khyim gyi rtags dang / sgo dang / drug gcig cig ston te /
analyzed: de la de'i gnas dang khyim bdag dang / rgan dang 'byor pa dang / khyim gyi rtags dang / sgo dang / drug gcig cig ston te /
translated: There, the abode, the householder, the elder, the wealth, the signs of the house, the door, and the six are taught.

original: 'jig rten zhes pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes pa ni gnas so //
translated: The world is the abode.

original: khyim bdag ces pa ni bdag po'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag ces pa ni bdag po'o //
translated: The householder is the master.

original: 'jig rten yang snod dang bcud du dbye'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten yang snod dang bcud du dbye'o //
translated: The world is also divided into the environment and the inhabitants.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad bsal ba zhes pa ni 'byor pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad bsal ba zhes pa ni 'byor pa bstan te /
translated: The removal of all fears teaches the wealth.

original: 'jigs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Fear is of five kinds:

original: 'tsho ba mi 'byor bas 'jigs pa dang / gtam ngan gyis 'jigs pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa dang / ngan song gis 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du spa gong bas 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba mi 'byor bas 'jigs pa dang / gtam ngan gyis 'jigs pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa dang / ngan song gis 'jigs pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du spa gong bas 'jigs pa'o //
translated: fear of not having enough livelihood, fear of bad reputation, fear of death, fear of the lower realms, and fear of being overwhelmed in the midst of the assembly.

original: 'chi ba dang 'khrug pa zhes pa ni mi bde ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs so //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang 'khrug pa zhes pa ni mi bde ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs so //
translated: Death and conflict are the various sufferings of unhappiness.

original: de dag ni 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: These are applied to the fears of cyclic existence.

original: yid mi bde ba dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba gti mug ste sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas dug gsum dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba gti mug ste sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas dug gsum dang sbyar ro //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction, ignorance and so on are the root of affliction, since they are the cause of suffering, they are applied to the three poisons.

original: yang na dkon mchog gsum ma rig pa yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na dkon mchog gsum ma rig pa yang sbyar ro //
translated: Alternatively, the three jewels and ignorance are applied.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag ma lus pa spangs pas yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid sems can thams cad kyi pha yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag ma lus pa spangs pas yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid sems can thams cad kyi pha yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Since all those afflictions are completely abandoned, the Tathāgata himself possesses all good qualities and is the father of all sentient beings.

original: mdo las stobs dang mi 'jigs pa zhes pa nas ye shes dam pa'i mchog thob pa zhes pa'i bar du ni 'byor pa bstan to //
analyzed: mdo las stobs dang mi 'jigs pa zhes pa nas ye shes dam pa'i mchog thob pa zhes pa'i bar du ni 'byor pa bstan to //
translated: The sūtra from “strength and fearlessness” up to “attains the supreme sublime wisdom” teaches the endowment of the Tathāgata.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa nang gi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir phyug cing nor mang ba lta bur bstan to //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa nang gi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir phyug cing nor mang ba lta bur bstan to //
translated: The internal qualities of strength, fearlessness, the unique qualities of a buddha and so on are complete, like a wealthy person with much wealth.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni bran g-yog 'khol ba dang 'dra bar des dbang dang sems can gyi don byed @250b pa'o ;
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni bran g-yog 'khol ba dang 'dra bar des dbang dang sems can gyi don byed @250b pa'o ;
translated: Supernatural power is like a servant, since it is controlled and benefits sentient beings.

original: / mdo las snying rje chen po mi skyo ba'i yid kyis phan par 'dod pa zhes pa nas zhig pa'i khang pa dang 'dra bar sems can zhes pa'i bar du ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa la thugs rje chen po skye mi mkhyen par bstan pa ston
analyzed: / mdo las snying rje chen po mi skyo ba'i yid kyis phan par 'dod pa zhes pa nas zhig pa'i khang pa dang 'dra bar sems can zhes pa'i bar du ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa la thugs rje chen po skye mi mkhyen par bstan pa ston
translated: The sutra says, “With a compassionate mind that never tires of benefiting sentient beings, like a house on fire, the Buddha benefits sentient beings and enters the world.”

original: te / spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don rdzogs par mdzad pa dang / khang pa me 'bar ba dang 'dra bar khams gsum gyi sems can 'gro ba lngar skye ba rnams la phan 'dogs shing 'jig rten du gshegs te /
analyzed: te / spong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don rdzogs par mdzad pa dang / khang pa me 'bar ba dang 'dra bar khams gsum gyi sems can 'gro ba lngar skye ba rnams la phan 'dogs shing 'jig rten du gshegs te /
translated: This teaches that the Buddha, having perfected abandonment and wisdom, accomplishes the welfare of self and other, and benefits sentient beings in the three realms who are born in the five destinies, like a burning house.

original: de las byung ba bstan pas theg pa rnams gcig gi don spyod pa la gzud par thabs mkhas pa chen pos phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba bstan pas theg pa rnams gcig gi don spyod pa la gzud par thabs mkhas pa chen pos phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on what arises from that shows the Buddha’s great skill in leading beings to engage in the practice of the single vehicle.

original: mdo las skye ba dang rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba zhes pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu gzud pa'i phyir 'byung ste zhes pa'i bar du ni sems can 'gro ba lngar skyes pa rnams 'khor ba g-yang za ba na gnas pa'i dpe ste ;
analyzed: mdo las skye ba dang rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba zhes pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu gzud pa'i phyir 'byung ste zhes pa'i bar du ni sems can 'gro ba lngar skyes pa rnams 'khor ba g-yang za ba na gnas pa'i dpe ste ;
translated: The sutra from “birth, aging, sickness, and death” up to “in order to lead to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening” is the example of sentient beings born in the five migrations who are dwelling in the abyss of cyclic existence.

original: de yang de na rab tu mang bar gnas pa dang / khang khyim zhig ba dang / phyogs thams cad nas me 'bar ba bus pa rnams de na gnas par ston pa la rab tu mang ba gnas pa'i sems can mang po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang de na rab tu mang bar gnas pa dang / khang khyim zhig ba dang / phyogs thams cad nas me 'bar ba bus pa rnams de na gnas par ston pa la rab tu mang ba gnas pa'i sems can mang po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, “dwelling there in great numbers” and “the house is destroyed” and “the fire blazes from all sides” show that they dwell there. “ Many sentient beings” means many sentient beings.

original: skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa ni khang pa rnying pa dang 'dra bar sbyar ro ;
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa ni khang pa rnying pa dang 'dra bar sbyar ro ;
translated: “ Birth, aging, sickness, and death” are to be applied like an old house.

original: / ma rig pa'i mun pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni gdug pa gsum gyi me phyogs bzhi nas 'bar ba bstan to //
analyzed: / ma rig pa'i mun pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni gdug pa gsum gyi me phyogs bzhi nas 'bar ba bstan to //
translated: “ The darkness of ignorance” and so on teaches the fire of the three poisons blazing from the four directions.

original: byang chub la gzud ces pa ni bu rnams la thugs rje skye zhing nyon mongs pa'i gnas nas 'don zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub la gzud ces pa ni bu rnams la thugs rje skye zhing nyon mongs pa'i gnas nas 'don zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase to lead to enlightenment means that compassion arises for the sons and they are extracted from the abode of afflictions.

original: phung po bzhi la mi rtag pa la sogs pas 'joms pa dang / skye rga na 'chis rnyings par byed pa ni khang pa rnyings pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phung po bzhi la mi rtag pa la sogs pas 'joms pa dang / skye rga na 'chis rnyings par byed pa ni khang pa rnyings pa lta bu'o //
translated: The four aggregates are destroyed by impermanence, etc., and are aged by birth, aging, sickness, and death, like an aged house.

original: mdo las de byung ma thag tu sems can rnams zhes pa nas sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po rab tu myong ba zhes pa'i bar du ni de yang bcom ldan 'das thugs rje skye ba ston pa la thugs rje skye ba dang / thugs rje skye ba'i dngos po rnam gnyis ston te /
analyzed: mdo las de byung ma thag tu sems can rnams zhes pa nas sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po rab tu myong ba zhes pa'i bar du ni de yang bcom ldan 'das thugs rje skye ba ston pa la thugs rje skye ba dang / thugs rje skye ba'i dngos po rnam gnyis ston te /
translated: The sutra states, Immediately after that, sentient beings... experience many kinds of suffering, which shows the arising of the Blessed One's compassion. The arising of compassion and the basis of the arising of compassion are shown in two parts.

original: sems can rnams zhes pa ni thugs rje skye'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams zhes pa ni thugs rje skye'o //
translated: The phrase sentient beings shows the arising of compassion.

original: skye rga na 'chi ba la sogs pa ni thugs rje skye ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: skye rga na 'chi ba la sogs pa ni thugs rje skye ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: Birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on are the basis of the arising of compassion.

original: de 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs pa la sems can 'di dag gnas so zhes bcom ldan 'das thugs rje skye ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs pa la sems can 'di dag gnas so zhes bcom ldan 'das thugs rje skye ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One's compassion arises thinking, These sentient beings abide in such various sufferings.

original: de yang sngar ni 'dod pa'i khams @251a * //
analyzed: de yang sngar ni 'dod pa'i khams @251a * //
translated: Moreover, previously, in the desire realm,🔽

original: kyi sdug bsngal bdun bstan /
analyzed: kyi sdug bsngal bdun bstan /
translated: Moreover, previously the seven sufferings of the desire realm were taught.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po zhes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po zhes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal bstan to //
translated: The phrase “many kinds of suffering” teaches the sufferings of the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal yang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid bzhis 'joms pa dang / 'dod pa rnam lngas bsregs pa dang rgyud rnams su 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal yang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid bzhis 'joms pa dang / 'dod pa rnam lngas bsregs pa dang rgyud rnams su 'khor ba'o //
translated: The sufferings of the desire realm are destroyed by the four characteristics of conditioned states, burned by the five kinds of desires, and revolve in the various continua.

original: de yang snga ma gsum ni tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de yang snga ma gsum ni tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Moreover, the first three are the sufferings of this life.

original: gcig ni tshe phyi ma'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gcig ni tshe phyi ma'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The last one is the suffering of the next life.

original: yang na snga ma gnyis ni 'dod pa mi rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: yang na snga ma gnyis ni 'dod pa mi rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Alternatively, the first two are the suffering of not obtaining what one desires.

original: 'khor bar 'khor ba ni sdug pa dang bral ba dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'khor ba ni sdug pa dang bral ba dang mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Revolving in cyclic existence is the suffering of being separated from what is attractive and encountering what is unattractive.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'am /
translated: The phrase “various kinds” refers to the five appropriated aggregates that are the basis of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal brgyad la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal brgyad la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The eight sufferings and so on are included in these.

original: dbang po lnga dang mngon par 'gyur ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang mngon par 'gyur ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The five faculties and their manifestation are suffering.

original: yid kyi dbang po dang phrad pa ni 'khrug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po dang phrad pa ni 'khrug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The contact of the mental faculty is agitation and so on.

original: mdo las da ltar gyi tshe la tshol ba'i phyir yongs su bsags pa'i phyir zhes pa nas sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu myong ba zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dod pas gdungs pa dang / 'khor bar 'khor ba bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las da ltar gyi tshe la tshol ba'i phyir yongs su bsags pa'i phyir zhes pa nas sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu myong ba zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dod pas gdungs pa dang / 'khor bar 'khor ba bstan te /
translated: The sutra states: “Because of seeking the present life, because of accumulating, up to experiencing the suffering of being separated from the pleasant” explains the burning of desire and the wheel of samsara.

original: ma rnyed pa tshol ba dang / rnyed pa yongs su sog pa'i phyir sdug bsngal skye'o //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa tshol ba dang / rnyed pa yongs su sog pa'i phyir sdug bsngal skye'o //
translated: Suffering arises because of seeking what is not obtained and accumulating what is obtained.

original: dbul phongs pa'i sdug bsngal ni mi dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbul phongs pa'i sdug bsngal ni mi dang sbyar ro //
translated: The suffering of poverty is applied to humans.

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang sdug pa dang bal ba'i sdug bsngal ni lha dang mi gnyi ga dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang sdug pa dang bal ba'i sdug bsngal ni lha dang mi gnyi ga dang sbyar ro //
translated: The suffering of meeting with the unpleasant and being separated from the pleasant is applied to both gods and humans.

original: lha dang mi la sdug bsngal de rab tu che ba'i phyir gzhan las bkar te smos so //
analyzed: lha dang mi la sdug bsngal de rab tu che ba'i phyir gzhan las bkar te smos so //
translated: Because that suffering is very great for gods and humans, it is mentioned separately from others.

original: mdo las de nyid du sdug bsngal gyi phung por 'khor zhing zhes pa nas yid la bya ba mi bskyed par gzigs so zhes pa'i bar du ni sdug bsngal de dag la gnas kyang spong zhing skye bar mi sems te rjes su dpog pa'i sgo nas rig pa🔽mi bskyed / mngon sum gyi sgo nas tshor bar mi byed /
analyzed: mdo las de nyid du sdug bsngal gyi phung por 'khor zhing zhes pa nas yid la bya ba mi bskyed par gzigs so zhes pa'i bar du ni sdug bsngal de dag la gnas kyang spong zhing skye bar mi sems te rjes su dpog pa'i sgo nas rig pa mi bskyed / mngon sum gyi sgo nas tshor bar mi byed /
translated: The sutra from “They circle in the aggregate of suffering” up to “he does not generate mental activity” teaches that although he abides in those sufferings, he does not think of abandoning them and being reborn.🔽He does not generate them by way of inference, he does not feel them by way of direct perception.

original: 'bras bu la mi 'jig pa dang rgyu la mi grag pa de dag kun la skyo ba mi bskyed 'byung bar mi sems te de la gzhol der rgyugs ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu la mi 'jig pa dang rgyu la mi grag pa de dag kun la skyo ba mi bskyed 'byung bar mi sems te de la gzhol der rgyugs ces pa'i don to //
translated: He does not generate weariness toward all of them, he does not think of arising from them.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu nga ni sems can 'di dag gi pha ste zhes pa nas de ltar gzigs so zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di theg pa chen po la re ba bskyed pa bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu nga ni sems can 'di dag gi pha ste zhes pa nas de ltar gzigs so zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di theg pa chen po la re ba bskyed pa bstan te /
translated: The sutra from “Śāriputra, I am the father of these sentient beings” up to “he sees in that way” teaches generating hope in the Mahāyāna.

original: de yang theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu sems su bcug ste gdul pa dang theg pa chen po'i rgyu @251b bstan te gdul ba dang theg pa chen po'i spyod pa gsang ba bstan te gdul ba dang theg pa chen po mngon du chud par bya ba ston pa
analyzed: de yang theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu sems su bcug ste gdul pa dang theg pa chen po'i rgyu @251b bstan te gdul ba dang theg pa chen po'i spyod pa gsang ba bstan te gdul ba dang theg pa chen po mngon du chud par bya ba ston pa
translated: They are training in the Mahayana by introducing beings to the Mahayana result, training in the Mahayana by teaching the Mahayana causes, training in the Mahayana by teaching the secret conduct of the Mahayana and training in the Mahayana by teaching the realization of the Mahayana.

original: dang bzhi la 'di ni dang po dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dang bzhi la 'di ni dang po dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the first of these.

original: mdo las de la sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas sems can de dag chos de dag gis 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chen po'i rgyu sems su gzhug pas gdul ba ste /
analyzed: mdo las de la sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas sems can de dag chos de dag gis 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chen po'i rgyu sems su gzhug pas gdul ba ste /
translated: In the sutra, from “O Shariputra” up to “those beings will not emerge through those dharmas” is training in the Mahayana by introducing beings to the Mahayana result.

original: gong du khang pa de yang gcig la zhes 'byung ba de dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gong du khang pa de yang gcig la zhes 'byung ba de dang sbyar te /
translated: This is connected with the above passage “That house is also one.”

original: sgo de las byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa 'ba' zhig gis 'byung gi gzhan gyis 'byung nus pa ma yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: sgo de las byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa 'ba' zhig gis 'byung gi gzhan gyis 'byung nus pa ma yin pa bstan te /
translated: It teaches that only the bodhisattva vehicle emerges from that door and that the other vehicles are incapable of emerging.

original: stobs dang rdzu 'phrul sogs pa rgya chen po bstan pas theg pa rnam gnyis snod chung du can spyod pa zhan pa 'dor zhing theg pa chen po la zhugs pas 'dod khams gsum la 'byung gi gzhan gyi thabs dang spyod pa la gnas pas 'byung bar mi nus🔽pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: stobs dang rdzu 'phrul sogs pa rgya chen po bstan pas theg pa rnam gnyis snod chung du can spyod pa zhan pa 'dor zhing theg pa chen po la zhugs pas 'dod khams gsum la 'byung gi gzhan gyi thabs dang spyod pa la gnas pas 'byung bar mi nus pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are born in the three realms, but they cannot be born by abiding in the methods and conduct of others.

original: mdo las de ci'i phyir zhe na sems can 'di dag ni zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar gzigs so zhes pa'i bar du ni re ba med par chen po thob pa bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las de ci'i phyir zhe na sems can 'di dag ni zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar gzigs so zhes pa'i bar du ni re ba med par chen po thob pa bstan te /
translated: In the sutra, from “Why is it so? These sentient beings…” up to “…the Tathagata sees it that way,” it teaches the attainment of the great without hope.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes zab mo de bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir re ba med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes zab mo de bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir re ba med ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “without hope” is that it is not possible to teach that profound wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: mdo las de sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas theg pa gsum mngon par ston pa'i bar du ni ji ltar 'byung ba'i thabs sbyor ba bstan pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: mdo las de sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa nas theg pa gsum mngon par ston pa'i bar du ni ji ltar 'byung ba'i thabs sbyor ba bstan pa dang sbyar te /
translated: In the sutra, from “That is why, Shariputra…” up to “…demonstrates the three vehicles,” it is connected with the teaching of the application of the method of how it occurs.

original: stobs la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam gzhag ste gsung gi thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams me 'bar ba'i khang pa las thar bar byas nas gdod theg pa chen po ston zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam gzhag ste gsung gi thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams me 'bar ba'i khang pa las thar bar byas nas gdod theg pa chen po ston zhes pa'o //
translated: The arrangement of the miracles of power and so forth is the skillful means of speech.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sman pa mkhas pa nad thabs dang sbyor zhing sman gtong ba bzhin sems can gyi dbang po dang sbyor zhing chos ston zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sman pa mkhas pa nad thabs dang sbyor zhing sman gtong ba bzhin sems can gyi dbang po dang sbyor zhing chos ston zhes pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat, like a skilled physician, teaches the Dharma in accordance with the faculties of sentient beings.

original: mdo las khyed cag 'bar ba'i khyim dang 'dra ba'i zhes pa nas /🔽khams 'di nas byung la zhes pa'i bar du 'di ni theg pa rnam gsum dngos su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las khyed cag 'bar ba'i khyim dang 'dra ba'i zhes pa nas / khams 'di nas byung la zhes pa'i bar du 'di ni theg pa rnam gsum dngos su bstan pa ste /
translated: The sutra says, “You are like a burning house,” and so on, up to “arising from this element.”🔽This is the explicit teaching of the three vehicles.

original: de yang khams gsum la skyo ba bskyed pa dang / theg pa rnam pa gsum la gzud pa dang / mngon du chud pa rnams kyi dpe dang / theg pa chen po'i bsngags pa dang bzhi zhig ston pa la 'di ni dang po dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang khams gsum la skyo ba bskyed pa dang / theg pa rnam pa gsum la gzud pa dang / mngon du chud pa rnams kyi dpe dang / theg pa chen po'i bsngags pa dang bzhi zhig ston pa la 'di ni dang po dang sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, it teaches four things: generating weariness with the three realms, introducing the three vehicles, the example for those who have realized the three vehicles, and the praise of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'dod pa lnga ni phyi'i yul lo //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga ni phyi'i yul lo //
translated: The five desires are external objects.

original: gdung ba zhes pa ni nang gi dmigs pa ste /🔽de gnyis spong ba la khams gsum nas 'byung ba'i lam @252a * //
analyzed: gdung ba zhes pa ni nang gi dmigs pa ste / de gnyis spong ba la khams gsum nas 'byung ba'i lam @252a * //
translated: The burning is the internal object.

original: tshol cig pa'o //
analyzed: tshol cig pa'o //
translated: The path that comes out of the three realms is the path that abandons those two.

original: mdo las nyan thos kyi theg pa dang zhes pa nas thob par gyis shig ces pa'i bar du ni theg pa rnam gsum thob pa stsol du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: mdo las nyan thos kyi theg pa dang zhes pa nas thob par gyis shig ces pa'i bar du ni theg pa rnam gsum thob pa stsol du gzhug pa'o //
translated: The Sūtra says, “You should seek the path of the śrāvakas” up to “you should attain it.”

original: mdo las nga ni gnas 'di la khyed kyi snying rje ba ste zhes pa nas brtson 'grus gyis shig ces pa'i bar du ni /
analyzed: mdo las nga ni gnas 'di la khyed kyi snying rje ba ste zhes pa nas brtson 'grus gyis shig ces pa'i bar du ni /
translated: The Sūtra says, “I am compassionate toward you in this matter” up to “strive.”

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon du chud pa'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon du chud pa'i dpe bstan te /
translated: This teaches the example of the realization of the āryas.

original: theg pa rnam gsum gyi don 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon du gzigs pa'i phyir bslu ba ma yin no zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa rnam gsum gyi don 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon du gzigs pa'i phyir bslu ba ma yin no zhes ston pa'o //
translated: It teaches that the meaning of the three vehicles is not deceptive because it is directly seen by the āryas.

original: mdo las kye ma sems can dag zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las kye ma sems can dag zhes pa nas /
translated: The Sūtra says, “Alas, sentient beings” up to “they will run around.”

original: kun tu rgyug par 'gyur gyis zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chen po'i yon tan bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu rgyug par 'gyur gyis zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chen po'i yon tan bsngags pa ste /
translated: This praises the qualities of the Mahāyāna.

original: sngar ni 'khor ba dang mi mthun pa bstan /
analyzed: sngar ni 'khor ba dang mi mthun pa bstan /
translated: Previously, the vehicle was taught to be incompatible with cyclic existence.

original: de'i 'og tu ni theg pa gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa las bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni theg pa gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa las bsngags pa ste /
translated: Subsequently, it was praised as being superior to other vehicles.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'khor ba ni nyon mongs pas bcings pa rang dbang med pa yin na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'khor ba ni nyon mongs pas bcings pa rang dbang med pa yin na /
translated: If worldly cyclic existence is bound by afflictions and lacks independence,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs shing brnyes pa'i theg pa ni zag pa med pas dga' ba chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs shing brnyes pa'i theg pa ni zag pa med pas dga' ba chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: then the vehicle attained and seen by the noble ones possesses great joy because it is uncontaminated.

original: mi phongs par rtsen zhes gzhan la rag lus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phongs par rtsen zhes gzhan la rag lus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a play of the fearless, because it is independent of others.

original: mi phongs pa ni mi tshol ba'i don te tshol ba rnam gsum spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mi phongs pa ni mi tshol ba'i don te tshol ba rnam gsum spangs pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness means not seeking, because it abandons the three kinds of seeking.

original: tshol ba rnam gsum ni 'dod pa'i tshol ba dang / srid pa'i tshol ba dang / log pa'i spyod pas tshol ba'o //
analyzed: tshol ba rnam gsum ni 'dod pa'i tshol ba dang / srid pa'i tshol ba dang / log pa'i spyod pas tshol ba'o //
translated: The three kinds of seeking are seeking desire, seeking existence, and seeking wrong conduct.

original: mdo las dbang po dang stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang zhes pa nas yid bde ba chen po dang ldan par byos shig ces pa'i bar ni 'dis theg pa'i dmigs pa'i yon tan bstan te theg pa chen po de stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /
analyzed: mdo las dbang po dang stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang zhes pa nas yid bde ba chen po dang ldan par byos shig ces pa'i bar ni 'dis theg pa'i dmigs pa'i yon tan bstan te theg pa chen po de stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /
translated: The sutra from the phrase the powers and the branches of enlightenment up to you should possess great mental satisfaction teaches the qualities of the object of the Mahayana because the Mahayana is the object of the powers, the four fearlessnesses, the seven branches of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum la sogs pa la dmigs shing gnas pa'i phyir bde ba dang yid bde ba skye zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum la sogs pa la dmigs shing gnas pa'i phyir bde ba dang yid bde ba skye zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the eightfold noble path, the four concentrations, the nine meditative absorptions, the eight liberations, the three samadhis and so on and because it is the object of the Mahayana that one abides in and generates bliss and mental satisfaction.

original: mdo las de la sh'a ri'i bu sems can gang mkhas par 'gyur zhes pa ni byis pa kha cig ri dags kyi shing rta 'dod de 'byung ba bzhin zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab la brten te /
analyzed: mdo las de la sh'a ri'i bu sems can gang mkhas par 'gyur zhes pa ni byis pa kha cig ri dags kyi shing rta 'dod de 'byung ba bzhin zhes pa'i bar du ni 'di man chad de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab la brten te /
translated: The sutra from the phrase in this regard, Shariputra, those sentient beings who become wise up to some childish beings desire a deer drawn chariot is the section that depends on the teachings of the Tathagata.

original: theg pa rnam gsum so sor grol ba thob par ston pa la /
analyzed: theg pa rnam gsum so sor grol ba thob par ston pa la /
translated: The three vehicles are taught to be the attainment of individual liberation.🔽🔽

original: 'di nyan thos kyi theg pa dang sbyar te @252b dpe dang don du sbyar bar dbye'o //
analyzed: 'di nyan thos kyi theg pa dang sbyar te @252b dpe dang don du sbyar bar dbye'o //
translated: The teaching that one attains liberation in each of the three vehicles is applied to the disciples' vehicle in the analogy and the meaning.

original: mkhas par gyur pa zhes pa ni mthu rnam bzhi ston te mkhas pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: mkhas par gyur pa zhes pa ni mthu rnam bzhi ston te mkhas pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa'i mthu'o //
translated: The phrase having become learned indicates the four powers: learning is the power of cause;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mthu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mthu'o //
translated: the phrase thus have I heard indicates the power of the spiritual friend;

original: pha rol gyi sgra thos zhes pa ni yid la byed pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sgra thos zhes pa ni yid la byed pa'i mthu'o //
translated: the phrase having heard the words of others indicates the power of attention;

original: brtson par byed ces pa ni tshogs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: brtson par byed ces pa ni tshogs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: and the phrase striving indicates the power of the collection.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung ba dang phrad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung ba dang phrad de /
translated: Having met with the appearance of a Tathagata in the world,

original: rigs kyi rgyu bzhin du sems bskyed la dad pas chos nyan cing brtson pas tshig stsogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi rgyu bzhin du sems bskyed la dad pas chos nyan cing brtson pas tshig stsogs pa'o //
translated: having generated the thought of enlightenment through the cause of the spiritual gene, having heard the Dharma with faith, and having striven to retain the words,

original: brtson pa ni spyod pa thams cad sdud pa'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: brtson pa ni spyod pa thams cad sdud pa'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: one should strive, for striving is the principal means of gathering all the practices.

original: bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes pa ni spyod pa zhan pas gzhan gyi don mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das zhes pa ni spyod pa zhan pas gzhan gyi don mi byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase having attained complete nirvana indicates that one does not work for the benefit of others through weak practice.

original: pha rol las thos zhes pa yang 'phags pa'i man ngag pas 'bras bu rnyed par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol las thos zhes pa yang 'phags pa'i man ngag pas 'bras bu rnyed par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Also, from another means that one attains the fruit by the instructions of a noble being, not by any other means.🔽The sutra from, The wisdom of other sentient beings without a teacher... up to, ...like a child who desires a cart, shows that this wisdom arises by the three powers.

original: mdo las sems can gzhan slob dpon med pa'i ye shes dang zhes pa nas byis pa kha cig ra'i shing rta 'dod pa de 'byung ba bzhin no zhes ba'i bar du ni 'di ni mthu rnam gsum gyis 'byung bar byed pa de'i rgyu mi dgos par rang bzhin
analyzed: mdo las sems can gzhan slob dpon med pa'i ye shes dang zhes pa nas byis pa kha cig ra'i shing rta 'dod pa de 'byung ba bzhin no zhes ba'i bar du ni 'di ni mthu rnam gsum gyis 'byung bar byed pa de'i rgyu mi dgos par rang bzhin
translated: The cause of that is not necessary.

original: gyi shes pas sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten du 'bras bu thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gyi shes pas sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten du 'bras bu thob par byed pa ste /
translated: By the wisdom of the nature of things, one attains the fruit in a world where there is no Buddha.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung mngon du thos pas lam thob pa ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung mngon du thos pas lam thob pa ltar ma yin te /
translated: It is not like the noble sravakas who attain the path by directly hearing the speech of the Bhagavan.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don zab mo rtogs pas 'bras bu thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don zab mo rtogs pas 'bras bu thob ces pa'o //
translated: It is said that one attains the fruit by realizing the profound meaning of dependent origination.

original: de yang bse ru bzhin gnas pa dang khyus lding pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bse ru bzhin gnas pa dang khyus lding pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is like the rhinoceros and the flock.

original: sngar bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la zhugs pa la phyis 'bras bu thob pas na rang gis rig zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la zhugs pa la phyis 'bras bu thob pas na rang gis rig zhes pa'o //
translated: Since one who previously entered the teaching of the Bhagavat later obtains the result, it is called “self-cognized.”

original: mdo las sems can gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen gyi ye shes zhes pa nas bus pa kha cig glang gi shing rta 'dod de 'byung ba yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chen po dang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa zhes dbye zhing ston te /
analyzed: mdo las sems can gzhan yang thams cad mkhyen gyi ye shes zhes pa nas bus pa kha cig glang gi shing rta 'dod de 'byung ba yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa chen po dang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa zhes dbye zhing ston te /
translated: In the sūtras, from “the wisdom of omniscience” up to “some children desire an elephant-drawn chariot,” the Mahāyāna and the Bodhisattva-yāna are distinguished and taught.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni stong pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni stong pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Omniscience is the wisdom that knows emptiness.

original: theg pa rnam gsum kun la yang ye shes mnga' mod kyi dngos po la gzigs pa'i ye shes ni bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig la mnga' ba dang rang rig pa'i ye shes nyid ni rang byung gi ye shes so //
analyzed: theg pa rnam gsum kun la yang ye shes mnga' mod kyi dngos po la gzigs pa'i ye shes ni bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig la mnga' ba dang rang rig pa'i ye shes nyid ni rang byung gi ye shes so //
translated: Although all three yānas possess wisdom, the wisdom that sees things exists only in the Bhagavat, and the wisdom of self-awareness itself is the wisdom that arises by itself.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med par mkhyen pa ni mkhan po med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med par mkhyen pa ni mkhan po med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Knowledge without depending on another is the wisdom without a teacher.

original: yang na de ye shes kyi rang bzhin ni rang byung gi ye shes so //
analyzed: yang na de ye shes kyi rang bzhin ni rang byung gi ye shes so //
translated: Or else, its nature is that of intuition, which is self-originated intuition.

original: ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ni @253a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ni @253a * //
translated: The characteristic of intuition is

original: mkhan po med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mkhan po med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: intuition without a teacher.

original: ye shes de gnyis kyi 'khor ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa nang gi yon tan dag go //
analyzed: ye shes de gnyis kyi 'khor ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa nang gi yon tan dag go //
translated: The retinue of these two intuitions is the inner qualities such as the powers and the fearlessnesses.

original: yon tan de dag gis 'gro ba rnams byams pa dang thugs rjes phan pa dang bde bar mdzad cing sems can sgrol bas theg pa chen po zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: yon tan de dag gis 'gro ba rnams byams pa dang thugs rjes phan pa dang bde bar mdzad cing sems can sgrol bas theg pa chen po zhes bya'o ;
translated: Since by these qualities he benefits and gladdens the worlds with love and compassion and liberates beings, he is called the Great Vehicle.

original: / byang chub zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum thun mong gi ming ste de dag la khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes smos so //
analyzed: / byang chub zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum thun mong gi ming ste de dag la khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes smos so //
translated: Enlightenment is the name common to the three vehicles. In order to teach its distinction, he says great being.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa nas bus pa de dag la bzhon pa chen po gcig byin pa de bzhin du zhes pa'i bar du ni yang dag pa nyid ston pa la rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste dper na zhes pa nas bus pa de dag la bzhon pa chen po gcig byin pa de bzhin du zhes pa'i bar du ni yang dag pa nyid ston pa la rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: In the sutra, For example, Shariputra, up to just as he gave them one great vehicle, so also the Tathagata, there are two divisions in the teaching of reality.

original: yang dag la bstan pa dang / the tshom dgrol ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag la bstan pa dang / the tshom dgrol ba'o //
translated: the teaching of the truth, and the resolution of doubts.

original: de yang bu rnams kyi re ba las 'gal ba bstan pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de yang bu rnams kyi re ba las 'gal ba bstan pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the teaching of the reversal of the sons' hope, and the application of the example to the meaning.

original: dpe la yang bu'i phyir thon pa mthong ba dang / pha'i yid rangs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dpe la yang bu'i phyir thon pa mthong ba dang / pha'i yid rangs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: In the example, it shows the seeing of the escape for the sons, and the delight of the father.

original: mdo dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdo dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: It is to be applied to the sutra as is appropriate.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par gzigs na zhes pa'i bar du ni pha'i bsam pa bstan te khams gsum g-yang zab me 'bar ba'i khang pa lta bu las 'gro ba mang po bton nas
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par gzigs na zhes pa'i bar du ni pha'i bsam pa bstan te khams gsum g-yang zab me 'bar ba'i khang pa lta bu las 'gro ba mang po bton nas
translated: In the sutra, from Sariputra, the Tathagata sees up to attains the bliss of nirvana, it shows the thought of the father. Having rescued many beings from the three realms, which are like a burning house with a deep abyss,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yang dag pa'i sgor gzud pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde ba dam pa la yongs su bkod de 'jigs pa dang 'tshe ba thams cad las thar zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yang dag pa'i sgor gzud pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bde ba dam pa la yongs su bkod de 'jigs pa dang 'tshe ba thams cad las thar zhes pa'i don to //
translated: he leads them into the door of the true teaching of the Tathagata, and establishes them in the supreme bliss of nirvana, free from all dangers and harm. This is the meaning.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de dag la de'i tshe zhes pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed kyi zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa rnam gnyis dang byang chub sems dpa' las sras su 'dra bas gzud pa'i phyir de gnyi ga yang theg pa chen🔽po'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la dgod kyi gzhan la mi gsung zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de dag la de'i tshe zhes pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed kyi zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa rnam gnyis dang byang chub sems dpa' las sras su 'dra bas gzud pa'i phyir de gnyi ga yang theg pa chen po'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la dgod kyi gzhan la mi gsung zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The sutra from “at that time, Shariputra” up to “they will attain parinirvana” shows that both of those are established in the Mahayana nirvana, because they are like sons of the bodhisattvas, in order to introduce them to the two vehicles.

original: mdo las sems can gang la yang zhes pa nas dga' bar 'gyur ba thams cad kha dog gcig pa sbyin par mdzad do zhes pa'i bar du ni de yang theg pa'i rang bzhin dang theg pa'i yon tan ston pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: mdo las sems can gang la yang zhes pa nas dga' bar 'gyur ba thams cad kha dog gcig pa sbyin par mdzad do zhes pa'i bar du ni de yang theg pa'i rang bzhin dang theg pa'i yon tan ston pa la 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: The sutra from “I do not speak of any sentient being” up to “they will attain parinirvana” shows that the nature of the vehicle and the qualities of the vehicle are taught here.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang nyan thos pa'i rigs rnams la dge ba thams cad rdzogs par bstan pa'i phyir theg pa rnam gcig byin pa bstan to //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang nyan thos pa'i rigs rnams la dge ba thams cad rdzogs par bstan pa'i phyir theg pa rnam gcig byin pa bstan to //
translated: The gift of the single vehicle is taught in order to show that all virtues are perfected in those of indeterminate lineage, and in bodhisattva lineage and shravaka lineage.

original: kha dog gcig pa bde ba dam rtsen pa //
analyzed: kha dog gcig pa bde ba dam rtsen pa //
translated: The single color is the bliss of the supreme seal.

original: zhes @253b pa ni theg pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: zhes @253b pa ni theg pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the virtues of the vehicle.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa ni yon tan thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa ni yon tan thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa'o //
translated: All causes and effects unmixed with addictions are the basis of all virtues.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos can 'phags pa rnams kyis bsngags par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos can 'phags pa rnams kyis bsngags par bya'o //
translated: They are praised by the noble ones who have the uncontaminated Dharma.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste thams cad la byin pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba ma yin pa de bzhin du zhes pa ni the tshom bsal ba bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste thams cad la byin pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba ma yin pa de bzhin du zhes pa ni the tshom bsal ba bstan te /
translated: The sutra states: Shariputra, just as it is not lying because it is given to all, so it is. This shows the removal of doubt.

original: dpes gleng ba dang / dogs pa bsal ba dang / dris pa dang / de'i lan la sogs pa ci rigs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dpes gleng ba dang / dogs pa bsal ba dang / dris pa dang / de'i lan la sogs pa ci rigs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The discussion by analogy, the removal of doubt, the question, the answer to that, and so on, are applied as appropriate.

original: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa nas yongs su mya ngan las zlo ba'i phyir brdzun du smra ba ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa nas yongs su mya ngan las zlo ba'i phyir brdzun du smra ba ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The sutra states: Shariputra, from the Tathagata up to the parinirvana, it is not lying. This is easy to understand, so it is not explained.

original: mdo las de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa nas bang mdzod mang po dang ldan te zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa gcig po 'di yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: mdo las de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa nas bang mdzod mang po dang ldan te zhes pa'i bar du ni theg pa gcig po 'di yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan te /
translated: The passage from the sutra that goes, “Why is it so? Because this one vehicle has inconceivable good qualities.

original: sems can rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rigs can thams cad kyis de la longs spyod du zin gyis kyang mi zad pa bstan to //
analyzed: sems can rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rigs can thams cad kyis de la longs spyod du zin gyis kyang mi zad pa bstan to //
translated: Even if all sentient beings of all kinds were to enjoy it, it would not be exhausted” shows that this one vehicle has inconceivable good qualities.

original: mdo las sems can kun thams cad mkhyen gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i chos zhes pa nas gzhung 'dis kyang de lta bur rig par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dis bsdus pa bstan te theg pa gcig po ston pa'i rigs pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi theg pa rnam gsum du ston pa'i bye brag dang gtan tshigs bstan pas 'bras bu bla na med pa ni gcig tu zad par bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: mdo las sems can kun thams cad mkhyen gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i chos zhes pa nas gzhung 'dis kyang de lta bur rig par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dis bsdus pa bstan te theg pa gcig po ston pa'i rigs pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi theg pa rnam gsum du ston pa'i bye brag dang gtan tshigs bstan pas 'bras bu bla na med pa ni gcig tu zad par bshad pa yin no /
translated: The passage from the sutra that goes, “All sentient beings possess the Dharma of omniscient gnosis” up to “This should be understood in the same way” shows that this is the summary. The reasoning that teaches the one vehicle, the specific and general reasons that teach the three vehicles as causes and conditions, and the explanation that the result is the single unsurpassed vehicle are the summary.

analyzed: khang pa 'drums pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su phye ste /

analyzed: de'i 'og gi tshigs bcad lngas ni gzugs kyi phung po mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang mi gtsang ba dang stong pa'i don bstan /
