original: rab rtsig pa dag kyang de bzhin zhig / zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dis ni dbang po med cing mi gtsang ba'i gnas lus 'di rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gis glags shing khyab par byas pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: rab rtsig pa dag kyang de bzhin zhig / zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dis ni dbang po med cing mi gtsang ba'i gnas lus 'di rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gis glags shing khyab par byas pa'i don bstan to //
translated: The verse up to “the walls are also destroyed in the same way” teaches the meaning of this body, which is a place of uncleanness without faculties, being occupied and pervaded by thirty-six substances.🔽A sūtra says:

original: mdo las / de gnas bya rgod bye ba dag dang ni //
analyzed: mdo las / de gnas bya rgod bye ba dag dang ni //
translated: In that place, there are ten million vultures,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: mi ma yin mang gnas dang gnas dag na //
analyzed: mi ma yin mang gnas dang gnas dag na //
translated: In the many places of non-humans, in the places.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa dgus phyogs sna tshogs nas gnod pa'i ltas ngan pa mang du 'byung ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa dgus phyogs sna tshogs nas gnod pa'i ltas ngan pa mang du 'byung ba bstan te /
translated: Up to here, twenty-nine verses teach the appearance of many inauspicious signs of harm from various directions.

original: de la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
translated: That is also divided into three parts.

original: dang po tshig phyed dang bco brgyad kyis ni 'dre dang srin bu rnams bstan /
analyzed: dang po tshig phyed dang bco brgyad kyis ni 'dre dang srin bu rnams bstan /
translated: The first, up to eighteen lines, teaches ghosts and worms.

original: de'i 'og tu tshig phyed dang bcu gcig gis ni de dag 'byung ba'i gnas bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshig phyed dang bcu gcig gis ni de dag 'byung ba'i gnas bstan /
translated: After that, up to eleven lines, it teaches the places where they arise.

original: tshigs bcad gcig gis ni bsdus pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs bcad gcig gis ni bsdus pa'i don bstan te /
translated: One verse teaches the summarized meaning.

original: de dag kyang nyon mongs pa bcu'i mtshan nyid ltas ngan gyi don du bstan te /
analyzed: de dag kyang nyon mongs pa bcu'i mtshan nyid ltas ngan gyi don du bstan te /
translated: Also, those are taught as the meaning of bad omens, the characteristics of the ten afflictions.

original: 'gro ba rnams de la 'jigs shing skyo ba dang / sbong du gzhug pa'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams de la 'jigs shing skyo ba dang / sbong du gzhug pa'i phyir bstan to //
translated: They are taught in order to frighten and discourage beings from them.

original: @255a * // srog chags snga ma'i ltas kyis ni gdug pa chung zhing gnod pa bags kyis byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: @255a * // srog chags snga ma'i ltas kyis ni gdug pa chung zhing gnod pa bags kyis byed pa'i don te /
translated: The example of the previous living being indicates the meaning of small poison and gradual harm.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa lnga dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa lnga dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to the five, desire and so on.

original: de'i 'og ma 'dre gdon mthu che la gnod pa myur bar byed pa'i dpes ni lta ba rnam pa lnga bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma 'dre gdon mthu che la gnod pa myur bar byed pa'i dpes ni lta ba rnam pa lnga bstan to //
translated: The example of the next ghost with great power and quick harm indicates the five views.

original: de'i 'og gi tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis kyis ni nyes pa'i skyon bsdu ba bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og gi tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis kyis ni nyes pa'i skyon bsdu ba bstan /
translated: The next two and a half verses teach the summary of faults.

original: de la yang rnam pa gnyis su phye ste /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis su phye ste /
translated: They are also divided into two parts.

original: tshig phyed dang drug gis ni so so'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba bstan /
analyzed: tshig phyed dang drug gis ni so so'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba bstan /
translated: The first six lines teach the characteristics of each.

original: de'i 'og ma tshigs bcad phyed kyis ni bsdus pa'i don bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og ma tshigs bcad phyed kyis ni bsdus pa'i don bstan /
translated: The next half verse teaches the summarized meaning.

original: dang po la yang rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po la yang rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into five parts.

original: dang po'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis ni 'dod chags kyi dpe bstan /🔽de'i 'og ma tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis kyis ni zhe sdang gi dpe bstan /
analyzed: dang po'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis ni 'dod chags kyi dpe bstan / de'i 'og ma tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis kyis ni zhe sdang gi dpe bstan /
translated: The first half verse shows the example of passion.🔽The next one and a half verses show the example of hatred.

original: de'i 'og ma tshigs bcad gcig gis ni gti mug gi dpe bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og ma tshigs bcad gcig gis ni gti mug gi dpe bstan /
translated: The next verse shows the example of delusion.

original: de'i 'og ma gcig gis ni the tshom gyi dpe bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gcig gis ni the tshom gyi dpe bstan /
translated: The next shows the example of doubt.

original: gcig gis ni nga rgyal gyi dpe bstan to //
analyzed: gcig gis ni nga rgyal gyi dpe bstan to //
translated: The next shows the example of pride.

original: 'dod chags la rnam pa bzhi ste mngon du chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dang ; chags pa dang zhen pa gnyis dang ldan pa dang / yul de dang de la dga' zhing chags pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la rnam pa bzhi ste mngon du chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dang ; chags pa dang zhen pa gnyis dang ldan pa dang / yul de dang de la dga' zhing chags pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Passion has four aspects: manifest passion, passion that will arise, passion that is present, and passion that is accompanied by two attachments.

original: bya rgod dang phug ron la sogs pa rim par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bya rgod dang phug ron la sogs pa rim par sbyar ro //
translated: The four aspects of passion are applied in order to the vulture, the dove, and so on.

original: bya de dag 'dod chags che ba'i phyir 'dod chags bzhi dang brgyad du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bya de dag 'dod chags che ba'i phyir 'dod chags bzhi dang brgyad du sbyar ro //
translated: Because those birds are very passionate, passion is applied to four and eight.

original: zhe sdang la yang dpe rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang la yang dpe rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: Hatred also has eleven examples,

original: sbrul la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: such as the snake, and so on.

original: de la zhe sdang rnam pa bcu ni de'i lus kyi phyir zhe sdang ba dang / yid du 'ong ba'i sems can gyi phyir zhe sdang ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i phyir zhe sdang ba dang / 'das pa'i dgra la zhe sdang ba dang /🔽da ltar gyi dgra la zhe sdang ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dgra la zhe sdang ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i spyod yul la zhe sdang ba dang / phrag dog pa'i phyir zhe sdang ba dang / sngon gyi bag chags kyi phyir zhe sdang ba dang /
analyzed: de la zhe sdang rnam pa bcu ni de'i lus kyi phyir zhe sdang ba dang / yid du 'ong ba'i sems can gyi phyir zhe sdang ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i phyir zhe sdang ba dang / 'das pa'i dgra la zhe sdang ba dang / da ltar gyi dgra la zhe sdang ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dgra la zhe sdang ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i spyod yul la zhe sdang ba dang / phrag dog pa'i phyir zhe sdang ba dang / sngon gyi bag chags kyi phyir zhe sdang ba dang /
translated: The ten kinds of hatred are: hatred for the body of another, hatred for a sentient being who is dear, hatred for a sentient being who is not dear, hatred for a past enemy,

original: gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa mthong bas zhe sdang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa mthong bas zhe sdang ba'o //
translated: hatred for a present enemy, hatred for a future enemy, hatred for an unpleasant object, hatred from jealousy, hatred from a previous habit, and hatred from seeing another's afflictions.🔽A sutra says:

original: mdo las / bshang gcis rab tu sme bar byas //
analyzed: mdo las / bshang gcis rab tu sme bar byas //
translated: The excrement of the body is smeared on the body.

original: zhes pa dag ni rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gis glags pa gti mug gi phung po yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa dag ni rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gis glags pa gti mug gi phung po yin pa ste /
translated: The mass of delusion is the thirty-six substances that are the basis of delusion.

original: skyo ba dang spang bar bya ba yin gyi dga' ba'i gnas ma yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skyo ba dang spang bar bya ba yin gyi dga' ba'i gnas ma yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: It is to be deprecated and abandoned, and is not taught to be a basis of joy.

original: sbyang ki dang khyi dang wa ni khams gsum mam dus gsum du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sbyang ki dang khyi dang wa ni khams gsum mam dus gsum du sbyar ro //
translated: The dog, jackal, and pig are to be applied to the three realms or the three times.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / mi yi rol rab tu za //
analyzed: mdo las / mi yi rol rab tu za //
translated: The human corpse is eaten.

original: zhes pa ni nga rgyal bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni nga rgyal bstan te /
translated: This teaches pride.

original: nga rgyal gyis rnyed pa la 'thab cing rtsod ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis rnyed pa la 'thab cing rtsod ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that through pride one fights and disputes over gain.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / gnas dang gnas na rnam par 'cha' zhing za //
analyzed: mdo las / gnas dang gnas na rnam par 'cha' zhing za //
translated: In the east and west, they are scattered and eaten.

original: 'thab mo @255b byed de rab tu sgra yang 'byin //
analyzed: 'thab mo @255b byed de rab tu sgra yang 'byin //
translated: They fight and make a great noise.

original: rnam pa de 'dras khyim de shin tu 'jigs //
analyzed: rnam pa de 'dras khyim de shin tu 'jigs //
translated: In this way, the house is very frightening.

original: shin tu sems gtum gnod sbyin de na 'khod /
analyzed: shin tu sems gtum gnod sbyin de na 'khod /
translated: The yakshas there are very fierce.

original: mi yi ro dag la yang rnam 'dren zhing //
analyzed: mi yi ro dag la yang rnam 'dren zhing //
translated: They also lead human corpses.

original: zhes pa ni tshig 'di dag gis nam mkha' la gnas pa'i 'dre gdon gyi dpe lta ba rnam lnga bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni tshig 'di dag gis nam mkha' la gnas pa'i 'dre gdon gyi dpe lta ba rnam lnga bstan te /
translated: These words teach the five types of views that are like the example of ghosts and spirits abiding in the sky.

original: de la tshig dang po gsum gyis ni log par lta ba'i dpe bstan /
analyzed: de la tshig dang po gsum gyis ni log par lta ba'i dpe bstan /
translated: The first three words teach the example of wrong view.

original: de'i 'og ma tshig phyed kyis ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi dpe bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og ma tshig phyed kyis ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi dpe bstan /
translated: The next half word teaches the example of discipline and ritual.

original: de'i 'og mas ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dpe bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og mas ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dpe bstan /
translated: The next verse gives an example of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de'i 'og mas ni lta ba bsnyems pa'i dpe bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og mas ni lta ba bsnyems pa'i dpe bstan /
translated: The next verse gives an example of the inflated view.

original: de'i 'og mas mthar lta ba bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og mas mthar lta ba bstan to //
translated: The next verse teaches the extreme views.

original: yang lta ba de dag la dang por lta ba spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan ;
analyzed: yang lta ba de dag la dang por lta ba spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan ;
translated: Moreover, in those views, first the general characteristics of views are taught.

original: de'i 'og tu lta ba so so'i mtshan nyid dang spyod pa bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lta ba so so'i mtshan nyid dang spyod pa bstan /
translated: Then, the individual characteristics and conduct of the views are taught.

original: gnod sbyin la sogs pa sems gtum po de dag log par lta bas dge ba de dag thams cad kyi rtsa ba med par byed pa nyid gnod sbyin mi'i rol 'brang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gnod sbyin la sogs pa sems gtum po de dag log par lta bas dge ba de dag thams cad kyi rtsa ba med par byed pa nyid gnod sbyin mi'i rol 'brang ba bzhin no //
translated: Those yakṣas and so on with violent minds destroy the root of all that is virtuous through wrong views, like the yakṣa Pūtanā.🔽A sūtra states:

original: mdo las / sbrul dang rkang brgya pa dang gcan gzan rnams //
analyzed: mdo las / sbrul dang rkang brgya pa dang gcan gzan rnams //
translated: Snakes, centipedes, and carnivores

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /

original: zhig pa'i khyim der ni yang gnas 'cha' ste //
analyzed: zhig pa'i khyim der ni yang gnas 'cha' ste //
translated: ...again take up residence in that destroyed house.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni log par lta bas nyon mongs pa thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir dper sems can gtum po gdug pa de dag gis bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni log par lta bas nyon mongs pa thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir dper sems can gtum po gdug pa de dag gis bstan te /
translated: Up to this point, those violent and vicious sentient beings illustrate how wrong view generates all afflictions.

original: skye zhing 'phel ba'i gnas su gyur pa phru gu glog pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: skye zhing 'phel ba'i gnas su gyur pa phru gu glog pa zhes smos so //
translated: The place of their birth and growth is called the womb.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / ji tsam gnod sbyin de dag 'grangs gyur pa ;
analyzed: mdo las / ji tsam gnod sbyin de dag 'grangs gyur pa ;
translated: To the extent that the yakshas are satisfied,

original: / zhes pa nas /
analyzed: / zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: 'khang du bcug pa de la dga' bar byed //
analyzed: 'khang du bcug pa de la dga' bar byed //
translated: they are pleased by the complaints.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni log par lta ba la sogs te lta ba rnam lngas rgyas shing 'phel bar gyur pa nyid 'grangs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni log par lta ba la sogs te lta ba rnam lngas rgyas shing 'phel bar gyur pa nyid 'grangs par gyur pa ste /
translated: The five views, such as wrong view, increase and expand and are called satisfaction.🔽Because they are terrifying through the three doors, they are like those who are pleased by the complaints of sentient beings who are tormented by the pride of moral discipline and ascetic practice.

original: sgo gsum nas spyod pa rnam pa gzhan gyis 'jigs su rung ba'i phyir dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pas sems can gtses pa'i 'khang pas bdag dga' bar byed pa bzhin du tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pas mtho ris bgrod pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sgo gsum nas spyod pa rnam pa gzhan gyis 'jigs su rung ba'i phyir dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pas sems can gtses pa'i 'khang pas bdag dga' bar byed pa bzhin du tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pas mtho ris bgrod pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The pride of moral discipline and ascetic practice that leads to higher rebirth is similar to that.

original: mtho gang tshad dang de bzhin khru gang tshad //
analyzed: mtho gang tshad dang de bzhin khru gang tshad //
translated: The size of the womb is one cubit and one🔽handspan.

original: zhes pa ni tshul khrims bsnyems pa dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa gtso yin par 'dzin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don tshol ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni tshul khrims bsnyems pa dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa gtso yin par 'dzin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don tshol ba nyid do //
translated: This verse shows that the search for the meaning of the supramundane is the pride of morality and the pride of ritual and austerity.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / de dag khyi rnams rkang nas bzung nas ni //
analyzed: mdo las / de dag khyi rnams rkang nas bzung nas ni //
translated: They seize the dogs by the legs

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: and

original: 'khang du bcug pa de la dga' bar byed //
analyzed: 'khang du bcug pa de la dga' bar byed //
translated: they delight in the one who is reviled.🔽This passage, up to

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni spyod pa'i mtshan nyid so sor dbye ba ste /🔽mu stegs can thar pa @256a * //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni spyod pa'i mtshan nyid so sor dbye ba ste / mu stegs can thar pa @256a * //
translated: , shows the individual analysis of the characteristics of conduct.

original: tshol ba ni yang dag pa'i chos ma yin te /🔽spyod pa khyi lta bus tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa ni khyi'i rkang pa nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: tshol ba ni yang dag pa'i chos ma yin te / spyod pa khyi lta bus tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa ni khyi'i rkang pa nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The tirthikas who seek liberation are not in the true Dharma.🔽The pride of morality and ritual and austerity is like seizing the dog by the legs.

original: rab tu mgrin dgag cas pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde ba la gnas par sems pa nyid khyi'i mgrin pa la rdzib dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rab tu mgrin dgag cas pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas bde ba la gnas par sems pa nyid khyi'i mgrin pa la rdzib dang 'dra'o //
translated: The statement, “they tie their necks” means that the thought of abiding in the bliss of nirvana through morality and ritual is like a dog’s neck being tied.

original: log pa'i brtul zhugs kyis rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba tshol ba ni khyi 'khang pas dga' bar byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: log pa'i brtul zhugs kyis rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba tshol ba ni khyi 'khang pas dga' bar byed pa bzhin no //
translated: Seeking the joy of liberation through perverse conduct is like a dog, who is delighted by copulating.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / gcer bu gnas shing nyam chung rid pa yi //
analyzed: mdo las / gcer bu gnas shing nyam chung rid pa yi //
translated: Naked, dwelling in a state of weakness and emaciation,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: rab tu bkres te kha zas kun tshol zhing //
analyzed: rab tu bkres te kha zas kun tshol zhing //
translated: extremely hungry, seeking all kinds of food,🔽up to

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i dpe ste /
translated: this is the example of the afflicted view of the perishable composite.

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang brtags te skyes pa ni che zhing ring ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang brtags te skyes pa ni che zhing ring ba'o //
translated: The innate and the intellectually created are large and long.

original: dge ba'i rgyu med par 'dzem pa dang / ngo tsha ba med pa ni gcer bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyu med par 'dzem pa dang / ngo tsha ba med pa ni gcer bu lta bu'o //
translated: Lacking the cause of virtue, shamelessness and lack of abashment are like nakedness.

original: ma rig pa dang bcas pas sgrib pa ni gnas pa yang dag pa'i gzhung gi shas chung ba'i phyir rid pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bcas pas sgrib pa ni gnas pa yang dag pa'i gzhung gi shas chung ba'i phyir rid pa'o //
translated: Obscuration due to possessing ignorance is emaciation because the power of correct adherence is weak.

original: phung po lnga la dam du 'dzin pa'i phyir der gnas pa'o ;
analyzed: phung po lnga la dam du 'dzin pa'i phyir der gnas pa'o ;
translated: It is dwelling there because it adheres firmly to the five aggregates.

original: / nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyus bdag tu 'dzin pa skye zhing 'phel bar gyur pas gnas dang gnas su bdag tu lta ba 'phel bar byed pa ni rab tu bkres te zas tshol ba'o //
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyus bdag tu 'dzin pa skye zhing 'phel bar gyur pas gnas dang gnas su bdag tu lta ba 'phel bar byed pa ni rab tu bkres te zas tshol ba'o //
translated: The view of self is nourished and grows in the various stages of life through the cause of the dharmas of the defilements, like a person who is very hungry and seeks food.🔽A sutra says,

original: mdo las / la la ba lang gdong la khab kyi kha //
analyzed: mdo las / la la ba lang gdong la khab kyi kha //
translated: Some have a head like a cow, with a needle for a mouth.

original: zhes pa ni lta ba bsnyems pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni lta ba bsnyems pa'i dpe ste /
translated: This is an example of the inflated view.

original: gzhan gyi lta ba bzang po mi chud mi lom zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lta ba bzang po mi chud mi lom zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means that one does not accept or understand the good views of others.🔽A sutra says,🔽Some are the size of humans, some the size of dogs.

original: mdo las / mi tsam dang ni de bzhin khyi tsam dang // zhes pa 'di ni mthar 'dzin pa bstan te /
analyzed: mdo las / mi tsam dang ni de bzhin khyi tsam dang // zhes pa 'di ni mthar 'dzin pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the extreme views.

original: ji ltar glang gi mgo la rva gnyis yod pa dang 'dra bar lta ba bsnyems pa rnams la 'dzin pa gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar glang gi mgo la rva gnyis yod pa dang 'dra bar lta ba bsnyems pa rnams la 'dzin pa gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: Just as an elephant has two tusks, those with inflated views have two graspings.

original: rtag par 'dzin pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa gnyis te /
translated: They are the grasping of eternalism and the grasping of annihilationism.

original: chad par 'dzin pa ni rgyu dang / 'bras bu thams cad spangs pa'i phyir sdig pa can mi'i sha za ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chad par 'dzin pa ni rgyu dang / 'bras bu thams cad spangs pa'i phyir sdig pa can mi'i sha za ba bzhin no //
translated: The grasping of annihilationism is like the eating of human flesh by a sinner, because it abandons all causes and effects.

original: rtag par 'dzin pa ni sdig pa de tsam du mi che ba'i phyir khyi sha za ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa ni sdig pa de tsam du mi che ba'i phyir khyi sha za ba bzhin no //
translated: Because the view of permanence is not such a great sin, it is like eating dog meat.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / lhug pa'i sgra de bshig cing sgra yang 'byin //
analyzed: mdo las / lhug pa'i sgra de bshig cing sgra yang 'byin //
translated: That loose sound is destroyed and sound is also produced.

original: zhes pa nas /

original: de la khyim gyi nyes pa des brjod 'di //

analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di dag mi bzad rigs kyi bu //

analyzed: zhes pa ni sdug bsngal 'jigs pa chen po dang ldan par bstan pa ste /

analyzed: theg pa chen pos bskyed cing gdon zhes pa'i don to //

original: gcig phyir gcig ces pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas gcig gis gcig sdud cing nyon mongs pa'i gnas na skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang shi ba rgyun mi 'chad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gcig phyir gcig ces pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas gcig gis gcig sdud cing nyon mongs pa'i gnas na skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang shi ba rgyun mi 'chad ces pa'i don to //
translated: One after another means that from beginningless time, one has been attracted to another, and one is born in the abode of afflictions, where aging, sickness, and death are uninterrupted.

original: mi bzad ces pa ni mu stegs can gyi khyim nas byung ba dang khyim na gnas pa gzhan slu bar byed pa mi bzad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi bzad ces pa ni mu stegs can gyi khyim nas byung ba dang khyim na gnas pa gzhan slu bar byed pa mi bzad ces pa'i don to //
translated: Unbearable means that those who have left the house of the tīrthikas and those who remain in the house deceive others.🔽As it says in the sūtra:

original: mdo las / sprul dang gnod sbyin gtum sems dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las / sprul dang gnod sbyin gtum sems dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: “From the nāgas, yakṣas, and cruel minds,🔽up to

original: me med zin kyang rab tu 'jigs //
analyzed: me med zin kyang rab tu 'jigs //
translated: even without fire, it is very frightening.”

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni /
translated: Up to here.

original: sprul ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: sprul ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Nāgas are hatred.

original: gnod sbyin ni las ngan par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin ni las ngan par spyod pa'o //

original: grul bum ni tshul khrims ngan pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: grul bum ni tshul khrims ngan pa la gnas pa'o //

analyzed: wa ni the tshom dang sbyar ro // khyi ni nga rgyal dang sbyar ro //

analyzed: bya rgod ni 'dod cing brkam pa dang sbyar ro //

analyzed: de lta bu'i nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyis gzir zhes pa'i don to //

original: mdo las // de 'dra'i sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig ste //
analyzed: mdo las // de 'dra'i sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig ste //
translated: Such is their suffering.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: de tshe de yi thabs bsams pa //
analyzed: de tshe de yi thabs bsams pa //
translated: At that time, he thinks of a means.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni thugs rjes phan 'dogs pa nyid dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni thugs rjes phan 'dogs pa nyid dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the compassion that benefits.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / byis pa de dag rtse la chags //
analyzed: mdo las / byis pa de dag rtse la chags //
translated: Those childish beings are attached to play.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: dga' bar lhan cig phyir 'thon /
analyzed: dga' bar lhan cig phyir 'thon /

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni /
translated: This is connected with

original: 'di man chad theg pa rnam gsum dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di man chad theg pa rnam gsum dang sbyar te /

analyzed: ri dags dang ra dang glang gi bzhon pas theg pa rnam pa gsum dang sbyar te bstan pa'o //

analyzed: de la yang dang por bzhon ba byin par khas blang ba dang / bzhon pa khyim gyi phyi rol na yod par bstan pa dang / bzhon pa nyid ci dang ci 'dra bar bstan pa'o ;
translated: There, first, accepting the gift of the vehicle, showing that the vehicle is outside the house, and showing what the vehicle itself is like.

original: / bzhon pa nga la yod ces pa ni bzhon pa sbyin par khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: / bzhon pa nga la yod ces pa ni bzhon pa sbyin par khas blangs pa'o //

analyzed: ri dags dang ra dang glang zhes pa ni phyi rol na yod pa dang dngos bstan pa'o //

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i sgo nas byung /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i sgo nas byung /

analyzed: bla na med pa'i gnas khams @258b gsum las 'das pa'i phyir phyi rol na yod ces bstan to //

original: khyed cag gi phyir ngas byas zhes pa ni bzhon pa'i dgos pa bstan te /
analyzed: khyed cag gi phyir ngas byas zhes pa ni bzhon pa'i dgos pa bstan te /
translated: The line I made it for you teaches the purpose of the vehicle.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas dam pa ni 'dus ma byas pa yin mod kyi theg pa nyid 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir byas zhes smras so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas dam pa ni 'dus ma byas pa yin mod kyi theg pa nyid 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir byas zhes smras so //
translated: The sublime state of nirvana is indeed unconditioned, but because the vehicle itself is conditioned, it is said to be made.

original: mdo las / bzhon pa de 'dra yod par shes nas su //
analyzed: mdo las / bzhon pa de 'dra yod par shes nas su //
translated: The sutra says: Knowing that such a vehicle exists,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: and so on, up to🔽liberated from suffering, they sit in emptiness.

analyzed: sdug bsngal dag las thar te stong par 'dug / ces pa'i bar du ni gsung rab la brten nas sdug bsngal las thar bar bstan te /
translated: This teaches liberation from suffering based on the scriptures.

analyzed: de yang bu rnams sdug bsngal gyis nas 'thon pa dang pha bde bar gnas pa ste /

original: 'dis ni bu rnams sdug bsngal gyis nas 'thon pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bu rnams sdug bsngal gyis nas 'thon pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the sons are delivered from suffering.

original: stong par 'dug ces pa ni sgrib pa gsum dang bral ba'i gnas bslab pa med pa'i sa dang po la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: stong par 'dug ces pa ni sgrib pa gsum dang bral ba'i gnas bslab pa med pa'i sa dang po la gnas pa'o //
translated: The line he was sitting in an empty house means that he was dwelling in the first stage, the stage of no learning, free from the three obstructions.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / mi des byis pa 'thon pa mthong nas su //
analyzed: mdo las / mi des byis pa 'thon pa mthong nas su //
translated: That man saw the children delivered🔽.🔽.🔽.🔽.

original: zhes pa nas /🔽pha de bde bar 'dug par rig nas su //
analyzed: zhes pa nas / pha de bde bar 'dug par rig nas su //
translated: and so on, up to:🔽Knowing that his father was well,🔽🔽

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni bu rnams thon nas pha bde bar gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni bu rnams thon nas pha bde bar gnas pa bstan te /
translated: The above passage indicates that the sons have left and the father is living in comfort.🔽

original: dpong sa bzhi mdor zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dpong sa bzhi mdor zhes pa ni /
translated: In the four directions and in the center.🔽

original: bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four noble truths.🔽🔽

analyzed: seng ge'i khri la bzhugs zhes pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i sa la gnas pa ste /
translated: The line seated upon a lion throne means that he is abiding on the ground of fearlessness.

original: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa na sems can thams cad sgrol ba'i thugs dam dang bcas pas sems can 'khor ba'i gnas nas thon pas dgongs pa grub pa'i phyir bde bar bzhugs zhes smras so //
analyzed: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa na sems can thams cad sgrol ba'i thugs dam dang bcas pas sems can 'khor ba'i gnas nas thon pas dgongs pa grub pa'i phyir bde bar bzhugs zhes smras so //
translated: Since all sentient beings were liberated from the abode of cyclic existence by the power of the bodhisattva's former aspiration to liberate all sentient beings, he says, You may rest in happiness, having accomplished your intention.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las / bu rnams dong ste 'di skad smras //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: mdo las / bu rnams dong ste 'di skad smras // zhes pa nas /
translated: The sons went and said this:

original: de dag dus deng stsal du gsol //
analyzed: de dag dus deng stsal du gsol //

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni de yan chad ni drang ba'i don bstan 'di man chad ni nges pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni de yan chad ni drang ba'i don bstan 'di man chad ni nges pa'i don bstan te /
translated: Up to this point, the sutra teaches the provisional meaning. From here on, it teaches the definitive meaning.

analyzed: bdag cag stsol zhes pa ni dbang po smin zhes pa'i don to // mdo las / mi de mdzod kyi mthu ldan pa //
translated: Please give them to us means please ripen our faculties.🔽The sutra says:

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /

original: gang la rin chen shing rta bcas //
analyzed: gang la rin chen shing rta bcas //

analyzed: ces pa'i bar du ni mi de mdzod kyi mthu dang ldan pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi mdzod dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: yul 'khor thams cad kyang mi la byin na yang mi zad pa'i nor dang ldan pa yin na /

analyzed: byis pa rnams la byin pas gang la zad par 'gyur ba ni yon tan gyi chos mang po dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: shing rta zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi chos la bya'o //

analyzed: dril bu dang / g-yer ka dang / gdugs dang / lhab lhub dang / mu tig gi dra ba dang / gser gyi phreng ba dang / gding ba 'jam po la sogs pa'i rgyu ni rnam par dkar ba sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba'i rkyen spyod pa dam pa dang ldan pa 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'i gdan la bzhugs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The driver is the pure livelihood. The bells, the tinkling ornaments, the parasol, the ornaments, the pearl net, the golden garland, the soft cushion, and so on are the pure motivation. The cause is the pure view. The condition is the pure conduct. The meaning of “he sits on the seat of pure livelihood” is this.

analyzed: glang dkar po tshol bzang ba ni /

analyzed: zhes pa nas /

analyzed: drang ba'i don la yang tshigs bcad gsum gyis bstan /

analyzed: de'i 'og ma tshigs bcad gsum gyis ni 'gro ba rnam lnga g-yang za ba'i gnas su sbyar /

analyzed: mdo las / khams gsum nas ning thar zhing //

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /

analyzed: gnas de nyid sangs rgyas kyi yin pa bstan pa'o //

analyzed: mdo las / mkhas pa rnams la dpe mchog 'di //

analyzed: theg pa mchog yin par bstod cing bsngags pa ste /

analyzed: de'i 'og ma gcig gis ni longs spyod dam pa dang ldan pa bstan /

analyzed: de'i 'og ma gnyis kyis ni dga' ba'i mchog yin par bstan to //

analyzed: de la yon tan bzhi ni dam pa khyad par can sgrib pa med pas rnam par dag pa dang / mchog dam pa yin pa dang / bla na med pa dang zla med pa'o //

original: yangs pa'i dngos po phyag gi gnas //
analyzed: yangs pa'i dngos po phyag gi gnas //

original: zhes pa ni 'phags la rnams kyi bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'phags la rnams kyi bsngags pa'o //

analyzed: mdo sde 'di lam dad pa rnams sdug bsngal myong ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the result of the experience of suffering for those who have faith in this Sutra.

original: tshig dang po nyi shu brgyad kyis ni ma dad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu bstan /
analyzed: tshig dang po nyi shu brgyad kyis ni ma dad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu bstan /
translated: The first twenty-eight lines show the result for those who have no faith.

original: de'i 'og ma gnyis kyis ni bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gnyis kyis ni bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: The two lines after that show the summary.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: de la yang tshig nyi shu gnyis kyis ni ngan song rgyud gsum gcig nas gcig tu 'pho ba rnam par smin pa bstan /
analyzed: de la yang tshig nyi shu gnyis kyis ni ngan song rgyud gsum gcig nas gcig tu 'pho ba rnam par smin pa bstan /
translated: Therein, the twenty-two lines show the maturation of the three lineages of the lower realms, passing from one to the other.

original: tshig drug gis ni 'gro ba bzhir rnam par smin pa bstan /
analyzed: tshig drug gis ni 'gro ba bzhir rnam par smin pa bstan /
translated: The six lines show the maturation in the four migrations.

original: de la tshig dang po gcig gis ni sems can dmyal ba myong ba bstan /
analyzed: de la tshig dang po gcig gis ni sems can dmyal ba myong ba bstan /
translated: Therein, the first line shows the experience of the hells.

original: tshig bcus ni byol song gi 'bras bu myong ba bstan /
analyzed: tshig bcus ni byol song gi 'bras bu myong ba bstan /
translated: The ten lines show the experience of the result of the animal realm.

original: de'i 'og ma tshig bcus ni mi'i nang na tha mar skye ba bstan /
analyzed: de'i 'og ma tshig bcus ni mi'i nang na tha mar skye ba bstan /
translated: The ten lines after that show the lowest birth among humans.

original: 'dir yi dags ma smos pa ni yi dags sred pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i phyir 'dir ma smos so //
analyzed: 'dir yi dags ma smos pa ni yi dags sred pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i phyir 'dir ma smos so //
translated: Here, hungry ghosts are not mentioned because hungry ghosts are born by the power of craving.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa drug gis dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa drug gis dbye bar bya ste /
translated: These hells are classified in six ways:

original: de'i ming dang / de'i lus dang / de bsdu ba dang / de'i gnas dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / de'i tshe'i tshad de /
analyzed: de'i ming dang / de'i lus dang / de bsdu ba dang / de'i gnas dang / de'i 'bras bu dang / de'i tshe'i tshad de /
translated: name, body, location, duration of life, result, and collection.🔽The cold hells are eight in number, the hot hells are eight in number, and so on.

original: grang ba brgyad dang tsha ba brgyad la sogs pa gzhan dag las 'byung ba bzhin shes par gyis shig / mdo las /
analyzed: grang ba brgyad dang tsha ba brgyad la sogs pa gzhan dag las 'byung ba bzhin shes par gyis shig / mdo las /
translated: The sutra states:

original: sems can dmyal las nam zhig 'phos na yang //
analyzed: sems can dmyal las nam zhig 'phos na yang //
translated: When will we escape from the hells?

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: And so on, up to:

original: 'di 'dra ba yi mdo sde 'dis spangs pa //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba yi mdo sde 'dis spangs pa //
translated: By this kind of sutra, we will be freed.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni byol song du gyur pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni byol song du gyur pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong bar bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the various sufferings experienced by those who become animals.

original: khyir gyur pa ni rnam par smin pa bcu ste /
analyzed: khyir gyur pa ni rnam par smin pa bcu ste /
translated: Those who become dogs have ten kinds of karmic maturations:

original: skam pa / rid pa /
analyzed: skam pa / rid pa /
translated: They are thin and emaciated.

original: mdog @261b nyams pa /🔽rngos nyen pa /
analyzed: mdog @261b nyams pa / rngos nyen pa /
translated: Their color is poor.🔽They are always hungry.🔽They are always thirsty.

original: gzhan gyis gtse ba /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gtse ba /
translated: They are struck and beaten.

original: shes pa med pa /🔽bkres pa / skom pas nyen pa /
analyzed: shes pa med pa / bkres pa / skom pas nyen pa /
translated: They are ignorant.🔽They are always hungry and thirsty.

original: brdeg pa dang / gzhu ba'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brdeg pa dang / gzhu ba'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: They are struck and beaten.

original: rnga mo'i rnam par smin pa ni khur lci bas mnan pa /
analyzed: rnga mo'i rnam par smin pa ni khur lci bas mnan pa /
translated: The karmic maturation of being a camel is being oppressed by heavy burdens.

original: zas kyis gdungs pa /
analyzed: zas kyis gdungs pa /
translated: You are tormented by food.

original: gzhu brdeg gi gnas su gyur pa /
analyzed: gzhu brdeg gi gnas su gyur pa /
translated: You become a target for beatings.

original: shes pa'i blo med pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i blo med pa'o //
translated: You lack the intelligence of knowledge.

original: war gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa ni rngos 'khongs pa mig zhar ba /
analyzed: war gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa ni rngos 'khongs pa mig zhar ba /
translated: The karmic maturation of being a donkey is being whipped and having your eyes gouged out.

original: brdeg pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //🔽sbrul du gyur pa'i sdug bsngal ni lus ha cang che ba rna ba 'on pa /
analyzed: brdeg pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o // sbrul du gyur pa'i sdug bsngal ni lus ha cang che ba rna ba 'on pa /
translated: You become a target for beatings.

original: shes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa med pa'o //
translated: The suffering of being a snake is having a very large body, being deaf and lacking consciousness.🔽The sutra states:

original: mdo las / nam zhig mi yi lus thob gyur kyang ni //
analyzed: mdo las / nam zhig mi yi lus thob gyur kyang ni //
translated: When I obtain a human body

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /

original: mgon med gyur cing 'jig rten dag na rgyu //
analyzed: mgon med gyur cing 'jig rten dag na rgyu //
translated: ... I will be a protector for the world's unprotected.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di sdong ba'i rnam par smin pas mi zhig tu skyes na yang /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di sdong ba'i rnam par smin pas mi zhig tu skyes na yang /
translated: Up to this point, even if you are born as a human through the karmic maturation of this sutra,

original: ma rabs dbang po ma tshang ba skyon sna tshogs kyis mnar bar skye ste /
analyzed: ma rabs dbang po ma tshang ba skyon sna tshogs kyis mnar bar skye ste /
translated: you will be born as a low-caste person with incomplete faculties, tormented by various faults.

original: lus kyi skyon ni dbang po rtul ba /
analyzed: lus kyi skyon ni dbang po rtul ba /
translated: The faults of the body are dull faculties,

original: ha cang thung ba /
analyzed: ha cang thung ba /
translated: being very short,

original: mtshan du mi sdug pa /🔽zha bor gyur pa /
analyzed: mtshan du mi sdug pa / zha bor gyur pa /
translated: having an ugly sex organ,🔽being crippled,

original: grum por gyur pa /
analyzed: grum por gyur pa /
translated: being lame,🔽and so on.

original: long ba 'on pa sgur por gyur pa /
analyzed: long ba 'on pa sgur por gyur pa /
translated: They are blind, deaf, and hunchbacked.

original: tshig smras pa mis yid mi ches par gyur pa /
analyzed: tshig smras pa mis yid mi ches par gyur pa /
translated: People do not believe what they say.

original: kha nas rul ba'i dri mnam pa 'dre gdon gyis gtse ba /
analyzed: kha nas rul ba'i dri mnam pa 'dre gdon gyis gtse ba /
translated: Their mouths emit a foul stench, and they are tormented by ghosts and spirits.

original: dbul ba / dman pa /
analyzed: dbul ba / dman pa /
translated: They are poor and lowly.

original: gzhan gyis bkol ba /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkol ba /
translated: They are enslaved by others.

original: nad mang ba /
analyzed: nad mang ba /
translated: They have many illnesses.

original: reg par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: reg par gyur pa ste /
translated: They are repulsive.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid dang / gsum gyi sgo nas sdig pa byas pa'i rnam par smin pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid dang / gsum gyi sgo nas sdig pa byas pa'i rnam par smin pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: These are the ripened results of misdeeds committed by body, speech, and mind.🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo las ; de na gang la de yis nyer bsnyen kyang //
analyzed: mdo las ; de na gang la de yis nyer bsnyen kyang //
translated: There, even if they rely on others,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: they are not protected.

original: byin na yang ni myur du mi za ste //
analyzed: byin na yang ni myur du mi za ste //
translated: Even if they are given food, they do not eat it quickly.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di la ma dad pa'i phyir gzhan la brten kyang des skyabs mi byed ces pa'i don to //🔽mdo las / de dag 'di 'dra sdig gi 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di la ma dad pa'i phyir gzhan la brten kyang des skyabs mi byed ces pa'i don to // mdo las / de dag 'di 'dra sdig gi 'bras bu ni //
translated: This means that because they have no faith in this sutra, even if they rely on others, they are not protected.🔽The sutra says:

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: The results of their misdeeds are like this.

original: nam yang de yi nad rnams mthar mi sos //
analyzed: nam yang de yi nad rnams mthar mi sos //
translated: Their illnesses never end.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di la skur pa btab pas bsod nams chung bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di la skur pa btab pas bsod nams chung bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, it shows that by disparaging this Sutra, one has little merit.🔽The Sutra says:

original: mdo las / gzhan gyi rkun po byas par gyur pa yang //
analyzed: mdo las / gzhan gyi rkun po byas par gyur pa yang //
translated: Even if one commits theft from others,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: sdig pa'i las can de la 'du shes 'bab //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las can de la 'du shes 'bab //
translated: The perception of that one of evil karma falls.🔽Up to this point, it means that by disparaging this Sutra, the fault suddenly comes.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di la skur pas nyes pa glo bur 'ong zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di la skur pas nyes pa glo bur 'ong zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The Sutra says:

original: mdo las / des kyang 'jig rten mgon po yang mi mthong //
analyzed: mdo las / des kyang 'jig rten mgon po yang mi mthong //
translated: By that, one does not see even the Lord of the World,

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: Up to:

original: de dag sems mi dran zhing 'on par gyur //
analyzed: de dag sems mi dran zhing 'on par gyur //
translated: They do not remember the mind, and become deaf.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di spangs pas nam du yang sangs rgyas mi mthong ba dang / chos mi thos pa dang / dbang po nyams par 'gyur ba la @262a * //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di spangs pas nam du yang sangs rgyas mi mthong ba dang / chos mi thos pa dang / dbang po nyams par 'gyur ba la @262a * //
translated: Up to this point, it means that by rejecting this Sutra, one never sees the Buddha, does not hear the Dharma, and the faculties are impaired.

original: 'di ni dang po gnyis dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po gnyis dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the first two.🔽The Sutra says:

original: mdo las / byang chub 'di 'dra ba 'di spangs pas na //
analyzed: mdo las / byang chub 'di 'dra ba 'di spangs pas na //
translated: By rejecting this kind of enlightenment,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: blun zhing yan lag dag ni tshang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: blun zhing yan lag dag ni tshang mi 'gyur //
translated: The fool does not have complete limbs.

original: zhes pa'i bar du 'dis ni dbang po nyams par bstan to //🔽mdo las / des ni mdo sde 'di spangs sdig gi 'bras //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du 'dis ni dbang po nyams par bstan to // mdo las / des ni mdo sde 'di spangs sdig gi 'bras //
translated: This passage teaches that they will have impaired faculties.🔽The sutra states:

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: The result of their misdeed is that they abandon this sutra.

original: de na de dag rtag tu de gnas 'gyur //
analyzed: de na de dag rtag tu de gnas 'gyur //
translated: They will always dwell there.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni des ngan song bzhi myong bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni des ngan song bzhi myong bar bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches that they will experience the four lower rebirths.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / byol song dang / mi ma rabs su 'gyur ba rim bzhin ci rigs par sbyar ro //🔽mdo las / de dag mi yi lus su gyur na yang //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / byol song dang / mi ma rabs su 'gyur ba rim bzhin ci rigs par sbyar ro // mdo las / de dag mi yi lus su gyur na yang //
translated: They will be born as hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals and humans, as appropriate.🔽The sutra states:

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Even if they become human.

original: de tshe de yi rgyan ni de dag ste //
analyzed: de tshe de yi rgyan ni de dag ste //
translated: Their ornaments are those.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni mi ma rabs su gyur pa rnam par smin pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni mi ma rabs su gyur pa rnam par smin pa bstan te /
translated: This passage teaches that they will have the karmic maturation of becoming a human of low caste.

original: rgyan ngan pas brgyan pa dang / rten ngan pa dang brten pa dang / mi mdzes par gyur pa dang / spyod pa ngan par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rgyan ngan pas brgyan pa dang / rten ngan pa dang brten pa dang / mi mdzes par gyur pa dang / spyod pa ngan par gyur pa ste /
translated: They will be adorned with bad ornaments, have a bad support and supported, be ugly and have bad conduct.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to what will be explained below.

original: mdo las / nad rnams de yi lus la bye ba khrag khrig rma //
analyzed: mdo las / nad rnams de yi lus la bye ba khrag khrig rma //
translated: The sutra says:

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: In his body there are a hundred thousand million wounds.🔽...

original: de ni byol song skye gnas de rtag dga' //
analyzed: de ni byol song skye gnas de rtag dga' //
translated: He is always happy in the animal realm.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dis mi mdzes par gyur ba dang / spyod lam ngan par gyur pa bstan to //🔽mdo las / de ring gal te ngas deng sh'a ri'i bu //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dis mi mdzes par gyur ba dang / spyod lam ngan par gyur pa bstan to // mdo las / de ring gal te ngas deng sh'a ri'i bu //
translated: This teaches the ugliness and bad behavior of those who do not respect the Dharma.🔽The sutra says:

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Today, if I were to say to Shariputra,

original: 'di 'dra'i mdo sde ma bshad cig ces bsgo //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i mdo sde ma bshad cig ces bsgo //
translated: Do not explain such a sutra!

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di la ma dad pa'i rnam par smin ba mdor bsdus te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni mdo sde 'di la ma dad pa'i rnam par smin ba mdor bsdus te bshad pa'o //
translated: This is a brief explanation of the ripening of those who do not have faith in this sutra.
